name: Who Wants To Be a Celestial Heir
description:
From the company's website:

"Climbing to the Celestial Kingdom is as fun as one, two, three in this challenging board game. The board folds out into three-dimensional steps with progression marked in circles on each level."

"The goal is for each player to answer enough gospel questions to progress to the top. Three "Helping Hands" are available along the way. Here is an exciting new gospel-oriented adventure for the entire family!"

There are also additional card sets available from the publisher for the Book of Mormon and the New Testament.

name: Razorback Trivia
description:
Trivia Game about all things Razorback (as in University of Arkansas Razorbacks).

Questions range from sports to campus heritage.

name: Comic Card
description:
This is an easy playing card game which is something like Old Maid and Simple Rummy. Players pick cards from each other's hands trying to get matching pairs of comic strip characters and most important, 4 cards in numerical order of their own kind to form a comic strip. Players have to avoid the "bad" cards while picking the ones they need to score points and win the game.

The cards are from four comic strips - Beetle Bailey, Hi and Lois, Popeye, and Blondie.

name: Flashback Movie Edition
description: Flashback -The Movie Edition contains 3200 questions dealing with over fifty (50) of your favorite movies from the 70's, 80's and 90's. Every card is different and contains four questions at increasing levels of difficulty, ranging from a Road Scholar to a Movie Buff, for all walks of life to have fun. No more landing on a block and being asked a question you know nothing about! There are NO DICE used in this game! After hearing your options, you get to choose the movie you want to be asked about based on your expertise.

name: Formel Card
description: Small card game with qualifying and racing rules.

name: Pyramid Power Game
description: The game is played on a 3D plastic pyramid with holes on the faces. Players construct continuous lines (or "Lifelines") of pegs of the same color from the bottom of the pyramid to the top. The line may be on or cross any face of the pyramid; it may even stretch all the way around the whole pyramid. The first player to construct such a "Lifeline" is the winner.

name: Bird Fun
description: This is a mix and match game for Ages 3-9 where you match the bird's head and the name of the bird to a card that it has been punched out of.

name: Trivia Chase
description:
From the publisher:

Trivia Chase - one of the most exciting board games to be introduced in years!

Comes with 6000 fun and factual trivia questions covering: movies & entertainment, television, music, sports, and general trivia. A role of the die moves your pawn around the board. Where your pawn lands determines the category of your trivia question. You then select a card from the appropriate color category. Each card has 5 questions with different point values (beginner = 10, moderate = 20, semi-pro = 30, pro = 40, and trivia genius = 50).

Includes gameboard, score sheets, 1 die, 12 pawns, 5 game card holders, 6000 question and answer, and instructions printed on the inside box top
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Jogo do 25 de Abril: O Mundo das Aventuras do PREC
description:
Commemorates the 30th anniversary of the "Carnation Revolution" of 1974 in Portugal, which overthrew the authoritarian dictatorship in power for more than 40 years.

Mainly a race game along a linear path with a roll and move mechanic, there are also two special event decks and some special rules regarding some spaces.

name: Avery Close Game
description: Players alternate moving all of their pieces each turn, moving them diagonally only, but as far as they like, in an attempt to get them to the other side of the board, placing each numbered piece in its like numbered spot, with no jumping or captures allowed.

name: In Vino Veritas
description: Everything you ever wanted to know on the wines of France without ever having the time to taste everything... In more than 1000 questions, make your own tasty "Tour de France" and be the first one to make it back to Paris with a full cellar!

name: Versailles
description: You are a courtesan in the court of the King of France. The game is rhythmed by ceremonies, where the other players try to trap you or make you look like a fool. You must also answer questions about history. You gain the favor of the king by winning Suns. You can also lose them during the game. The player with the most Suns at the end of the game wins!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Wild Seed Game
description:
This Ampersand Press game is an innovative nature game for children.
It requires no reading.
There are four different games that can be played at multiple levels.
Wild Seed teaches children about life cycles and gives them an awareness of the environmental conditions needed to stimulate plants.
The game stimulates interaction and discussion with a beautifully illustrated game board and action cards. There are color spots to designate movement around the game board, and a storybook that can be read to the child to introduce plant science.
Also included are additional learning activities. This game will intrigue your children and they will learn a great deal.
They can play in small groups with adults and have a great time with follow-up activities.
They learn why some seeds grow and others don’t.

It is an excellent and socially responsible game in terms of its theme and in the way it helps children to learn about nature.

Game Description:
Play the Wild Seed Game for fun, fast-paced action, and strategy! Learn about wild seeds and what helps them grow. Find out why some seeds make it and others don't.
Pick a card and move your playing piece ahead or back and be the first to move your seeds through the seasons to home.

Contents:
96 Action Cards
Game Board
12 Playing Pieces
Rules for playing 4 Games with multiple levels of strategy
Wild Seed Story
Parent and Teacher discussion topics

Dr. Toy Award 2003
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Farming, Memory
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: I.N.I.T.I.A.L Response
description: Players select a category, then repeatedly spin two spinners to determine 20 pairs of letters. Players then fill in the provided score sheets with as many names as possible that match the category and initials. When everyone's through, each guess is scored based on how close the name matches both the initials and the category and whether anyone else used that name. Bonuses are awarded for answers in shaded scoresheet rows and for getting 20 acceptable answers. Highest score wins!

name: Das Bierquartett
description: 32 German brewers present their wares, with information in 5 categories, including alcohol content, year the brewery was founded, etc. The game is played according to the standard Quartett rules – each player plays out a card and each card’s entry in a particular category is compared – highest number wins (except for founding year, which is in reverse).

name: Deck of Dogs
description:
Endorsed by the American Kennel Club. Seven suits of eight cards each, the suits being Herding, Working, Sporting, Non-Sporting, Toy, Terrier, and Hounds. Each card bears a picture of a different breed.

Two games are provided, one rummy variant and one Uno variant.

name: RAVE Master! Trading Card Game
description:
Based on the mega Japanese hit mange RAVE Master that in Japan has spun off into an anime series and multiple video games as well.

Synopsis of story:
The Continent of Song is in chaos. The sinister secret society known as Demon Card is using the power of Dark Bring to destroy everything in their path. The only things capable of stopping Dark Bring are the Rave stones. Unfortunately, the Rave Stones were scattered around the globe in an explosion 50 years ago, so now they must be collected by the Rave Master in order to stop Dark Bring once and for all.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip

name: Sexual Secrets
description:
From the back of the box:

HIS:
The first time I touched a naked woman I....
On a scale of 1 to 10, I think my buns are...
When I get drunk, the sex gets...

HERS:
The thought of making love to two men at the same time
really makes me...
When I finally lost my virginity, I was...
The excuse I most often use for not making love is...

These are examples of sexual secrets; tasty little tidbits from deep within your very own wealth of intimate personal experiences. Do you dare confess your innermost confidences to other players or make up wild fantasies they might believe?

Includes 36 voting cards, 3 dice (1 red, 1 white, 1 black), 1 male confessions booklet, 1 female confession booklet, 1 scorepad, and original instructions. The back of the box mentions something about "432 sexual secrets", but the instructions do not list any such thing so I am taking it to be a misprint as even the picture on the back does not show anything that is not already present.

name: Period Pieces
description:
This card game was published for the (British) National Trust by Dinosaur Publications.

The game comprises a set of 48 cards, 44 of which depict different furnishings from the Jacobean, Georgian, Victorian and Modern periods. The other 4 are 'House' cards, and they are used as Jokers which can be substituted for any other card.

The object of the game is to collect two sets of 3 or 4 object cards of the same period (e.g. Jacobean) or 3 or 4 object cards of the same type (e.g. lighting). The sets are:

1. Kettles
2. Tables
3. Clocks
4. Chairs
5. Toys
6. Cradles
7. Cabinets
8. Lighting
9. Musical Instruments
10. Irons
11. Vessels

PLAY
Seven cards are dealt to each player, the rest are turned face down to form the draw pile, with the top card being turned face up to start the discard pile. Each player in turn draws the top card from either the draw pile or the discard pile. He then discards a card. As a player collects a set of 3 cards he may, if he wishes, place them face upwards on the table in front of him and score their total. Any player having the fourth card to the set may, in turn, place it in front of himself and score its number. The game ends when one player has disposed of all the cards in his hand.

SCORING
Cards score according to the numbers on them. House cards score 20. All cards still in the hand of a player score against him, and all cards on the table score for the player who has collected them. The first player to score 200 points is the winner.

name: Aber på Rov
description:
The coconuts are ripe, and the monkeys fight over the coconuts. Each player controls two monkeys. Monkeys climb the tree to pick the coconuts, but also to steal coconuts from each other, push each other down, or just to another palm leave. First player to get 5 coconuts into his home wins the game.

Recommended Ages 7 and up
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lucky Luke Rodeo
description: a very rare boardgame..a rodeo tournament involving horse racing, shooting and knife using ability..a must for all the LUCKY LUKE comics fans
categories: Adventure, American West, Comic Book / Strip

name: Stick Puzzle Poker
description: "Stick Puzzles" were a short-lived experiment similar to jigsaw puzzles but composed of two-sided, rectangular cardboard sticks rather than the traditional interlocking pieces. Most of these were simply pictures to assemble, but one was also a game. Stick Puzzle Poker, in addition to being a puzzle where each side shows a different set of ten poker hands, also includes rules for traditional poker and multiple variants including several that make use of the puzzle as part of the game. Although the actual use of the puzzle in the game is minimal (simply defining which parts of the deck should be pulled and used as community cards), the set does allow for a variety of different ways to play: "Hole in the Head," "Low Blow," "High-Low Split Stikeroo," "Twin Sticks," "Flip Stick Rollover," "Stickeroo," "Stackpoli High-Low," "Super High-Low," "Bean-Go Draw," "Stick-O-Dynamite" and "Acupuncture Stud."

name: Battle of the Coral Sea
description:
This 2 player game allows players to take command of the Allied (US, Australian and New Zealand) and Japanese navies and replay the Battle of Coral Sea.

Components:
Game box
130 Cutout Units
11x17 Game map
Rules
1 D10
mechanics: Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Magic Spell
description:
A combination of Concentration and Scrabble, set in a 'magician's school'. For three or four students of the mystical arts.

You're a student starting a new semester at Lunston Lifflammer's Academy of the Magical Arts and Sciences. Like you've done in your previous semesters here, you've made a friendly wager with a few close friends. The first student to finish his or her course load of spells for the semester doesn't have to do any chores next semester. Instead, the other students in the wager will do that student's chores for him or her. Next semester you're slated to muck out the dragon hatchery three times a week. If there's a worse chore at the school, you don't know what it is. This semester, you either win the wager, or your nickname will be, 'Stinky.' Good luck!

Object: Be the first student to complete a full course load of spells (9 credits worth).

You need:

* Letter tiles (Ingredients) (available on the website)
* A Spell Deck (available on the website)
* Beads or coins to keep track of Spirit

http://www.invisible-city.com/play/181/magic-spell
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Slap Happy
description:
From the publisher's web site:

Four oversized, colorful foam mitts are what makes Slap Happy exciting and fun! Roll the jumbo-sized game die and a color comes up. Be the first player to slap the matching color on the vinyl mat to get a hand token. The first player to collect six tokens wins!

name: Der kleine Verkehrsprofi
description: The players gather 'traffic sign-cards' by using their luck and tactical dexterity. By doing this they learn about the most important traffic signs.

name: Bel-party
description:
The board consists of a map of Belgium.
Each player is a tourist from a different country and is visiting Belgium. They all start in Brussels and move to a different city.

In each city they visit, they have to answer a question about the location they're in. If you answer correctly you get a picture of the location or a recipe of a local specialty.

In order to win the game, you have to collect a picture of Brussels, a picture originating from each of the Belgian provinces, a picture of a folkloric manifestation of each of the three different regions and a recipe. If you exit the country at the correct border with all these, you win the game.

The production value of this game is absolutely gorgeous - over 200 full color pictures are included with an additional 500 question cards ! A very good way to get to know the country.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Dwarf Stones
description:
Essentially an ultra-streamlined fantasy wargame cross-bred with an abstract strategy game. Players start with a fort in one corner of the board. They slowly add armies and spread out across the board (on a defined point-to-point network) to take over mines which allow them to produce gems (which must be transported back to the fort to be useful). Gems may be used to spawn extra units or gain combat bonuses. The game includes defensive terrain bonuses, very simple supply line rules, and stacking limits.

Players are eliminated when their fort is taken. Last man standing wins.

The game components are a set of glass beads to represent armies and gems and a roll-up mat with the map printed on it.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Industry / Manufacturing, Wargame

name: Spy's: The Espionage Game
description:
This game is not to be confused with SPI’s Spies.

Each player has two pawns, a tall one and a short pawn. Each player designates one pawn an active agent and the other pawn a decoy agent. To win the game the player must get the active agent to the train station with three or more pieces of information.

The gameboard represents a seedy part of an anonymous city. Designated buildings in this neighborhood contain the information. Players spend their turns skulking around the neighborhood collecting the information. Players may leave bombs in buildings as booby traps for unsuspecting opponents or attack them using guns and knives.
mechanics: Action Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Arrows
description:
Each player starts on the spots in the first two rows on his side. Players alternately move one of their marbles from one spot to the next, either in the direction of the arrow or along the line in any direction. If the move ends on a spot with an opposing marble, the marble is taken and out of the game. A player who can remove all marbles of the opponent wins the game. Luxurious edition with wooden board and marbles of glass and metal.

Released in Essen 2005
publishers: Berliner Spielkarten, Burbank Toys, Leisure Learning, Orda Industries Ltd., ROMBOL, Skye Marketing Corporation

name: Yachting
description:
Be the first to travel around Long Island in a yachting race. An eight-sided compass die determines the direction of travel while a six-sided die determines how many spaces one can go in that direction. If a player cannot move in the direction rolled, the ship is not moved for that turn. A player may also refuse to move when it wouldn't be to their advantage, or move a smaller distance when there aren't enough spaces available.

The six-sided die is numbered 2 through 5, and has a lighthouse where the "1" would go. When the lighthouse is rolled, the direction die is ignored, and the six-sided die is rolled again. This player may move the number of spaces rolled in any direction, and may change direction as often as they please. If the lighthouse is rerolled, it is counted as a 1.

This game, along with others in Channel Craft's Vintage Game Series, comes in a small tin. Movement is made with pegs, which rest in a hole after each move, making it a suitable choice for travel.

name: Was Kann Das Sein
description: Pieces are velcroed to the players' hats and they must determine what piece is on their hat.

name: Rim Memo
description:
Rim Memo, is a memory game with a twist. In this game there are pictures on all of them with that pictures name, and the match is done by being able to rhyme on the two pictures that you turn up.

The player with most pairs at the end is the winner

name: Big Time Wrestling
description:
Players manuever their wrestlers in the ring an each turn can use their action points to simultaneously select a move (from the cards in hand) to try on the opponent. The moves are cross-indexed and appropriate damage is dealt to opponent. The match is over when one wrestler is pinned or both have accumulated 75 or more impairment points.

Promotional copy said "the only board game that comes in a can so strong that you can stand on it without it breaking!"

name: Race-A-Way Championship Auto Race
description:
From Box:
Object of the Game: To Win the race. For 2 players a race can be won after 8 laps have been completed including one stop for gas. For 4 players, the winner will complete 4 laps plus a gas stop.

Components:
1 Game board (race track)
1 spinner (cardboard with numbers 1-6)
4 cars (plastic stands with cardboard cars)
4 gas cans counters (cardboard. colored to match cars)
16 lap flag counters (cardboard)
Instructions

Ages 6 - 12.

name: Cyclone-opoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Gym Shoe, Graduation Cap, Alarm Clock, #2 Pencil, Bicycle

Board Spaces:
Union Drive, Cy, Reiman Gardens, Memorial Union, Hilton Coliseum

Cards:
Vieshea! All tokens advance to Veishea. If owned, all players split the rent.

You stepped on the Zodiac and failed your final! Academic Probation! Go Home!

It's midnight! Advance to the Campanile with the token of your choice.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: AberdeenOpoly
description:
ABERDEENOPOLY is concerned with business trade in Aberdeen. The object of the game is to accumulate as much wealth as possible through the purchase, trade and development of businesses - the businesses themselves representing actual firms on the Island or town.

It has the following features:

- Businesses to buy, trade and sell.
- A £500 ‘Loan Card’ for each player, ‘Get Out of Jail’ in another game.
- The ability (once you own all the key businesses in a color group) to expand by building shops and superstores. Though you wouldn’t guess that from the counters!
- ??? - a place where you get sent when you have failed to pay your bills - though you are able to visit if you happen to pass by.
- The ??? Square, where you gain £200 by passing through. Not in the usual position of one of the corner squares, but two squares after the Start.
- 21"Good News/ Bad News" and 21"Strke It Rich" cards.
- Mortgages
- ??? Sponsored Free Parking.

- ... and many more.

Box Description : Watercolor of Aberdeen Docks
Board Description : Aberdeen FC football ground
Year of Manufacture : 1998
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Zoo Mania
description: Try to get rid of your cards and trap your opponents with as many cards as possible.

name: Hallmark Celebrations!
description: This is a trivia game that challenges your ability to remember the special occasions that other players share with you. You'll also be quizzed in birthday and holiday trivia. Answering questions correctly scores points. The player with the most points at the end is the winner.

name: Snail
description: Each player throws the Dice, the highest scorer starts first. The person who starts to play shakes the Dice and moves his marble the number of cups shown on the Dice. The other players do the same in turn. Should one player land on the cup already occupied, that player must go back to the beginning and start again. The winner is the first person to occupy the centre cup by throwing the right number on the Dice. Sould the number be too great, he counts towards the middle and then counts backwards from the middle the extra number of cups.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tim and Tam
description:
A lovely amusing children & family game for 2-8 players. Tim Tomato and Tam Paprika take you to the market to sell fruits and vegetables. Who gets paid most for the fruit and vegetable cards wins!

Players take turns moving around the board collecting fruits and vegetables. Once all the fruit and vegetable cards have been collected, one of the players randomly selects one of the three market value cards. Using the chosen card, the players add up their points. Whoever has the most points wins.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/timtam.htm

name: Dinosaurs and Prehistoric Animals Animal Rummy
description: This game is played with a deck of 32 cards. Each features information on a different prehistoric animal. This information has nothing to do with gameplay, however -- all that really matters is that each card has a number from 1 through 8 in the upper left corner. Players are trying to collect sets of four cards with the same number. Each turn, the current player asks opponents for cards of a given number, Go Fish style. Players are required to hand over requested cards if they have them, but as soon as a request cannot be fulfilled, a new player's turn begins. When all cards have been played in quartets, the player with the most completed sets wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Prehistoric

name: Junkyard Wars
description:
Junkyard Wars is a print and play game available as a downloadable pdf. It consists of several decks of playing cards, counters to represent the players bots and playing mats to keep track of all your resources and upgrades.

[From the Manufacturer]
Junkyard Wars is a tactical game of battle and resources gathering where players take on the role of a robotic factory and the Bots that it manufactures to act as its slaves.
The game consists of players trying to both out maneuver their foes, while at the same time trying to gather the needed resources that are required to both upgrade their Bot slaves and to achieve total victory over their foes. Nothing short of the destruction of the enemy factory will see you winning the game, so play smart and be ruthless in your machine like drive to survive.

name: Jack's a loss
description:
This is a game a lot like the game 'Hera and Zeus' but you use playing cards.
Each player receives 9 cards to start off the top of the draw deck. They are placed in front of themselves in a row, upside down, making sure that there is a gap between the two rows.
During the game, battles take place to see what cards get removed and which don't (higher cards beat the lower cards(except '2' beats 'ace', seeing as nothing else does!)).
You can have up to five rows by nine columns. This creates a reserves system. That creates a bluff mechanic.
The game ends when two jacks, or the jack of hearts is destroyed by the opposing player.

There is also a 1 player version, where there is a default of nine cards placed alternately face up and face down. You do this as well, but yours are all face up. The rules are now the same, except for some other things, that are mentioned in the rules.

name: States And Capitals Challenge
description: Here's a way to master U.S. Geography and have fun too! Players move around a track of flags surrounding a colorful map of the United States. They capture states by correctly identifying state capitals. Ownership of the state can be challenged by answering trivia questions relating to facts, landmarks, and state nicknames. 2-4 players Grades 4-12

name: Slugger
description: This baseball simulation game incorporates math skills as players learn the ins and outs of baseball. Records are kept by players as they compute hits, outs, batting averages, and percentages.

name: Bible Search
description: Bible Search is a game of advance and block whose moves are generated by correctly answering the questions, of which there are 3 categories (Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced) in each of 2 sources, the Old Testament and the New Testament. Correctly answering a question generates 2 choices, a move to advance your pawn 1 space, or a block option which, if successful, allows you to block your opponent(s) progress, or chance missing a turn, advancing 2 spaces or moving back 2 if question incorrectly answered or advancing 1 space or moving back 2 if question incorrectly answered.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Addition and Multiplication Dominoes
description: Eleven games are included in this domino game. It's a great activity for individual drill on addition and multiplication, or it can be used in a small group in a learning center.

name: Babylonia
description:
From the publisher:

A points scoring game of ‘facing capture’, ‘waiting capture’ ‘void captures’ & ‘capture proper’ for 2 to 8 player’s played on an classically designed, yet attractively different, checkered board where war is fought IN every direction & FROM every direction!

A Classic in Waiting, in Tradition, and in Style, Babylonia™ is a social 2 to 8 players points scoring capture game, where the winner is the player with the most point at the end of the game after deductions have been made. In this game the player’s men are called ‘Zealots’.

Taking turns, a move is to lay your Zealot on the board, then totaling your scores, if any, for that turn - and that’s about it really, but don't be misled; from humble beginnings the whole board will soon have you on your toes! So watch out. You have been warned!!!

name: Millennium Mania 2000
description:
Description :
You can win by being the biggest trivia buff in the group or by providing the best bluffs. If you convince the other players that your bogus answer to a question is right, you gain the advantage.

name: The 400
description:
"The 400" Game - "The Aristocrat of Games"
Manufactured by Morris Systems Publishing Company
Copyright 1933

"Know 400 pertinent facts about a subject and you will have laid the foundation to become master of it".

Game comes with:
8 32-page question and answer books,
6 score pads with instructions,
1 spinner.

The question and answer books are in the following topics:

Riddles
Etiquette
World Events
Love and Marriage
American History
Famous Sayings
Foods and Cooking
Spelling (National Spelling Bee Series)

Bears the 1933 National Recovery Act (NRA) Eagle Emblem "We do our part"
on the box front and spinner box.

name: The Life of Christ: A Christian Bible Game
description:
From the box:
"Children and adults will love learning about the life of Jesus Christ through this beautifully illustrated and exciting board game. This inspired board game is framed in the Bible's chronological, geographic and historical context, and features multiple-choice questions about the birth, life, death and resurrection of Jesus Christ."

If players answer a multiple-choice question correctly, they may advance their token one space on the game board. The player to reach the end of the board first wins.

name: Speller Junior
description:
Description from publisher:

A word spelling game.
A beautifully illustrate, multi colored board game, scientifically made to help children learn spellings of 560 carefully selected words which make up a 2/3 of the vocabulary of everyday usage.
Players compete in this exciting game to spell the words correctly and race along the path on the board to score the maximum marks.

An enjoyable and challenging game that would go a long way to test, correct and reinforce the knowledge of spellings of a child. He/she would be able to learn the spelling of 560 selected basic words which are commonly misspelled.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Educational

name: Itsy Bitsy Spider Game
description:
"The exciting game of Itsy Bitsy Spider's adventure!"

Itsy Bitsy Spider Game is a children's game for two to four players Ages 4 and up.

The main board of the game is a spiderweb angled at 45 degrees with a tap (faucet) at the top which, when turned, releases a small blue ball. Playing pieces are small spiders which slot into the board. Movement is determined by a twister-style spinner.

To begin, each player takes one of the spiders and, in turn, spins the spinner. The player may spin up:
- 2,3,4 or 5: the spider moves that number of spaces up the board;
- "switch spiders": the player may change places with another spider higher up on the board; or
- "turn the tap": the player turns the tap at the top of the spiderweb, releasing one of the blue balls.

The objective of the game is to move your spider up the spiderweb to the top. During the game, the tap may be turned, the ball released has a fairly good chance of hitting some of the spider playing pieces and knocking them off the spiderweb. Spiders which are knocked off have to start again at the bottom. The winner is the first player to reach the top.
publishers: Crown & Andrews Ltd., International Playthings, Inc.

name: Smarte Penger
description: The players try to get control in actual Norwegian companies. Most of the shares in the companies are sold in open or sealed auctions.

name: Hexagrams
description: Abstract positional game played on a board tiled with hexagons and equilateral triangles. Each player has two kinds of pieces: "Triads" - Pawn-like pieces which move on the triangles, and "Hexads" - Larger pieces which occupy the hexagons. The object of the game is to capture or immobilize all of your opponent's hexads.

name: Overstag
description:
Sailing game where the players have to sail an Olympic sailing track on a Frisian (province of Holland)lake. The first to sail his ship across the finish line wins the game.
The game contains:
- a gameboard
- six ships
- one starting ship
- one freighter (obstacle)
- 3 buoys
- 22 bonus cards
- 22 penalty cards
- 2 dice

Produced as a promotional game for Sonnema, producer of the famous Frisian bitter, Beerenburg

name: Hudson River Sloops
description: Hudson River Sloops simulates trade along the Hudson River during the early 1800's. The river cargo was transported by the sloops navigating the tricky winds and waters of the Hudson. Cargo was shipped between New York and Albany. There are 10 river ports and 8 commodities. Commodities vary in worth its source distance from Manhattan and market condition.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation

name: Atlantic City Jackpot
description: Atlantic City Jackpot was published as a marketing tie-in with the Resorts International Atlantic City Casino and Hotel. Players take the role of gamblers spending a week in Atlantic City, high rolling their way to a fat life of riches and glamour. Each turn around the board constitutes one day of play time, during which the active player may gamble on craps, blackjack, the slots, and other games of chance. At any point the non-moving players may place side bets in favor of the moving player or the house.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Man at War: The Game of Crisis and Conflict
description:
Man at War is a trivia game where players (or teams) move their pieces through 5 layers of the Pentagon.

Each trivia card has 5 categories of questions:

1. Commanders
2. Troops, Units and Installations
3. Battles and Campaigns
4. Traditions, Uniforms, Decorations and Insignia
5. Weapons Systems

On the outer layer of the Pentagon, players are required to answer 1 question to continue their turn. Each layer that players move towards the center of the Pentagon requires the players to answer an additional question to continue play, until the center of the Pentagon is reached where players are required to answer all 5 questions on a trivia card. If all 5 questions are answered correctly, the player received the rank of General of the Army. If any question is incorrectly answered the player must return to the start of the game and begin again or "gracefully resign" out of the game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Empire Mania: The Hockey Conquest
description:
Each player starts the game with millions of "Empire Mania" dollars; and then proceeds to collect assets by purchasing teams and free agents, collecting bonuses, winning points for the League Standings, and staying clear of the Penalty Box Squares. As well, you can trade Teams and Free Agents - a strategy that can make you a bundle, or cost you a fortune.

Imagine the thrill of buying your favorite teams of the NHL, combined with the excitement of developing your own strategies to win the game. The player who has the greatest financial empire at the end of the game wins!

(This game was an Official Licensed Product of the NHL)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Luck of Life
description: A children's game where you spin a dial to collect wages or other life experiences. Players try to move from the lower class to the middle class to the upper class. Winner is the first to reach a million dollars.

name: Tryline
description:
"Tryline" is a head to head Rugby Union simulation.
It consists of Fast Action Cards, Team Cards, a color coded pitch made up of squares and a blue and red reversible counter that changes color once possession changes.

The FAC's control the Kicking, Passing, Running, Rucks, Mauls, Scrums and Lineouts etc. These are turned over by players depending on the previous FAC command or on the strategic placing of a Team Card.
The Team Cards have 2 functions only one of which can be used when it is played. The first function called the Territory Part uses a move value attached to Kicking, Passing and Running etc. which are implemented when the player has been allowed to on the FAC. The second function is the Action part which can be used to counter play determined by FAC's or indeed by the placing of other Team Cards.

Tries are awarded when the counter lands on the Tryline by means of Running, Passing and Tap Penalties. If Kicks, Mauls and Scrums move the counter onto the Tryline then players turn a FAC to see what the outcome is on the Grounded Ball section.

At an advanced level, once players become used to the basic game, Tryline offers you the opportunity to introduce Substitution Cards and a Yellow Card system.

name: SuDoKu Mania
description:
Sudoku is played on a grid divided into 9 large squares (3x3), with each square made up of 9 cells (3x) for a total of 81 cells.

The objects of Sudoku is to fill in a (9x9) grid in such way that every row, column and (3x3) square contain each number from 1 to 9 once, and only once.

In this game, the rules book show about 150 grids and their solutions.

45 Easy grids
45 Intermediate grids
45 Difficult grids
15 Evil grids

Like you'll see in the game material, you game play with the tiles or by writing directly on the board.

Game material :

1 dry-erase game board
90 number tiles
1 black dry-erase marker
1 red dry-erase marker
1 game rules and grids booklet

This game can be played alone or in group.

name: Goofy's Mad Maze Game
description: For Ages 7 - 12, be the first to find his way through the maze. In addition to the walls of the maze, there are other hazards to avoid and the ability to jump over walls if the spinner lands on 'jump'

name: Fazendo Novela
description: Fazendo Novela (Making Soap Operas) is a game created and used by Globo Network in their workshop for new authors. Players use cards to create characters, plots, scenes and, even, commercials. By the end players vote the winners.

name: Spider and Fly
description:
The square gameboard resting inside the box lid represents a spider's web. The little wooden tops that players spin are the spiders. The numbered holes on the gameboard represent flies the spiders want to capture and eat.

from the box lid:

Each player, in turn, takes the two wooden spinners and spins them one at a time in the center of the "web". For each top which rests in a numbered compartment with the sphere end down, the player scores the amount printed under it. If the spinner rests in a compartment with the peg end down, the player scores double. A game consists of 100 points, and the first player who scores that amount is the winner.

name: COO-COO
description:
COO-COO is a party game published in 1921. Players punch out a hole in the pegboard using a metal "key." A little wad of paper is pushed out, which when unrolled reveals a slip containing some stunt the player must perform. Each pegboard contains 100 stunts.

from the box:

Every COO-COO game contains 100 different stunts. COO-COO is issued in series; every series is entirely different from every other series. The numbers are shown on the end of the boxes.

DIRECTIONS FOR PLAYING

are shown on the front of the game board.

A good variation is to have the player do the stunt called for on his slip, while the others attempt to guess what he is doing.

Sometimes the hostess will select one of her men guests to start the game. When he has done his stunt, he gives the board to any lady he chooses for the next stunt. After playing she hands the board to a man, etc., till all have played.

COO-COO will be even more successful if the hostess announces before the play starts that a prize will be awarded to the lady and another to the man doing his stunt the best.

The judges may declare a tie and require two more stunts played by e»ch of those tied, thus prolonging the fun.
publishers: Herbert Specialty Mfg. Co. of Chicago

name: Low Bidder: a Game of Management Strategy
description:
From the rulebook: "Low Bidder is the business game that was originally developed for the 1964 Engineering Foundation Research Conference, and was initially presented in its session on 'The Strategy of Bidding.'" Players bid on a number of randomly selected construction jobs. The low bidder wins the job and receives his bid, but must then pay labor and material costs for the job. Labor costs are modified by a random card draw.

Though the game is explicitly listed as 2-25 players, it's noted that 3-8 makes the best game.

name: Ai-Nori: Card Game
description: Card game based on the popular Japanese dating show. Use the two decks (a couples deck & an event deck) to build up a matching hand with another player and/or sabotage other players.

name: The Game Of Lose
description: An interesting and humorously packaged alternative take on Monopoly, with players accumulating property and trying to bankrupt their opponents. The big difference is that bankrupt players, though they can no longer win, are not eliminated; they instead go on "Swellfare" and are given rubber checks with which to pay their rents. To win the last solvent player must pass the start/finish line with at least $100. This is hard to accomplish and most games end with everybody losing.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Haunted
description: Haunted is a card-based game of strategy, set in the dark, shadowy world of Edwardian Gothic horror. Through the course of the game you will be confronted by creatures good and bad, while encountering situations and objects that will help or hinder your path to your final destiny. Everyday situations can very easily be the gateway to unspeakable evil – chance discoveries may lead you unwittingly to a nightmarish fate. It is our task to escape these terrible consequences by wit and guile (and maybe a little luck!)

name: Voyage au cœur de Lyon
description:
In this game, players will each have a personal profile indicating which parts of the city of Lyon they must explore in order to win (ie: the sportsman will have to visit stadiums...).

The game is then a classical roll-and-move where depending on the place your pawn is, you will have to answer special questions about the history and the city of Lyon.
When a player has visited all of his 5 destinations, he needs to rush back to place Bellecour (biggest square in Europe), first one there wins.

The game is entirely bilingual, questions are both in French and English.

name: Sudoku for Dummies: The Game
description: Yet another Sudoku game. This one provides "more than 50 puzzles", "3 training puzzles" and 81 number tiles to be played onto the boards. In addition, the company runs the AreYouGame.com site where you can download more puzzles.

name: Rich Little's VCR Charades
description: Rich Little acts out Charades on a video tape and two teams have to guess the charade before the team on the video tape guesses correctly. Teams also act out charades for scoring on their own.

name: The Adventures of Oliver & Toes
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to reach home after going on an adventure through the neighborhood.

This game was created to help finance the ASPCA America's First humane society.

name: Tumbling Clowns Game
description:
From the box:
"This easy game for two to four players is a great way to introduce young children to the fun of basic gameplay. Players take turns spinning the big clown and knocking over members of his troupe of tumbling clowns. The object of this fast-paced game is to knock down more tumbling clowns than the other players. Recommended for ages 4 and up."

The contents feature a game board, 10 hand painted solid wood small clowns, and one large clown with a solid wood base and foam upper body for knocking them over with.

name: Quad-S
description:
Quad-S, the Strategic Starship Skirmish System, is a spaceship combat board game unlike any other on the market by using a “modular” rules system. Each race plays by their own rules and can be used as a stand alone game. This spaceship combat game has a focus on capital ships. Each race book has a set of self contained rules, there is no base book.

Quad S Evolution, the second edition of the game, now comes in one book with all the races inside. Also comes with a CD with all the counters and control sheets included.

name: The VCR Basketball Game
description: Simulates coaching an NBA team through play calling. Includes a videotape with footage from all NBA teams from the mid '80s. Also includes a mini ball and hoop to make your own free throws.

name: Pikes and Muskets
description:
Described as an excellent family game from the National Trust, produced in 1984. Now very scarce.

For 2-4 Players, Ages 5 and up.

name: Fantz
description: A Miniatures game featuring combat between bands of fantasy-archetype based F'antz (ants) warriors. The starter set contains 5 Dwarf F'antz, 5 Elf F'antz, rules and a table cloth. Also available are Barbarian, Barbarian Archers, Dwarf Crossbows, Elf Heavy Archers, Undead, and Undead Ogres, all in F'atz form.

name: Pony Ride
description:
From the box:
Do you like ponies? Experience the country life by playing PONY RIDE. Pony Ride is an educational and fun game where children can learn about a pony barn and a real farm!

In the PONY RIDE game you will... Spin the spinner and follow the hoof prints along the trail through the countryside!

BE THE FIRST PONY HOME TO THE BARN!

Cross a bridge...Jump a jump...Take a shortcut through the apple orchard! Will your pony stop along the trail to eat apples? Will your pony stop to eat grass? OR WILL YOUR PONY BE THE FIRST PONY TO GET HOME TO THE BARN AND WIN THE GAME? This game includes:

The barn box for the ponies The game board with pop-ups The story book about the ponies and farm The rules A spinner And the four pony play pieces: Allie, Pal, Knight and Honey

In the pony ride game, the players ride through the countryside on four friendly ponies:

Honey Pony - is the yellow pony. She is very sweet and loves to be petted. She is gentle and soft. Knight - is the red pony. He is young, playful, and curious Pal - is the black pony. He is smart, strong, and likes to be first. Allie - is the white pony. She loves to run and run and run. She can dance and drink tea!

Remember - you can put your pony's head out of the barn window if you are the first to the barn. The pony can watch. Or put your pony in the green field next to the barn to eat grass!

Players: 1-4 Ages 3 and up Who Wins: The first pony to reach the barn wins. This player must spin a yellow hoof print to enter the barn and win. Note: Reading is not required Instructions tell you how to play different games

name: The Incredible Shrinky Dinks Game
description:
From the creator:
This fun and easy to play game allows you to circle the game board and collect Shrinky Dinks from the six different areas of Shrinky Dinks Land. You will to go into the Shrinky Dinks Maker and shrink to get into Shrinky Dinks Land, collect your five game pieces and then head for the Shrinky Dinks Maker to get big again. When you’re big, it’s time to race for the finish.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Good Humor Game
description: A children's game that teaches matching and counting using something they all love: the Good Humor Ice Cream Truck!! The truck moves around the path dispensing the many treats that the children have learned are there. The winner is the first player to collect four cards with the same flavor.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Get in Gear
description:
From the back of the box:

A Challenging Race to Avoid Pitfalls in the Road and Reach the Finish Line First!

Out of Gas! Flat Tire! Cows on the road!

Players "drive" their cars on the ever-changing road, trying to avoid oil slicks, broken glass, accidents, and more. You decide how far you will drive each turn by how many dice you choose to roll. Green lights mean GO so the more green lights you roll the farther you can travel. But if you roll a red light you can't go anywhere - - - -

As you make your journey you must watch the instruments on your dashboard, too. You may run out of gas, or your engine may overheat.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Schillerstraße: Das Spiel
description:
From Spiele-Offensive:

Convince your fellow players of the advantages of Italian men. Get a case of beer from somewhere, anywhere. Or get everyone together to practice a Canon. A total of 132 bizarre directorial instructions await the players.

When Uncle Fritz tries his hand at being a sports reporter or sister Lucy puts on her famous cucumber facial, everyone can't help but laugh. Using the director's instructions, each player must improvise a short scene that incorporates all of the directions.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Bella Lanella
description: A game about knitting sweaters for shorn sheep: a very simple pattern matching game for young children. Colorful, with lots of variations as the players get older.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Bild im Bild
description:
Bild im Bild is a memory game with an art theme.

Players compete to find the most pairs of tiles, matching details to their paintings. The tricky part- the detail tiles and painting tiles are the same size.

name: Monopoly: Maailman Ihmeet
description: In this version of Monopoly players are travelling around the world and there are different wonders of the world instead of properties.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Gabula u Gabeli
description:
A game based on a theory that the legendary city of Troy was located somewhere near Gabela (small town in Bosnia and Herzegovina). That's why it is called "Gabula u Gabeli" which can be translated as "Trouble in Gabela".
Players take roles of heroes from Greek mythology. The goal of the game is to discover Troy and win Helen's heart.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das Arche-Noah Spiel
description: The Great Flood is coming and players are helping Noah to get the animals into the Ark.

name: Bible Cubes
description:
12 wooden cubes labeled with books of the Bible.
Each of the 66 books of the Bible are represented on 11 of the cubes, while the 12th is labeled with Creation, Ten Commandments, Beatitudes, Church Begins, and two blank sides that represent 'wild cards'.

Players roll the cubes and attempt to identify consecutive books. Two consecutive books score 1 point; three score 2 points; etc. The first and last books of the Old and New Testament are bonus books that score 2 points regardless of matches, and the events on the 12th cube score 5 points if you can match them to the book in which they occur. First player to 40 points wins.

A number of other games could be played with these cubes, but these are the rules as stated.

name: Mickey Mouse Rickety Bridge Game
description:
Walt Disney board game dominated by a central three-dimensional die-cut bridge with four movable pylons.

Players must transport two monkeys of their color to the finishing area on the other side of the river, so three separate journeys must be made as the monkeys cannot be carried together. Players may elect to take the long, safer route around the edge of the board or they may take the shorter route & attempt to cross the bridge.

Gameplay is directed by a spinner, which has 5 divisions (1-4 movement & a broken plank). If the plank is spun, one of the pylons supporting the bridge is removed. Pieces that fall into the river from removal of pylons are placed on a special log square on the longer outer path.

The first player to get both of their monkeys to the finishing area is the winner.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zizzlingers Power Game
description:
Zizzlingers Miniature Collectible Game Pieces - with Power Game.

Zizzlingers are plastic figures that are revealed like those little sponges that expand in water. Part of the fun is putting your pack in the water and seeing who comes out.

Zizzlingers figures each have a symbol on the bottom that is one of five symbols in a kind of extended Rock-Paper-Scissors (each symbol defeats two others, ties its own symbol, and cannot defeat two others). Each figure only has one symbol that is used each time it is used in play.

Zizzlingers come in different licensed properties, some of which are Marvel Heroes, Disney Princesses, and Disney/Pixar characters. Zizzlingers gives you two to three figures in one package for about $5.

Home Page: http://www.zizzle.com/zizzlingers.html
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures

name: Black Gold
description:
The maker Orofun Games of Littleton, CO calls this "The Oil Investment Game of Today." The object of the game is to earn the most money in a preset period of time. This is primarily achieved by income received from producing oil wells. The winner is the first player to collect $20 million dollars, or the one with the most money after time runs out.

The board is divided into 4 areas; Knife River, Apache Run, Big Muddy & Black Basin. Players roll the dice and travel around the board clockwise. As the player moves around the board, they collect oil lease cards and begin drilling for oil.

As play continues, the players collect pay day, which grows based on the amount of producing oil wells. They also can experience wells running dry, leases expiring, and they can purchase insurance. New years begin, they can face windfall profit taxes, receive golden oil drop cards, refinery bonuses, go bankrupt, and they may make deals amongst each other.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Old Macdonald's Farm Game
description:
Be the first to fill Old Macdonald's Farm with animals.

Contents include a spinner, and 4 game boards each with 6 animal puzzle pieces that fit inside them.

The rules are very simple (the game is for ages 3+) and are included in their entirety:
To start the game each player is given an Old Macdonald Farm board. Press out the animal shapes and lay them out on the table in front of you. The youngest player then spins the spinner and takes the corresponding animal the pointer indicates. Play then moves clockwise to the next player in turn. If the spinner selects an animal that the player already has, the player doesn't pick up any animals. The first player to fill their Old Macdonald's farm is the winner.

name: Vintage Wheels
description: Vintage Wheels is a trivia game about automotive history. The game includes a game board, 1000 cards with questions and answers, 6 tokens, a die and instructions. Each player rolls the die on his turn to determine which question an opponent will ask him from a card. A correct answer allows the player to advance his token along a track the number of spaces indicated on the die. If a player answers incorrectly, play passes to the left. The first player to complete a circuit wins.

name: Apina
description: There are funny looking monkeys on the cards and players have to imitate those looks. But you also have to remember other players' imitations. If you fail to remember you're dropped.

name: Truth and Triumph: Challenge Edition
description:
The Truth and Triumph - Challenge Edition provides additional questions which can be used with the base game.

Expands:

Truth and Triumph

name: Orange Barrels
description: Players are highway drivers in the never-ending maze of road construction. The object is to maneuver your car from start to finish before other players, in the process navigating through the obstructions created by various road obstacles, the most plentiful of which are the orange barrels (which other players are constantly placing in your path).

name: Chemplay
description:
Chemplay is a simulation game developed by Esso Chemicals in Europe to teach employees how to handle the "economic and business concepts of the petrochemical industry." The goal of the game is to do business and not be eliminated by going bankrupt in a mechanism very similar to Monopoly. There are two types of roles for the players, either Chemical Companies or Merchant Bankers (with about one third of the players being Merchant Bankers). All players rolls two six sided dice and move their marker along the track that many steps, paying rent to the owner or buying the property if it is not owned.

The Merchant Bankers usually acts as bankers and loan money to the Chemicals Companies, at terms that are up to the players to negotiate, but can own some properties (Pipelines and Transport Companies). The Chemical Companies can own Chemical Plants, of which there are six types, including the special "Steam Crackers" that enhance the other plants, but not Transport Companies and Pipelines.

Any player can take loans from the game's bank, the International Bank, when buying properties or developing a property but only up to 50 % of the needed amount and always at 20 % interest. If any player needs more money or there is a need for money when the player have to pay for the rent of a property, a board meeting requires money or the taxes are due, then that player may negotiate a loan with any of the Merchant Bankers (up to 80 % of the required sum, but at any interest rate and terms the players agree upon).

Apart from properties the game board consists of Board Meetings (when the player might gain or loose money), taxation and income.

When a player cannot pay, not even by selling property to some other player or by taking a loan, then that player becomes bankrupt and a special meeting is held among the creditors. The purpose of this meeting is to strike a deal where each creditor gains as much as possible and at the same time the bankruptcy is prevented. If such an agreement cannot be reached, the player is bankrupt and is eliminated from the game.

name: Penetration
description:
You have different objectives and you can bluff your opponents on what your real objective is... You have both offensive and defensive pieces. Each turn consists of 7 actions by each player where you can split the actions between either offensive or defensive pieces. Dice are for any minor conflict outside of an Objective area between an attacker and a defender piece. Each player will play a conflict card for a major conflict within your objective areas. Be careful as you can only use each card once until you have used your whole deck.

A bit like a sophisticated Stratego in some ways...
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: The Hustings
description:
From the back of the box:

"Welcome to the Hustingshire North Parliamentary Constituency, where your campaign to become its duly elected Member of Parliament is about to commence.

The Hustings is a fast moving and exciting game which follows closely the British electoral process and gives its players the chance to become candidates and experience the thrill and tension of participating in an Parliamentary Election.

Choose your Party, secure your nomination, and get your campaign underway as the race hots up in the pursuit of the votes available in the fourteen Wards of Hustingshire North. On your way, however, beware of the ups and downs and decisions you may have to make, all of which could affect the number of votes you secure.

Once all of the votes have been cast and the postal votes collated, candidates face the nail biting wait for the Returning Officer to open the ballot box, complete the count and declare the result of the Election.

The Hustings is easy to play and yet totally absorbing, great fun and educational at the same time. Above all it will provide hours of fun and excitement for al the family.

Experience the true flavour of the British electoral system and play The Hustings today. It's sure to get your vote!"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Magica
description: Who can collect the most toys? A memory game for 2-4 children of 4 years and older. In the center lies the picture cards face-down in circle. The children use the magic hat cylinder to move along the course. Whoever can guess which toys are hidden under the cards wins a picture card to collect. The player with most pieces at the end of the game wins and is the best Magorius.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Conservation Game
description:
Object of the game is to think about conservation and how we can help in a practical way. The winner is the player obtaining the highest number of points

Going around the game board players pickup counters for good deeds eg picking up litter and recycling glass and paper - and penalties are given for leaving lights or heaters on, leaving bottles around etc

name: Yosemite Sam's Treasure Hunt Game
description:
Simple spin-and-(not always)move game.

Players start with an equal amount of gold coins. Coins are won and lost via directions on gameboard spaces as the 'treasure hunt' progresses. The player with the most coins at the end of the game is the winner.

Plastic generic movers. Thin card press-out money & spinner. Bright, colorful gameboard & box art featuring Sam, Bugs, Fudd and various associated Looney Tunes characters.

This game is very similar to Hey, Hey, Witch Way?!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Taxi
description:
Each player starts the game with one taxi and $500 (borrowed). The idea of the game is to move around the board according to the basic rules of road safety and earn money by picking up cash fares from the various taxi 'ranks'. Once you have sufficient capital you may buy a second taxi and progress to a stage where you have enough money to convert your ordinary taxis into Supercabs.

These Supercabs give you double income from 'ranks' and double income or penalties from radio calls.

The game is won when a player has two Supercabs and is able to complete a circuit of the board, arriving at his 'base' with enough cash to repay all his accumulated debts. The player with the greatest assets wins.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sneak a Peek (The Crossword Game)
description: Sneak A Peek (The Crossword Game) is a game where players interactively solve actual themed crossword puzzles, but with many exciting twists. Each player receives different clues based on the draw of a card and roll of a die. They may answer for points or receive a free sneak a peek letter anywhere on the puzzle board. As the game progresses, the board is filling in, players are amassing (and now know the answers to) many clues, and point values and heart rates are escalating. Add in double, triple, and wild cards, as well as players loaded with sneak a peek letters, and you have an exhilarating race to the final solution of every puzzle.

name: Pantheons
description: Each player in this game controls a Pantheon chosen from a list that includes the Greeks, Norse, Egyptians, Celts, Babylonians and so on, and tries to conquer the world for their respective pantheon. Along the way, players can develop new mystical abilities and recruit interloper factions (such as the forces of Heaven or Hell) to help lead their armies into battle. Pantheon features three kinds of game units (Infantry, Heroes, and Gods), with each Hero and God unit for the respective pantheons having their own names and stats. This game includes one set of game rules, a 17" x 44" four-piece black & white map, 1D10, and over 1000 cut-out counters.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: King
description:
Invented by an ex-Durham shipyard worker, King combines elements of tic, tac, toe with the 'Kings Move' from Chess.

The objective of the game is to move your 3 pieces one by one around a 3x3 grid until you win by getting all 3 in a row.

Initial placement: Take turns placing pieces on the board until all 6 are out, the first piece cannot be placed in the center.

Movement: Take turns moving one piece one square in any direction (except diagonally black-to-black). No taking/jumping allowed.

name: Annette's Secret Passage Game
description:
Parker Brothers game from 1958. Annette, Spin and Marty are on a cruise off the coast of California with Marty's grandmother. One evening as the graceful "Sea Sprite" sails into the Blue Lagoon off the shore of Shell Island they see "Hawk the Pirate" fishing. During the night Marty's grandmother's jewels are stolen. Annette thinks that whoever stole them must have escaped to the Island. They go looking for Hawk the Pirate and the jewels

Game comes with one set of footprint cards and one set of fish cards. 4 colored playing pieces, 4 earrings, 1 boat, 4 boat cards, 4 spinners and a playing board.

Object of the game is to be the first person to reach the FINISH square with one of Hawk's earrings and a boat.

name: Jibi: Who's the Ace Reporter
description:
To file the best scoop with the morning paper: the player who puts together the best story without getting scooped is declared the ace reporter.

Jibi is a family game. This action-adventure game is built around the concept of creating photo stories. The players have to move their pieces around the labyrinthine island of Jibos to collect photos to compile and complete their stories.

In the game, cards representing people and places on the island of Jibos are picked or taken from other players. The object is to collect pairs and sets of photo cards. Special Jibi cards set the pace of the action from start to finish of each game. Although Jibi is a game of strategy, luck also comes into play from time to time – for better or worse!

WHO WILL BE THE ACE REPORTER?

name: Campbell's Soup Game
description:
Licensed by Campbell’s Soup Company, “Campbell’s Soup Game” is a children’s game for ages 3 and up, for 2-4 players. It includes a spinner, alphabet letter tokens (which are round, and the writing on them resembles soup noodles), plus two-sided round discs to serve as Campbell’s Soup Bowls, according to the package.

The label on the container has text in both English and French, and on the bottom label has information for Mattel USA, Mattel France, Mattel Australia and Mattel Canada. The container itself is shaped very much like a soup can. It is unclear if the mechanics or game play of this game differs at all from the 1979 title, “Campbell's Alphabet Scoop & Spell”, which also came in a soup-shaped container, and was produced by Warren Industries.

name: Alien Race in Outer Space
description:
This is one of the games in the Tiny Tins series by Patch Products.

Players take turns rolling two dice. One determines which of six aliens to move, the other determines how far it will move. When an alien lands on or passes through your home system, you can take a matching token (but only once). The winner is the first player to have a token from each of the six aliens.

name: My First Farm
description:
Description from the publisher:

By playing My First Farm, a.k.a. Mein erster Bauernhof, children discover the farm. By way of the differently shaped tiles they can check to see whether the tiles match.

The game is made up of 24 tiles, 12 with a red and 12 with a yellow border. The tiles represent activities on a farm as well as things to be found on a farm. There are two sets of rules: one for one child, one for two children. The two children rule is that all tiles are shuffled and put into the middle of the table picture side down. On the first turn a child draws a tile and sees if its his color. If it is he can place it picture side up on his side of the table. If it is not it must be put back into the middle. On subsequent turns the child draws a tile and this must be his color and match the tile/s already placed. If not the tile is put back. A child can choose any tile in the middle including the tile just discarded by the other player. The first one having his twelve farm tiles in a matching row wins.

name: EuroGame
description:
"A trivia game for people who keep up with the times - A game that knows no borders"

A trivia game about Europe. There are 2 different difficulty levels on the questions and the idea is to get flags of 6 different countries and the get back to the central point of the board from where the players started their journey.

name: Popeye Card game
description:
From the back of the box:

Shiver me timbers! It's all the fun and excitement of the POPEYE arcade game - in a card game! All hands on this deck race to match-up Olive Oyl's sweetheart cards. Play a Popeye card and show-off your matches. But keep an eye out for Brutus. When an opponent plays this card, one of your matches could be stolen. Only a Spinach card can save it! There's the Hag card, too. She'll help players swipe one of your cards if you have the one they want. So fight to the finish - be the first to make the right number of matches and you win!!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: This Is Your Capital: Canberra Game
description:
What is This is Your Capital Game?

This is Your Capital is a fun-filled, race & chase property game, which all the family can join in.

The gameboard is a full color representation of your capital and the players compete with each other to race to targeted destinations on the gameboard. The first player to arrive at the targeted destination will buy that property and recieve a destination card. The first player to purchase 12 destination cards and return home safely, wins the game.

However, there are a couple of catches; firstly, each player receives only a limited amout of This is Your Capital money and in the course of the game, players are required to visit a financial institution to obtain cash, meanwhile giving opponents the opportunity to buy other property's. Secondly, if an opponent lands on you, he or she can buy one of your destination cards, therefore reducing the number of destination cards you own.

So the object of This is Your Capital. is to successfully budget your money, buy 12 property's and return home safely, without running out of money and by out manoeuvreing your opponents.

AVERAGE PLAYING TIME: 40-60 MINUTES

NUMBER OF PLAYERS: OPEN, RECOMMEND 2-6
publishers: E-Systems Publications, Pty, Ltd, Patwell Enterprises

name: Run-It-Out
description: A 1930s/40s cricket card game, with beautiful illustrations and a very simple mechanic. From 1 to 4 players can take part.
publishers: KUM-BAK Sports, Toys, & Games, MFG Co. Ltd

name: ¡Ocho!
description: Combining cards and dice, ¡Ocho! focuses on the number 8 ("ocho") as players alternate rolling dice and dealing cards to gain winning hands that earn them game currency or cards. From the Publisher: "No fancy cards or complicated rules… just dicey, fast-paced fun!"

name: The National Trust Ghost Game
description:
A card game based on the ghosts which haunt National Trust houses and castle (in Britain).

The Object of the game is to match up your National trust Property with its ghost.

Contents: 52 Cards
- 24 showing National trust properties
- 24 showing "illustrations of spine-chilling ghosts
- 4 Knights.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Horror, Memory

name: Remember Domino
description: A variant of dominoes, with nice symbols instead of points, and some different rules.

name: All the Way Down
description:
As the old American Indian legend goes, the world is supported by turtles all the way down. This game has stacks of turtles climbing on top of each other. The stack is owned by the player whose turtle is on top. The game begins with each square holding 3 turtles, and the stacks are arranged checker board style in a 4x4 grid. If player knocks a stack over he loses. The game ends when the players agree that no more stacks can be formed. Whoever owns the most turtles in their stack wins.

Equipment Needed:

4x4 board
24 six-sided dice in each of two colors

name: Stadsspel
description:
A series of Monopoly clones about various Swedish cities. Each game has an identical set of rules and components, except for the game board, which is adapted to the city in question.

As in Monopoly, the game is about moving around a board, buying property, drawing cards and paying rent. The object of the game is to eliminate all other players by forcing them into bankruptcy. The players can also agree upon an alternative victory condition before the game begins; the player who owns at least half of all properties is declared the winner.

The game board is covered with advertising. The properties you buy are actually real Swedish companies who reside in the city the game is about.

The big difference from the original Monopoly is the possibility to buy stock. There are five kinds of stock (coffee, coal, iron, oil and gold) with different odds and payout.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Art Ditto
description:
Art Ditto from Birdcage Press...

In Art Ditto, you will to play memory games with great works of art, as you collect art collecting cards. Playing the game enables you to learn how different artists depict birds, boats, cats, flowers, horses, and more. Players will also learn words in four languages as they have fun with great art.

The game contains 48 memory tiles, 8 art collecting cards, and instructions in English, French, Spanish and German. Ages 4 and up.

name: Vis Magica
description:
From the publisher's website

Rules for Fantasy Wargaming!

Fantasy wargaming system based on the popular Vis Bellica rules for Ancient & Medieval wargaming.

Figures based as chunky elements that correctly represent ground scale. Easy to move round the table and look good.

An average game consists of about 120 figures a side, and takes about 2½-3 hours of play to resolve.

A combat system that doesn’t involve complicated book-keeping or rolling more than two or three dice at a time.

A command structure where figures are grouped as regular ‘brigades’ or irregular ‘contingents’ that report to officers that report to more senior officers.

A command system where officers could, on a parade ground, successfully issue a limited set of orders to the figures under their command, but this ability breaks down rapidly as the 'fog of war' descends during a battle.
Hidden movement possible without the need for a referee.

An army list philosophy that allows you to use any figures from any manufacturer: to use your imagination!

name: Turn On
description:
Turn On is a "game version" of the classic child's game of electricity. Players draw cards, set the timer, then attempt to follow the directions on the card within the allotted time (typically :15, :30, :45 or :60)

The "gimmick" in Turn On is that the instructions on the cards always involve the two players touching the metal bars projecting from the sides of the game, and at some point, each other. As the human body is capable of conducting a slight electric charge, completion of the instructions also completes the circuit and the game board buzzes (there is no sensate feeling - i.e. no one gets shocked) letting players know they have successfully completed the task. The team totaling the highest point total (based on the time allotted for completed cards), is victorious.

A number of blank cards also came with the original version to allow player "variations".

name: Murder at the North Pole!
description:
It was a sad, sad day in Santa City at the North Pole when the body of Jolly JoJo, Chief Elf and toy designer, was discovered by Ebba Sneezer Scrooge, in the main toyshop. Poor Jolly was found standing on one leg in a bucket of hardened cement. He had been blindfolded and duct tape had been wrapped around his mouth. And oddly enough, his arms were straight up in the air…and his hair stood on end!! My goodness, Jolly was quite the sight, he looked like he had quite the fright……and he certainly must have ticked someone off - big time!!

Tell us more……

For decades, Jolly JoJo had been an employee of Claus Enterprises and was in charge of toy design. He began his fabulous career with the creation of "Mr. Zucchini Head" which proved to be incredibly popular with children all over the world. Jolly then went on to invent "Darbie", the first doll ever designed with an hour-glass figure and an "out of this world" wardrobe. After "Darbie" came "G.I. Jose" and an array of other action figures quickly followed. He was there at the infancy of computerized video games and the rest is history. His genius and adaptability to the new venue of entertainment was astonishing….and his most amazing success, the creation of the action packed hand-held computer game series featuring "Volcano Vinnie", won him universal fame…..so, it's no wonder, Santa adored him.

So what Happened?

It was Christmas Eve and Santa had just left for his annual, around-the-world toy distribution trip. As a long time North Pole tradition, all residents of Santa City gathered in the Town Square, waved goodbye to Santa and then headed off to the Candy Cane Cabaret to celebrate another successful season. Everyone was having a grand old time…..when Ebba Sneezer Scrooge, toyshop foreman, noticed that Jolly JoJo was nowhere to be seen. Scrooge decided to hightail it over to the toyshop and lo and behold, there he found Jolly…..who wasn't looking very jolly at all, in fact he was quite dead.

Some guests include Frostbite and Snowflake Snowmanelli (toy inventors), Holly Berry (greenhouse supervisor), Ebba Sneezer Scrooge (toyshop foreman), Don Blitzen (stable keeper), Noel Angelino (JoJo's guardian angel), Bob Humbug (Santa's navigational coordinator), Sweet Wings (sugar plum fairy), Kirby Marlow (Ghost of Christmas Past), Ginger Snap (cookie baker), Capt. Pistachio (nutcracker) and of course, the Clauses.

name: Rara kruiswoordspel
description:
The Rara Kruiswoordspel is a close relative of Scrabble.

The box contains a gameboard and a set of plastic tiles.
Each tile shows one letter of the alphabet. There are also a few joker tiles. The number of tiles showing a letter is related to the frequency of that letter in Dutch text.
The board has a grid of 15 by 19 squares. A square can hold one letter tile. Some squares are black. These are like black squares in a crossword puzzle: you can't put a letter there. Other squares carry the number 10 or 20. Those are bonus squares.

Players have a hand of 10 randomly drawn letter tiles. On their turn they can lay down up to 7 of those on the board. The rules for playing the tiles are the same as in Scrabble. The score is one point per letter in each word created or altered, plus the value of any bonus squares covered.

name: Speck weg
description: Lose weight and make other players gain weight.

name: Butterfly Bingo
description: A butterfly-themed variation of the classic Bingo game. Instead of pulling chits, players use a spinner to determine which of 16 butterfly species is "called". The game teaches children not only the names of 16 butterflies from around the world, but also helps develop matching skills. Variations include standard Bingo (3 counters in a horizontal, vertical or diagonal row), cover-up bingo (fill all 8 butterfly spots plus the free center spot on one's card), and a solitaire version where a child can spin/match on their own.

name: The Bible TCG
description:
With the exception of the Bible itself no ministry tool in the world compares to the Bible Trading Card Game.
