The Bible TCG is a one of a kind, STRATEGIC, interactive card game, devoted exclusively to God's word and provides players a Biblical lesson/experience unlike any other. Throughout the game, players discover the biblical lands, recreate biblical events like the Crucifixion and Resurrection of Christ, the missionary journeys of Paul, the baptism of the Ethiopian treasurer and many, many more.

Every card in the Bible TCG features one or more biblical verses. Players who choose to memorize the verses in their play decks will quickly discover they have a major advantage for victory.

Pick up a Bible TCG deck today; then Pray,Read,Play!

name: Old Macdonald Counting Snap
description:
Actually there are rules for 3 games on the box which contains 48 cards, 4 each of 12 different pictures ranging numerically from 1 tractor to 12 mice.
You can play a simple memory matching game or a game of SNAP, which is basically flipping face down cards over until there are matches.
Ages 3-6 on the box.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Number

name: Macius: Rette die Tiere!
description: King Macius has collected many exotic animals for his zoo. Now they are very hungry. You must help King Macius feed the animals.

name: Down Styphon!
description:
Down Styphon! Is a miniatures game simulating Musket and Pike warfare. The setting of the game is based on one of the stories in the Paratime series by H.Beam Piper. The main character Lord Kalvin, who is a Penn. State Trooper that ends up on a parallel earth where the 'secret' of gunpowder is controlled by a group of Priests who's influence and gunpowder or 'Fireseed' as it's called can be bought and controlled. Kalvin also possesses the knowledge of making 'Fireseed', better guns and the history of warfare.
The rule book is 20 pages with two card stock loose pages that have turn references and combat result tables. This game was designed in 1977 when 25mm was the dominant figure scale (15mm scale had just come into being), but you can easily change the scale for movement and range by dividing the 25mm distances in half or by replacing inches with centimeters. You can use any English Civil war minis for this and the has four pages of line drawings showing how the armies look and what colors to use for each of the different armies.
Scale for 28mm is 1 figure = 20 men. You can change this if you like using 15, 6, or even 2mm (for 1:1 fun) change range and movement distance as you scale down.
Orders are written down with simultaneous movement.
categories: Miniatures, Novel-based, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Justice League of America: The Flash Game
description: Board has playing spaces in the shape of letter "F." Board background features The Flash, Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman and The Martian Manhunter. Comes with insert with built-in spinner and game cards. Spin the spinner and be the first to the finish square.

name: UNO: Stars of the American League
description:
This baseball themed edition of UNO features pictures of American League stars on the cards. The National League version is the same, but with National League stars.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Top 2" -- this one requires the two players with the fewest number of cards in hand when it is played to draw a card into their hands, with the player playing the "Top 2" card exempt.

name: Creepy Creatures: Make-a-Snake
description: Players build onto a snake's head by playing cards in a chain, matching food icons in the snake's body. Game ends when a player can play a matching tail.

name: Hit Parade
description:
A Finnish trivia game about pop music, with 3000 questions of the rock-pop-disco-soul scene of the 1960's to 1980's.

The number of players is not specified so the only limit is practicality; the game lasts until a pre-agreed number of points or rounds played.

This is the Finnish edition, with somewhat localized content of the Finnish music scene, of a Swedish game published around the same time in the eighties by Kärnan as Popgeni. Swedish content translated by Eero Mattila.

name: Crazy Cocktails
description:
[From the game packaging:]

Are you brave enough to play this game?

A crazy mix of Truth or Dare, Fact or Fiction and Sex Trivia, this daring game is definitely for the broadminded. The aim of the game is to collect 10 colored chips as you answer the questions, do the dares and drink the cocktails.

The outcome is a bawdy game that reveals all about the players. Ideal for girls nights in, mixed get togethers and after dinner parties.

All players should be over the legal drinking age and wild cocktail party freaks!
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Stacked
description: The titillating game of strategy and conquest! Includes game board, 60 playing pieces, rule sheet. For 2 or more players.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Wordigy: A World of Words for Family Fun
description: There are 130 cards, each with a letter and a value (values range from 1 to 5; the same letter can have different values on different cards). There are multiple rounds, with the number of cards dealt to each player increasing from 5 to 10 as the game goes along. Players draw and discard in turn until someone can spell a word using all but one of their cards.

name: Sudoku Taisen 6x6: The Great Battle of Sudoku
description:
Taisen, a Japanese word for Great Battle. Now you know ... But are you ready? Are you ready for the Great Battle of Sudoku!

Sudoku Taisen is a true multi-player sudoku game. 6x6 grid with 1,000+ ways to play and you are the puzzle!

In Sudoku Taisen 6x6, it is much more challenging to complete your grid because you are sharing 8 squares (shared squares are called Taisen Square) with your opponent(s). Your opponents can place a number to prevent you from completing your grid. Therefore, you need to stack your opponent's number with your desired number, so you may complete your grid. Your opponents will surely do the same to you. Furthermore, additional challenge, your fate of winning also depends on your dice roll and the Taisen Card you draw.

Contents:
20 Taisen Cards
180 Chips
1 Die
1 Board (two sides)
1 Manual in English

Board is designed for two or four players. It can also be used for one player and three players.

Related to:

Sudoku Taisen 4x4: The Great Battle of Sudoku
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Boar Hunt: The Dark Ages
description:
Boar Hunt:The Dark Ages Game is a game that appears simple at first glance because there are only 9 spots on the board and 8 playing pieces which all remain on the board during the game after they've been placed.

Boar Hunt has two teams of 3 Dark Ages "Hunters" and a "Wild Boar". One player plays the red set and the other plays the white set. The object of the game is to be the first player to capture their "Boar" between 2 of their "Hunters" either going across the board or along the outside circle.

The game is played in 2 phases as in a 9-Mans Morris Game. The players take turns placing their Boars and Hunters on the board and if no one wins in the placement phase, the players take turns moving their pieces to capture their own Boar between their own Hunters while trying to block their opponent from winning.

Though there have been countless games through the centuries which use a small format game board (Mu Torere and TicTacToe to name 2)but Boar Hunt is the first that uses 2 teams trying to achieve different but similar goals.

Boar Hunt:The Dark Ages Game started out as a small game with a leather "Acorn" board with glass playing pieces packaged in an attractive wood box.

The deluxe version features a solid wood game board with nice details and the playing surface is burnt into the wood using the "pyrography" decorating technique. The playing pieces are hand finished castings of the original playing pieces which look like they were carved in the actual Dark Ages. The playing pieces have a nice heft to them and the game is quite attractive when set up.

The size of the board (6"x9"x3/4" - 16cm x 23cm x 2cm)and the sculptural quality of the playing pieces will make this an attractive game to leave set up on your desk, coffee table or bookshelf.

name: Batman
description: Based on the comic book of the 70's, Batman by Hasbro is an exciting crime fighting game where you play the dynamic duo. Gotham's evilest criminals have run amok in the city and it's up to Batman and Robin to capture them and return then to the Bat Cave.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Denys Fisher Toys, Hasbro Industries (Hasbro Bradley)

name: Milwaukee Scene
description:
A Monopolyesque game themed around late seventies Milwaukee, WI USA.

The object of the game is to accumulate wealth by buying and selling significant local entities such as: Pabst, Schlitz, or Miller Breweries; The Mecca; Marquette University; Summerfest; or The Milwaukee Brewers MLB team.

"Have you ever wanted to own the Hyatt Regency, a radio station, the Brewers or Admirals? Now is your chance by playing the Milwaukee Scene!" --John N. Hansen, 1979

Players may become politicians, labor leaders, or publishers, as well as owners of professional sports teams in this game. Connection cards are sought to enable owners to develop properties in order to increase rents, and to do so requires bargaining with other players.

So, why not sit down with a Miller High Life or MGD and make a decision to buy the brewery which produces it? Sorry Laverne and Shirley, Schlitz is no more, and Pabst left town for good...

Inventory:

1 playing board
50 Scene Cards (including two blanks)
25 Ownership Cards (deeds)
3 Debtor Cards
4 Power Group Badges
16 Connection Cards
6 Tokens
2 Dice
1 Card With Colored Circular Markers
5 Deominations/Money

name: The Wombles Games
description:
Two games in one via a double-sided board.

The Wombles 'Underground Overground Game' and the Wombles 'Bananas and Springs Game'.

'Underground Overground' is traversing the board to land on 'newspaper' squares to collect newspapers for Uncle Bulgaria. The first to collect three newspapers and take them to Uncle Bulgaria wins the game.

'Bananas and Springs' is a stretched out version of snakes and ladders.

For those of a certain age in the UK, the Wombles were a ubiquitous group of furry animals on Wimbeldon Common who tidied up the rubbish - well before eco concerns hit the world stage. (Pictures of Madame Cholet are included!)

All together now -

"Underground Overground Wombling free,
The Wombles of Wimbledon Common are we.
Making good use of the things that we find,
Things that the everyday folks leave behind."

So, just "Remember you're a Womble!" and get that board on the table.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Metricat10n
description: Boardgame used to teach the metric system through board interaction and the collection of metric bills. Game play is roll and move and players win by collecting 10 bills from each of 7 sets of metric measures.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: What's The Score?
description:
This set of 144 ChalkTalk Hockey quiz cards is great fun to play alone or with friends or family. It's guaranteed to challenge your knowledge on hockey facts, history and rules of this great game. Includes 72 True and False questions and 72 multiple choice. Can also be used as a booster card set for ChalkTalkHOCKEY Trivia Action Board Game.

A great card game to bring along on those hockey road trips!

name: Hummelchen
description:
Players roll the dice and try to move their bumble bees to the blossoms of the tree shown on the game board.
When a bumble bee reaches a blossom it is safe. If another bumble bee reaches its space it is removed from the game.
Every player has 20 bumble bees and tries to occupy as many blossoms as possible.

name: Snap Election!
description:
This is an electioneering game.

A Snap Election has been called and you are a candidate.
To get elected you need to win the votes of half the electorate. This means canvassing 6 groups of voters on 6 separate policies. It also means outsmarting your opponents, who may be out to win at any cost.
This is politics , remember, the playground of sleaze and the graveyard of principles. We are about to find out what kind of politician you really are!

name: Group Photo
description:
Group Photo is a simple children's card game in which players take turns drawing and discarding cards in an attempt to be the first player to match the picture cards in their hand, including at least two Photo ID cards, to the characters on their Group Photo card. The first player to do so wins the game.

In addition to the regular picture and Photo ID cards which comprise most of the deck, the game contains special purpose cards that function as wild cards ("Camera Shy" and "Say Cheese"), allow a player to skip another player's turn or retrieve one card from the discard pile in exchange for one from their hand ("Redeye"), or cause an opponent to swap their group Photo card for a new one ("Overexposed"). The game also includes rules for scoring multi-round play.

name: Tufty Road Safety Game
description: Based on the kids commercials featuring Tufty the Squirrel from the 60's and 70's , this game attempts to teach the correct way to cross the road. It is really a roll and move game with help/hindrance squares. Several editions of this game exist, from the 1960-s through the 1980's.

name: Zombie Cafe
description:
Zombie Cafe is a game of zombies and brains. You had a nice little delicatessen, but that was before The Change. Overnight, your best customers became zombies, and a zombie's favorite food is brains. Fortunately your meat supplier also turned into a zombie, so getting your standing orders changed from pastrami and corned beef to brains and more brains wasn't difficult.

Zombie Cafe is a game of selling. Players are dealt five Brains from a Brain deck, each brain has a numeric value assigned indicating quality. The first player to sell all of their brains wins! Sounds easy, right? Of course it isn't! During your turn you play modifiers from the Cafe deck on your brains to improve their quality and make them easier to sell, you play modifiers on other player's brains to decrease their quality and make them harder to sell, and general chaos ensues! It's not uncommon for one player to think they have it made and they'll go out on their next turn when suddenly a flurry of cards are played and they now have four more brains to deal with.

The game is fast to play, is good for 2-6 players (you could try eight players, but you'll exhaust the Brain deck pretty quickly), and a game usually lasts 20-30 minutes. One page of rules (double-sided), 52 Brain cards, and 52 Cafe cards. You will need two six-sided dice per player.

Home Page : http://www.sparebrainsgames.com/zombiecafe.html

name: Checkout Game: 4 Square Food-Market Shopping Game
description:
Checkout
The first shopper to spin and match the number in his checkout counter aisle twice, once for each numbered square, checks-out of the store first and wins the game.
Comes with lots of (96) cute little vintage product cards such as Weet-Bix, Marmite, Edmonds Baking Powder, Pedigree Dolls.
Also comes with 4 plastic shopping carts used as playing pieces.
Instructions on lid of box.
publishers: Milton Bradley, Owen A. J Ltd, Somerville Ltd.

name: Jeux de pions pour aujourd'hui
description:
Jeux de pions pour aujourd'hui is a set of laminated cardstock game boards, stickers for placing on pieces (not supplied, but easy to find or improvise), and an activity book containing historical flavor text in French and rules in both French and English, all packaged in a clear plastic pouch. The game boards, sticker sheets and rules included in the set are:

Agon / Queen's Guards
Le canard Marseillais / The Duck from Marseilles
Jeu de la chasse au loup / Wolf Hunt
Jeu des chasseurs / The Hunters
Le jeu du cirque / Circus
Jeu du Congo / Congo
Foot-ball lil-i-put / Lilliputian Soccer
Jeu des grenouilles / Frogs
Jeu des quatrarmes / Quaterarms
Salta / Salta
Le tacticien / The Tactician
Le voyage à Pékin / Trip to Beijing

Ce fichier contient différents types de documents.

Un livret de 42 pages donnant les règles des 12 jeux de pions, en français et en anglais, avec de nombreux diagrammes qui facilitent la compréhension. La première partie du livret situe ces jeux dans leur contexte historique et donne un aperçu du monde des jeux de pions en ce début de XXI siècle : centres de vacances collectives, à l'école, en famille.

Douze tabliers cartonnés correspondant à 12 jeux de pions édités en France, la plupart au début du XX, à la Belle Époque : l'Agon, Le canard Marseillais, Jeu de la chasse au loup, Jeu des chasseurs, Le jeu du cirque, Jeu du Congo, Foot-ball lil-i-put, Jeu des grenouilles, Jeu des quatrarmes, Salta, Le tacticien, Le voyage à Pékin.

Des planches de figurines autocollantes et prédécoupées : dé spécial, pions et cartes.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Book, Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Racing, Sports, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Activité, Ceméa, Jeux et Pratiques Ludiques

name: Gammot
description:
My only variation game, this is a true 4 player Backgammon game, not a team game, but for 4 individual players. Not only is it a great game for those that already know backgammon but it also makes a great conversation piece set up on the coffee table.

There's a couple difference from the original in the set up rules and the throw rules; & there's also a nice little rule of my own thrown in that you might like to play. Recommended Ages 9+

name: Retire-E-Z-Z-Z
description:
"A New Twist to the Popular Card Game Hearts!" boasts the cover. The game is somewhat of a Hearts with a retirement theme, but there are some rule ambiguities that make it unclear. There are 40 cards, 10 each in 4 suits. The black & white artwork on each card depicts various advantages to retirement (more time, relaxation, etc.) The lead player lays down a card. Players must follow suit if possible, but also "always trying to get red of heart cards first". It is not clear if this is a rule or strategic advice.

The person who plays the "highest card in the group" wins, but it is not clear if group refers to cards which followed suit or all cards played. Later, the rules indicate that players could have different numbers of cards in their hand, and that the game ends when one player is out. This seems to indicate that the proper interpretation of the rule that the winner "takes the hand" is that the winner takes the cards from the trick into their hand.

All cards left in players hands are worth face value, except hearts are worth 10 each. The person with the least points - at the end of one hand is the winner.

Neither the rules nor the box specify the player count range.

name: Script
description: Script is the third of the small box games published by Pseudon and is noted with "#3" on the spine, and it is a word game. The game consists of a set of letter tiles each with a number, as in Scrabble. The unique thing about the game is that over the course of the game players must come up with 20 words each beginning with a different letter of the alphabet, and all the words must be different.

name: Busy Busy Builder
description:
From the box:
Busy Busy Builder is a dress-up game for boys and girls who love building things! Be the busiest builder in town by collecting your own matching colored set of tools: screwdriver, hammer, wrench, nut and bolt. Don't work too fast because you might land on a Sore thumb. the first player to collect all of his or her tools and the Tool Belt wins the game.

Contents:
4 Moving bolts
4 Screwdrivers
4 Hammers
4 Wrenches
4 Nuts
4 Bolts
1 Sore thumb
1 Screwdriver spinner arrow
1 Tool Belt
1 Game Board
Instructions

Ages 3+
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Old New Testament
description:
Quiz based card game featuring questions from both the Old and new Testaments.

This game is vol 3 of Ramco's 10 volume set of quiz card games.

Can be combined with other sets for a larger and more diverse game.

Features 52 doubled sized cards containing 3 levels of difficulty (Beginner, Advanced and Master).

name: Sci-ology
description:
From the publisher:

An exhilarating science game that uses memory, thinking, and strategy skills! The goal of this exciting game is to collect the most quartets (groups of four) by using memory and strategy skills. At the same time, this fast-paced game introduces players to the different fields of science while learning fun facts provided on each card (such as, "The giant clam can be 4.5 feet tall and weigh 500 pounds"). Sci-ology is a fascinating game that is a blast for the whole family and will be played over and over again for many years to come. Includes: 48 oversized (4"x6") colorful fun fact-filled cards.

name: Sextillions
description: 36 acrylic pieces include all the shapes of 6 squares joined ("hexominoes"). Each piece has a name. They are sized to be compatible with Poly-5, making it combinable with that set. The 8½" tray and vinyl game mat accommodate four strategic games and hundreds of puzzles. A Games 100 nominee.

name: Zoo
description: Zoo: Card Game. Cards represent various animals with up to 12 traits. Players play melds of cards with the same trait. Players score victory points for having the highest score in a trait. Good Kids Game. Complete rules plus link to card set at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Zoo.html
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Print & Play

name: Fädelmaus
description: The children are excited -- a mouse darts through the nursery and the garden. It has already slipped through seven holes -- who can best thread the mouse's path?

name: Fantasto
description: Feeling, touching, and finding the right colors: who will fetch the right token out of the little pouch? The tokens have to be plugged into the picture board matching both is size and color.

name: Colorloc
description:
From the rule sheet:

Colorloc is a game for 2 players. Each player has 23 pieces. The pieces are of three types: colored, grey or plain. Each player has 16 colored pieces, 6 grey pieces and 1 plain piece. Whites plain piece is solid white. Blacks plain piece is solid black.

The object of the game is to capture your opponents plain (target) piece.

The basic premise of the game is that a colored piece is locked into lines of it's own color and the black lines. Each piece has it's own special rules to follow in addition to this. Grey pieces can move on any line, and the grey 'dot' pieces are particularly powerful..

name: Die Sonnenflieger
description: The sun stands in the center of the board surrounded by the universe. Each player tries to reach the sun in order to obtain eternal life! The goal of the game is to become old and to live out a happy life. Players reach the sun using basic elements like air, fire, and and water, and the more trips made the higher the score.

name: Play Olympic
description:
This is a rather simple dice game, where 2-6 players play up to 17 sport events. It belongs to a series of 4 square cardboard games from Scandecor (Play Racing, Play Olympic, Play Western, Play Pirates).

All events are done with the roll of 1-3 dice and give 7-5-4-3-2-1 points for rank 1-7.

As with all games of the series, the board is illustrated with funny comics and the 6 plastic playing pieces are also made in that funny design.

name: Dough Re Mi
description:
Based on the game show of the same name hosted by Gene Rayburn, which ran on NBC from 1958-60.

The game was played similarly to Name That Tune, but with only the first three notes of a popular song being played, and players then bid on their ability to guess the song correctly. The game cost more than the typical board game for the era due to including a small, eight-note xylophone which players used to begin each song.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Season Harvest
description:
Season Harvest is a resource-gathering game played on a modular board made of cards. There are four card types: summer, fall, winter, and spring. As you play cards to change the seasons in spaces on the board, seeds grow into trees which eventually bear fruit. Your goal is to harvest as much fruit as possible and end the game with the most fruit in your basket.

Although the basic game is competitive, Season Harvest also has several cooperative variants.

http://www.invisible-city.com/play/292/season-harvest
categories: Card Game, Economic, Farming, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: thwart
description: Players start with 5 numbered tokens of their color. They must get rid of these, and acquire 5 new ones not of their color. Every spot on the board has a token/number associated with it. The board is a hexagon linked with 6 paths through the center. The players move counter-clockwise or through the center.

name: Man o' War: Napoleonic Naval Warfare Rules
description:
A very concise rule set for Napoleonic naval warfare using 1/3000 scale ship miniatures. The rules are self described as having "loopholes in them, but if you like your games fast, furious and bloody, these rules should work for you".
There is much definition missing from the rules, and they would appeal to gaming friends who do not mind compromising on complexity, and who are not prone too much to arguing over rules.
Damage is recorded on record cards.

name: B.U.opoly
description: This game is a variant of Monopoly, with cards and property names changed to items of interest for Boston University students, alumni and staff. Although the basic gameplay is the same as Monopoly, the dollar values and card text has changed in B.U.opoly, resulting in different economics than the game upon which it is based.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Flieger greifen an!
description: An old German game, published in the 40s. An easy one with fighters, bombers, recons, Flak and balloons.The attacker has to fight for the railway station and the defender has to defend it.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Wargame, World War II

name: Rally
description:
This is a car racing game with a variable track built out of 24 course tiles. The tiles have different designs and some of them have some special spaces printed on them.

The race starts just with the start tile on the table. Each turn, a player has the option to either add a tile to the course or throw a die to move his car. If a die roll cannot be used totally, the car does not move at all.

When the last tile has been put on the table, the cars must continue the race back to the start tile. The first arriving there, is the winner.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Partyzone: Knave of Hearts
description:
You are about to enter a world of romance and intrigue, of high society and scandal. Many surprises lie ahead...and the party you are about to throw will be remembered and talked about for months to come!

Each Partyzone Game is a complete mystery party in a box. It is a party game for you and your guests. It provides a theme for your party. It is an icebreaker to help get your party started. You don't sit down and play; instead, you and your guests move around and socialize with each other. Just what you would want at any good party!

In the Knave of Hearts Scenario, your guests are given roles as socialites at a fancy party on the French Riviera in 1948. Each guest has a mysterious past and some secrets to protect, and each has one or more missions that involve the other guests at the party. Many of these missions conflict with one another.

This Partyzone game of intrigue and deception for adults includes instructions and party planning booklet, 12 invitations and envelopes, 20 identification badges, decorations, and much more
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Wo sind deine Freunde? Kleiner Rabe
description:
One in a series of "Little Raven" games published by Klee - WHERE ARE YOUR FRIENDS LITTLE RAVEN? is a children's game for 4-12 year olds.

The game comprises 48 tiles representing pictures of the little raven and his friends. They can be put together in sets to form complete pictures in series of 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 tiles - the series to which a tile belongs being indicated by a number shown on the tile.

Players take it in turns to draw two tiles one of which must be drawn from a face down pool on the table and the other either from the pool or from another player (with various rules describing what may or may not be taken).

The aim of the game is to put these pieces together to form as many complete sets of pictures as possible. The player who, once all the pictures have been completed, has used the greatest number of tiles is the winner.

name: Such a Deal!
description: Players are each in charge of a used car dealership. The players roll dice to move around a Monopoly-style board containing dealership spaces, card draw spaces, and other miscellaneous actions. Landing on another player's dealership can force the purchase of a car from that player. The goal of the game is to be the first to sell all the cars off your lot.

name: The Wedding Game
description: The Guests of Honor secretly answer questions about themselves. The teams take turns drawing cards and completing tasks such as hum, draw, mime and fire up their brain power. The first team to make it onto the wedding ring has the chance to answer the guests of honor's bio- questions. The team that answers the most questions correctly...wins.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Reise durch das Mittelalter
description:
A family game with educational background. Part of the German "Was ist was?"-collection including games, puzzles and more. The game is for players ages 8 and up.
Players - using their dice - move around the playing board showing the medieval Germany and its famous places trying to execute their order cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: WCW Slam-A-Rama Wrestling Card Game
description:
From the Box:
"A fast action, easy to learn card game featuring the stars of World Championship Wrestling.

"Object of the game: To win the "World Championship Belt" by being the first player to reach the top of the scoring board."

The game features 12 different wrestlers from Sting to Ric Flair. Each has four cards that work in a paper-scissor-rock dynamic (with a "pin" card beating the other three moves).

name: Slovenija
description:
from publisher:
One can travel in many different ways - afoot, by car, by plane, some - very rare though - even in a space ship. Often enough one is able to travel only in one's thoughts. The family game Slovenija is designed for such travelers. We travel "by dice". The game is not complicated, quite similar to the popular "Sorry", which is familiar to all of you. You only have to consider some additional rules. First of all you use traveling cards that determine your pathway. How quickly you move along this given pathway depends on your score. Rules on the cards additionally influence you mobility.

name: Pooh's Balloons
description: Help Winnie the Pooh and his friends catch all of the balloons that are flying about the 100-Acre Wood. A fun, color matching game for pre-school children. For ages 3-6.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Archworld
description:
The games system of Archworld is designed with several purposes in mind:

1) To explain in terms of wargaming the capabilities of the armies and the peoples of the Archworld campaign setting

2) To provide a simple yet realistic set of rules that will cover ancient, medieval, and early gunnery periods.

One of the reasons behind the genesis of the Archworld rules has been an attempt to respond to the needs and complaints of many wargamers who feel that most of the ancient warfare rules now available are far too complex. Too many of these game systems require an excessive amount of log keeping and the use of overly long sets of tables. A need for referees and a lot of pencil pushing detracts from the enjoyment of the game.

The other problem with many fantasy rules is that they bear little relation to the literary fantasy tradition. These games tend to rely upon vast numbers of omnipotent beings and spell-casting wizards rather than the strategic capabilities of a kingdom's legions of ordinary soldiers.

Archworld is intended to provide a reasonable and easy-to-understand accounting of the uses of weapons and armor of the period, and the strategy of empire making and the like. The gamer who is not interested in the re-fighting of Archworld battles may simply disregard the fantasy elements and still use these rules to create realistic battle situations for any period up to the late 1600s.

Bases and Scale:

Scales is given in terms of paces, with one real inch equaling ten paces, one scale pace equals 2 1/2 feet (or 1 mm. equals 1 foot). All movement and the proper sizes of bases can be worked our from this scale. As a rule, one figure equals twenty men, except in the case of personality figures, which obviously are one to one.

Archworld also contains a complete set of rules for naval combat.

Archworld also includes a 4 panel paper foldout map of Archworld, 3 single sided sheets of cardboard ship cutouts (these are not counters-the cut outs of the ships are much larger and are used for naval miniatures combat), and 2 single sided cardstock sheets of reference charts.
categories: Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Nautical, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Bon Voyage
description:
A game from the "Traveller-Serie".

The box contains a board, 4 figurines, 2 dice and 120 DM. The aim of the game is to earn the most money during your journey on the board.

As usual with this type of games, it is all about luck with the dice rolls.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Autorennen
description:
A simple roll and move racing game containing 4 plastic cars, a board, 2 dice, rules and the board.

Using one die, it is player's decision to double or triple the result.
Even numbers allowed to start, odd numbers are a misfiring motor and you try again next round.
If the result is >12, you may use the points, but you have to intermit(???) next round.
Starting from a red field, you can only use the basic result of your roll. Only two players are allowed on one field, a third one has to stop one field behind. Passing the finishing line, the player receives a marker (not included - coins or matches are recommended!).
you play a agreed number of rounds.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Käseparty
description: (from the box) The aim of the game: Mice of different colors are hiding in a big Swiss cheese. Who will be the first to get two mice of the right color to peep through the two holes in the small cheese slice.

name: Monday Morning Quarterback
description: A standard football game where the offense and defense secretly pick their plays. Several decks of cards determine the result of the play based on the plays selected.

name: Modular Maze Game
description:
The primary equipment for this game consists of four plastic trays which fit together in pairs, 252 plastic walls which fit between pillars in the trays, and two marbles.

Each player takes two trays and constructs a maze in one using the walls - some walls have large holes which the marbles can pass through, some have small holes which block them. The second tray snaps onto the first to hold the walls in place. The players swap mazes and compete to be the first to get a marble through theirs.

The game also comes with clamps which hold sets of trays together to make multi-level mazes - you can make a two-level maze with a single set.

name: Roars of Laughter
description:
It's a set of ninety cards in two categories: questions and answers. From the box, it's a "merry question and answer card game for merry parties".

The questions begin with "What would you do if...". The answers are along the lines of "I would soak it in milk".

name: Dinozoo
description: Your rocket ship is a time machine made by Professor Smarty, the world's greatest scientist. He wants you to journey back to the age of dinosaurs to catch the best ones for his new zoo - the DinoZoo. If you do, he will make you Head DinoZookeeper. You get points by catching dinosaurs and getting bonus chips. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Sandmann, lieber Sandmann
description:
This is a very simple roll-and-move game from the former East Germany (DDR) -- the game is pictured in the Taschen Icons Book _DDR_Design_. From the appearance in the book, it's a bedtime game for children -- players roll the die and move their piece, and follow the directions when they land on certain spaces -- e.g. move forward, wait for two turns, etc.

John Blund is known in Scandinavian as a mythological little man who calms the children and helps them to sleep.

The goal of the game is to reach the finish point first. Just roll the die and move. If you end up on a "action"-field just follow the simple instructions.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Plasticart, SPIKA GmbH, VEB Roh- und Feinkartonagen Leipzig

name: Wer kennt seine Sachsen?
description: Simple question-and-answer game, circling around the country of Saxony in Germany. The players have to answer questions about the culture, architecture, history/politics, trivia and the country of Saxony. The player, who can answer 9 questions right, wins the game.

name: Hot Tomato
description: You win when you make the Hot Tomato jump across the play area and into the scoring tray. Win 8 rounds and you've won the game. Players make the Hot Tomato jump by pressing one of the five keys on their side.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Have U It?
description: Players receive a green card with the sentence "Have U It?" on it and an equal amount of red counters. Each letter has a corresponding number next to it in red. The first player picks a card from the deck and checks to see if the letter and number coincide with his card. If it does, he places the card face-up in front of him If not, he calls out the combination and all players check their cards. The player who needs it takes the card. When someone fills their card, they yell "I have it". All players pay him in red counters the total value according to the numbers of the letters which they are missing.

name: Musical Dominoes
description:
Dominoes with the numbers replaced by musical notes and/or key signatures. The notes and/or key signatures must match to lay a tile.

An early version of Musical Dominoes was published by Theodore Dresser in 1893. C.W. Grimm was credited as the inventor. This set came with 36 dominoes marked with two equal squares in which note value signs ranging from a whole to a sixteenth were printed. The game came with two instruction booklets: "How to Play Musical Dominoes" and "How to Give Musical Domino Parties." The latter booklet explained six game variations.
publishers: Bramhall Woodware Ltd., Theodore Presser Company

name: Monster In The Cabbages
description:
Monster in the Cabbages is a dice game for two to five players. Monster in the Cabbages uses about 8 six-sided dice, a cup, and pencil and paper. A four-player game takes about 25 minutes to play. Monster in the Cabbages is appropriate for ages 10 and older.

Your goal is to harvest as many cabbages as you can. However. there’s a Monster in the cabbage field that needs to be fed. If everyone ignores the Monster, it’ll get so hungry that it’ll eat everyone (Everyone loses the game if this happens.). That means that you have to balance your need to harvest cabbages with the threat of letting the Monster in the Cabbages eat everyone.

On your turn you can Harvest Cabbages or Feed the Monster.

If you choose to Harvest Cabbages, roll two dice and add them to your score (under Cabbages).

If you choose to Feed the Monster remove a die from the Monster Cup, mark a Feeding on your paper, then roll the dice in the Monster Cup (see below for the possible ramifications of this).

If the Monster Cup is between you and the next player at the end of your turn, it gets to take a turn. On the Monster Cup’s turn, add a die to it, then roll the dice in the Monster Cup. When the Monster Cup’s turn is over, move it to your right.

When you roll the Monster Dice: If the Monster Dice total 25 or greater, or if the Monster Dice show three or more identical results (triples or better), the game ends.

If the game ended because the Monster Dice roll was 25 or greater, the Monster in the Cabbages got too hungry and ate all of you (the game wins and all of the players lose).

If the game ended because the Monster Dice rolled triples, cross reference the triples rolled with the following table to determine the winner:

1 or 2: The player with the most cabbages wins. Ties go to the player with the least number of feedings removed.
3 or 4: The player who did the most feedings wins. Ties go to the player with the least cabbages.
5 or 6: Multiply your cabbages by your number of feedings. If your result is the biggest, you win. Ties are shared victories.
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Economic, Educational, Environmental, Farming, Negotiation

name: UNO: My Scene
description:
UNO Fun with girls' favorite My Scene (r) characters.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The Casting Couch.... uh, I mean, Casting Call card -- ????
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: UNO: Barbie California Girl
description:
Based on the Barbie Cali Girl Line of Toys.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Beachcomber" Card - When played the "Beachcomber" card allows a player to instantly discard one card from each color (up to four cards total) to any other player of their choice.

name: Motor Chase Across London
description: This is a roll and move game featuring a car chase through the London streets. A lead car and 4 pursuit cars are represented by small, cast metal, car model playing pieces. Game has a similarity to Scotland Yard but with much more simple rules. An earlier version of this game is called "Bandit Chase across London" and listed elsewhere on BGG.

name: Jambo: The World Game
description:
From the Rules: Object - Your goal is to become a Citizen of the World by moving around the board, answering questions, and completing challenges. The first person to make it around the world wins. -Contents- Game board, 3 sets of cards: Question, Action & Wild, Six playing pieces, 1 Die.

A Trivia game with players moving around a map of the world trying to get to the end first, with some variation such as a group questions that move everyone forward and Action & Wild card options that have you do other things like say "Goodbye" in three different languages or leapfrog over the next player pawn.

Developed with funding from the IBM Global Work/Life Fund and the AT&T Family Resource Program. Jambo was created with the help of Educators for Social Responsibility, Cambridge, Massachusetts.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Air Race
description: Air Race is a game involving the delivery of mail around the world in the shortest time possible. The game is for 2 - 4 players. Each player uses destination cards in order to determine where one needs to deliver the mail to. Finishing ones deliveries in the shortest amount of time is the goal of the game. Rolling the dice is the method of movement. This is a Chad Valley game from the mid 1930's

name: Tackle
description: Tackle is a quiz game for soccer fans. He who knows the correct answers at the right moment does a tackle. The game book contains 1000 questions (and answers) about soccer.

name: Alphabet Game
description:
From the box: Beginning spellers are introduced to letters and word formation by sight and touch.

Players compete to finish words on cards by collecting letters from spaces as they move their pawns around the board.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Börse
description:
This Heyne travel game is played on 3-piece board of 9x16 size. A exchange rate table is also included.

Players travel around the board, change the value of the shares as indicated on the landed spaces, buy and sell shares and try to have the most money at the end.

The bank starts with a limited amount of money - depending of the number of players - and the game ends, when the bank has no money left.

name: Bob's Bouwplaats
description: The game consists of a 80*80cm. carpet. It is based upon the Bob the Builder character from the cartoon series. The game is dice controlled and aimed at a target group from 3 years old.

name: BrainCheck Two
description:
BrainCheck Two is an alignment and configuration game. It is a variation of the various Morris games. It uses a board similar to Twelve Men’s Morris, but the board is color coded so that the red lines cannot be used to create a line of three. The game only uses ten men on a side.

The game starts with a placement phase, then a movement phase. Forming a line of three in either allows a player to remove on of his opponent’s men. A player reduced to two men loses. There are a number of other rules about movement and removal of men.

name: Cetacean Ascension Moonbase 8
description:
From the publisher:

It’s the year 3535. You’re a hyperevolved intelligent whale. You and your cohorts have been selected out of hundreds of petitioners for a rare opportunity: Sufficient psychic energy has accumulated for one of you to Transcend, becoming a being of pure thought. To access this energy, your pod’s elders have transported you to Cetacean Ascension Moonbase 8 (CAM 8), a cluster of underground lakes at the polar ice cap of the moon.

To channel the pool of psychic power and successfully Transcend, you must expand your mental faculties by growing. This requires vast amounts of the lunar krill that live in the lakes. Unfortunately, the seed lakes at CAM 8 can not support enough krill for you grow and ascend. You are not capable of performing the excavation required to expand your lake. Fortunately, you have a small group of giant hamsters you’ve genetically engineered to perform specific tasks, such as digging tunnels and harvesting krill.

Will you be the first to sufficiently expand and flood your network of tunnels, thereby harvesting enough krill to grow and successfully ascend?
categories: Environmental, Negotiation, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Territory Building

name: Grand Prix Bicycling
description: This Canadian cycling game is about a race in a city (a criterium). The board measures 64x48cm., there are 18 cyclists, 2 dice, 40 lap winner cards, 40 booster cards and 32 chance cards in the game. The mechanism is not difficult. The criterium goes over a number of laps that is agreed between the players (this determines the length of the game). One the map there is a track that gives the players multiple choice to determine the circuit. A number of spaces on the track are colored yellow and blue. When a cyclist is on a yellow space he receives a power card (also when he finishes a lap and starts a new lap), on the blue spaces a player has to draw a chance card. It is also possible that a cyclists takes a wrong route (this can happen with a chance card). There are also spaces that contain a text (for example 'flat tyre'). Winner is the player who's cyclist covers first the total distance of the criterium. With the dice and the card drawing this Canadian game has a high luck factor but the cyclist lover will certainly enjoy it.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Anagramania Junior Edition
description:
Junior Edition of Anagramania, designed for players ages 8 to 13.

Players solve anagram based clues as they move around the board.

Offers 2 levels of play:

Basic: offering fewer choices in tactics.
Word 'n Spoke: Has more tactical play and gives players less skilled in solving the anagrams a better chance to win.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: On Our Way: Steps to Perfection
description: A game designed to acquaint individuals with some of the requirements of several gospel steps in the LDS church. Players roll dice to fill each requirement and chits are used on each players game sheet to mark the filled requirements. First player to fill all requirements on the game sheet wins.

name: Race the Moon
description:
The object of this game is to plant the tulip garden before the moon is full. Each turn the player rolls the dice and can plant a tulip of the color rolled. If the moon is rolled, the player must add a moon piece to the central moon puzzle. If the moon is complete before any gardens are planted then the moon wins.

The game has a co-operative aspect in that if a player rolls a tulip color that they already have in their garden then they may donate the tulip to a different player. No player may have two tulips of the same color in their garden.

The game is crafted from wooden components.

name: The Berenstain Bears Spooky Old Tree Game
description: Take one of 4 bears and guide them through the spooky old tree. Help get them out by using their flashlight, stick, rope and key. First bear out wins.

name: Jona und der große Fisch
description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Jona und der grosse Fisch (Jonah and the Big Fish) is by Uli Geissler and is a game about the story of Jonah. Jonah was given the assignment to travel to Nineveh. There, he is to ensure that the people make up for their mistakes. A difficult assignment for Jonah, who'd love to try and avoid it. In the game, the goal is to bring Jonah to Nineveh with the help of big fish, to save him and to prevent him from fleeing to Tarsis so that God's will can be carried out. All game figures are made of wood.

name: Metropolen
description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Metropolen (Metropolises) is also by Jorg Miethe. Here, the goal is to place the location of various metropolises on a blank map. The closer your X comes to the correct location, the more points you get.

The game was invented during a car ride from Stuttgart to Leipzig. There was a lot of traffic and therefore lots of traffic jams mentioned on the news. The inventor pictured a map of Germany during these announcements and tried to arrange the towns mentioned. From this situation arose the first prototype "Highway Guessing". This very quickly turned into the playable "Metropolen".

The game can be used by school classes as a geography learning game (for example in two groups playing against each other) or as an educational game for traveling groups or other parties. The game was tested in a casual group and was a real conversation starter ("I know where that is, I had the most unbelievable experience there...").

name: Roundabout Five
description:
From the media kit:
In Roundabout Five, players compete as individuals on teams that randomly change their composition and size on every turn (Dynamic Teams). On regular game cards, teams encounter trivia, odd comparisons (Which happened first? The United States attacks Libya or the Culture Club releases Do You Really Want to Hurt Me) , riddles, jokes, math and grammar problems. Second Option cards introduce elements such as debate (Would Daffy or Donald Duck last longer on the cartoon version of Survivor?), charades and personal trivia (Was I born before or after Woodstock?) to the game, creating a whole new level of fun. R5 can be played by 3 or more adult players for a total point objective, select number of turns or within any given time constraint.

Home Page: http://www.roundaboutfive.com

name: Honigbär
description:
There is a lot of lively activity on the large, brightly colored wildflower meadow. The bees in particular are busy collecting honey blossoms. Unfortunately, they are not alone because the honey bear is also very partial to these honey blossoms and for that reason the bees need a little luck with the dice.

Ages 4 and up.

name: Puzzle Struggle
description:
From the game box:

A new way to play crossword puzzles with friends and family! Clues are drawn from a deck and read aloud so everyone participates in each turn. Challenge your opponent and steal the question. Rules include 2 variations - one for novices and one for real crossword buffs.

name: Hierarchy
description:
Described as "the Game of Intrigue, Passion and Treachery", Hierarchy is played on a triangular board with players starting at the bottom right before progressing in a snake towards the top of the "pyramid".

In turns, players roll two dice to determine the colour (subject) and the difficulty of the next question. Get the question right and the player gets another turn.

Questions can be on: Economics & Politics, Initials & Abbreviations, Professions, Advertising, Media & People, and Companies.

Players have the option to challenge other players on the same level as themselves - of which there are five - and the loser goes down a level.

In the box are six stacks of cards containing questions and answers, graded by difficulty, a triangular board that folds into a hexagon, a hexagonal player aid with the subjects and their matching colours printed on it, and a velveteen bag containing 6 tetrahedron playing pieces and two dice - one with coloured spots on it to match the subject colours.

name: Der Kleine Prinz: Zähmt den Fuchs
description:
One in a series of children's games featuring the character "The Little Prince".

In this game the players have to capture or tame the fox, which they do by making their way down a path based on their ability to predict which of four 'locations' the fox will appear.

One player acts as the fox and receives 12 cards comprising three each of four different locations - he shuffles these and places them in a pile face up in front of him.

The other players (up to three) represent the Little Prince and have to make their way down a path formed from 5 route cards. Each of the route cards shows the four locations where the fox might be hiding. The path is connected to a tile on which the fox playing piece is placed. They Prince players each have four tiles representing the four locations.

Each turn they try and predict at which location the fox will appear by laying one of their tiles face up. The fox player then turns over his top card and 'appears'. If any of the other players have a match then they move down the path to the next location on the route showing that location.

Over twelve rounds players progress down the path towards
the fox - the first player (if any) to reach the fox is the winner. If no-one manages to reach the fox then it is the player that progressed the furthest down the path that is the winner.

name: Evolution of the Stars
description:
Evolution der Sterne by CSPP is the first strategic puzzle cardgame, for 2-6 players (more players with more sets of cards). Players are exploring a space galaxy and can either explore, research, build spaceships or battle for control of planets.

It contains: 55 colored cards, 1 Player Aid Card, 1 rules sheet, plastic box.

To play the game, you will need 13 dice per player (not included).
publishers: Computerspiele per Post (CSPP), Udo Grebe Gamedesign

name: Cap Kennedy
description: This building game is about the Cape Kennedy shuttle base. Each player has 25 parts (each in his color) in which he has to create a construction so that the shuttle can be launched. The player who completes the construction first wins the game. In the game, which has very simple mechanics, a die is used to determine if a part may be build. The die has colors on it, matching the 4 color of the players and 2 other color. When a die roll matches a color the part may be build. The game can be played from the young age of 5.

name: Dream Date
description: This precursor to the more famous "Mystery Date" has girls trying to literally attract boys. Players use heart-shaped magnetic pieces to navigate a clear plastic board. Under the board is a revolving cardboard circle representing the Social Circle, which contains magnetic discs of boys with whom the girl may "click" or "repel." If they click, she picks a ring for a date, and tries to avoid "obstacles" along the Valentine Path which will make the boy lose the ring. The winner is the first girl who can go out with a boy and receive the ring. Contains spinner, playing surface and circle turntable, 4 hearts, 4 cars, 4 boys, 4 rings, and 9 star-shaped obstacles.

name: Yakuza War
description: Card game for 2 to 4 players. CCG type Mechanics. Set in 17th Century Japan. Each player controls a Yakuza (organized crime) group. Players are trying to kill off each others Boss. Players recruit Samurai, Ronin, Bushi, Ninja, and others to help them fight. Fight cards determine how many Units can fight in a battle. Battles are resolved by a combination of dice and card play.

name: Ein toller Käfer
description: Based on the Walt Disney movie "The Love Bug" from 1968. Players move around the board with their plastic cars. Movement is controlled by dice. Some parts of the board trigger events based on the movie, which are basically gaming instructions like take another roll or move three steps ahead. First player who reaches the finish line wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Marble Roll
description:
A game of marble rolling skill. Each player propels their marbles toward a scoring target area that is separated into point values from five to 25. The higher point areas are smaller and harder to hit than the low point areas.

The number of players is limited only to the amount of time a player is willing to wait for their turn. It easily scales in the number of players, number of marbles and how far away the scoring target area is placed from the players.

name: Colorante
description:
Both players get a set of ten four-colored pieces (light & dark). Each piece has a different color on each side and can only be moved in that direction towards which the color is facing (to the next field of that color). Opposing pieces are captured in right angular moves. If a piece ends a move on the edge of the board it can be rotated.

The game ends if a player captures 9 opposing pieces (7 in the "Speed Version").

name: Remagen Bridge
description:
Remagen Bridge is a specific miniatures scenario, but it comes with a full set of rules, and so is an independently-playable wargame. The scenario is a tactical one covering the fighting for the eponymous bridge.

Somewhat unusually for a miniatures game, all movement allowances and firing ranges are given in numbers of sectors (squares) rather than inches, making it quite similar to a board wargame.

Remagen Bridge was published in Strategy & Tactics Volume I, Numbers 1-4. In some places it is called "Remagen Bridgehead" but the former name is more often used.

name: Charade Cards
description:
Party game of charades where players are on two different teams, compromising of at least 2 players on each team.
A player takes a charade card and acts out the phrase to have his teammmates guess the movie/book/song/TV Show. Record how long it takes to guess the charade, and at the end of the game, the team that took the least amount of time to make it's guesses wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Dark Dungeon
description:
This is a solo game set in a dungeon, including board tiles, counters and detailed rules for movement, combat and character actions. From the publisher:

Jord watched as the elf peered around the corner into the dark chamber before them. The dwarf warrior did not like the smell that was coming out of the dark room, it reminded him too much like his wife’s cooking. By the Gods the woman could burn toast he thought, hell that was why he was always seeking out these dark dungeons, any excuse to eat something other then her gruel.

The elf signaled the way was not guarded by a trap, and so the dwarf and the small human sorceress took up a position near the entrance while the burly human warrior and the elf entered. As soon as the two stepped into the chamber the whole place lit up with a bright light and the laughter of the necromancer that waited within. Damn Jord cursed as he watched the hoard of skeletons rush him and his companions. Maybe he should have stayed home today and eaten the roast his wife was burning.

This is dark dungeon, the newest Mini-game from Bad Baby Productions. Hire mercenaries and adventurers and then send them out to explore the many dungeons and adventurous locations about the great city of Mordenhelm. See if you can outlast, out fight and outsmart the many monsters, traps and dangers that wait for you in the Dark Dungeons of this city.

Dark Dungeon is a sole game, using a fast, fun system of encounters and adventurous situations. See if you can meet the challenge and return with the glory you deserve.

name: Coccinella Lauseschreck
description:
Players lay their cards in eight garden sections. When "ecological" connections are made, a player receives points. The game ends when a player has emptied his or her hand. Whoever has the most points wins.


Die Spieler legen in den acht Gartenteilen ihre Karten ab. Dabei bemühen sie sich um ökologische Zusammenhänge, denn das bringt Punktgewinne. Das Spiel endet, wenn ein Spieler seine ganzen Karten losgeworden ist. Wer dann die meisten Punkte hat, gewinnt.

name: Tri-Animals
description:
This game is designed so that each player starts with six triangular-shaped cards. Each card, at the tips has a number that must match the card that it is laid down next to, as you strive to empty your hand of cards. For the 'younger set' there are animals, ranging from sharks to ladybugs, and it, of course, includes dinosaurs. This way, for kids too young to know their numbers, they can play using the animals as 'the key' to matching their cards.

Each player takes turn matching one card, if no match is possible they must draw cards from the 'tile card pool,' until there is a match, then play continues to the next player.

The game ends when when one of the players runs out of cards. That person is considered the winner of the game.

name: Games to Grow On
description:
Games to Grow On features two different games from Discovery Toys in one box: a roll-and-move type game similar to Candy Land, and a game where each player wants to be the first to complete their building using various shapes. This game is aimed at player ages 4 and up.

Contents:
1 double-sided game board
1 colored die
1 shape die
4 animal game pieces
18 picture cards
12 color shapes
Instructions

name: Plotto
description:
Plotto is a twist on 4-in-a-row played on a Hex board with four colors of stones. The goal of the game is to place two stones of the same color such that they form the ends of a line of four. The rules require that no two stones of the same color are adjacent. In a two-player game, each player controls two colors.

Online Play

gamerz.net (play by email)

name: Klondike: Trivia Game on the Yukon
description:
Klondike is a trivia game that allows players to re-experience the gold rush by traveling from Seattle to Dawson City. On route players can move on if they obtain courage points and dollars. These are gained by answering questions on the Klondike cards, by picking Event cards, or by playing poker (betting).

The game box and board include historic photos from the National Archives of Canada.

Contents.

Game board
Courage point bills
Paper money
A debt record
Event Cards
A box of Klondike cards
6 Markers
1 Die
A Set of rules.

name: Plopp!
description:
The game consists of 4 suction-cups-on-a-stick (German: poempel), 5 cardboard chits with 5 different faces, 25 cards representing the 5 different faces (5 each), and 13 pieces sponges (wooden blocks).

Each player get a 'poempel', the cards are shuffled and divided among all players. The chits are laid out visibly in the middle of the board and the sponges are set aside.

Using only one hand all players start revealing cards from their stack simultaneously. If two or more players reveal the same face they try to grab their poempel and 'suck-up' the right cardboard chit.
The one to get the chit first, earns one sponge. The game then resumes. If you grab a chit erroneously you have to give back a sponge. The game ends when all sponges are distributed. The player with the most sponges wins.

name: Emergency Ward 10
description: Game based on a hit T.V. series on English television in the 1960's called Emergency Ward 10. One of, if not the first of the television hospital soap type series. The game includes four counters, four vehicles, a spinner and playing instruction leaflet. You move around a circular board beginning on the outside rim and finishing on the inside rim. The spinners move number determines what happens to you on this recreation of the show.

name: Dunce
description:
The Dunce game is similar to Jumbolino, only in reverse. In Jumbolino players roll dice to be the first to construct a figure. In "Dunce," players spin a teetotum that has pictures of the dunce pieces as well as a lucky horseshoe pic. If a player puts together the whole dunce (stool, body, head, and cap - in that order), he/she is eliminated from the game; the winner is the last eliminated. The box also lists Rules for Teenagers and Adults, saying that they can play the old game of "Ghost" by adding letters to a word, with the player who completes the word having to add a part to his toy dunce.

The die has six sides. Two stools, one body, one head, one dunce's cap, and a lucky horseshoe. You have to assemble the body in order. If you get the lucky horseshoe then you skip a turn, but all your opponents have to put on their next body part.

This game is also similar to ScareCrow, which also has players building a figure in order, except that in that game the player who finishes first is the winner.

name: World Safari
description:
World Safari is a combination of 2 educational games on the same game board. It is a geography-based trivia game designed to encourage children to learn about the various sizes, locations and characteristics of many countries in the world. It also seeks to familiarize players with the map of the world.

One game consists of players naming countries and capitals on the maps for points. A first-time answer scores more points than a second-time answer coming after a prompt. Scores are tallied when all the countries have been named.

The other game is played Cranium-style, where players must answer certain trivia questions aided by Visual Aid cards that ask for the location or name of certain buildings. When these are answered correctly, the player moves forward on the board. The player to reach the Finish square first is the winner.

name: Tic Tac Tony
description:
Take turns placing your disc on Tony's tail. When you flick the tail, the disc flies onto his back and lands in one of the holes. The first player to get three in a row wins.

For ages 3-7.

name: Dino the Dinosaur Game
description: Spin and Move children's game based on the animated TV show "The Flintstones".
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric

name: Go Diego Go!  Rescue the baby dinosaur
description:
A themed Chutes & Ladders variant with some additions, like Rescue Pack squares that allow an extra roll, hang glider squares that allow (and force) the player to switch positions with someone else. The board now goes to 91 and there's a dinosaur track on top.

Alternate cooperative rules are included with some interesting additional developments.

Includes board, rules, 6 pawns, 1 die, rubber dinosaur.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Horse of the Year
description: Board game based on Horse Show Jumping. The game has four plastic horses with riders, a variety of fences, walls and other items to make up the Show Jumping course on the board.

name: Malin Baryard World Cup
description:
Free translation from back of the box:

Do you dream about becoming a successful show jumping star just like Malin Baryard? In Malin’s own game WORLD CUP you get to test your talent in exciting jumping competitions. Initially you compete on a borrowed horse and try to collect enough prices to get all necessary equipment and a horse of your own. With that accomplished you just have to win one final competition to become the World Cup champion. All you need is luck, a bit of tactics and some horse knowledge.

Event cards and trivia questions make the game full of action and lots of fun. You also get to ride different horses and the better you perform the better horses you get to ride. Many of the available horses are "celebrities" and if you are really good you might even get to jump Butterfly Flip!

Good luck!

Malin Baryard
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mensch Natur Technik
description:
A tactical dice-game for Hannover's places of interest, from Bothfield to Kirchrode.
"People Nature Technology" was the motto of the 2000 Hannover expo.


Ein taktisches Würfelspiel zu Hannoverschen Sehenswürdigkeiten von Bothfeld bis Kirchrode.
"Mensch Natur Technik" war das Motto der Expo 2000 in Hannover.

name: Get Better Bear
description: Play doctor and be the first to make the teddy bear better. Move your character around the board, placing bandages on boo-boos as you go. Watch out for gauzy shortcuts. When you reach the lollipop, flip it over and put it on the bears mouth. You made him smile and you win.

name: Djurens fantastiska värld
description:
Swedish trivia game about animals (The Fantastic World of Animals). On their turn, players choose their own task for that turn by playing a card from their hand. The categories are charade, picture quiz or one of five different categories of questions, e.g. “Animals in the air”. There are also wild cards. If the player succeeds in her task, she discards her task card. The first player to loose all her cards is the winner. When playing a charade card, the player has one minute to perform the charade. If another player makes the correct guess, then that player may discard any one card from her hand. The player performing the charade may also discard a card because the charade was a success.

8 years and up

name: Svensson frågar och Svensson svarar
description:
The name Svensson is Sweden´s equivalent to Smith, and the title means Svensson asks, Svenssons answers. In this game players earn points by answering trivia questions but also by correctly guessing how many Swedes (in %) have correctly answered the same question on www.vetgirig.nu. People have also submitted questions for the game on the website.

Contents:
Gameboard
3 decks of cards
4 pawns
1 notepad
Rules

14 years and up

name: Scar-Nee and IQ Solitaire
description:
Scar-Nee and i-Q Solitaire (styled that way on the board) are two distinct abstract strategy games for one to four players, marketed together and using identical equipment. Similar to Teeko but played on a 4x4 board and using 16 discs (4 different colors each numbered with pips 1 through 4).
It is likely that Scar-Nee is the same game or a direct forerunner of Scarney, and quite possible that i-Q Solitaire is also an ancestor of the solitaire versions of Scarney described in the latter's rule book.

name: Space Poker
description: A card game for children (7+ years). This is a Space themed poker game. Players try to get space shuttles or planets, or better still, whole intergalactic sets, in order to win.

name: The Amazing But True Cricket Trivia Game
description:
In the Amazing Cricket Trivia Game players split into two teams.

It is a simple trivia game loosely shaped around the game of cricket to encompass the concept of innings and overs. Each question correctly answered is rewarded with the roll of a die to see how many runs have been scored.

name: The Car Boot Game
description:
Each player sets out to buy or acquire sale item cards to sell at a profit. Each sale item provides the player with some profit, some items are "collector's items", providing a large profit.

First to reach an agreed total wins.

This is a simple "roll and move" game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Follow Me
description: A childrens' game where players take turns putting discs into a pile in the center. Each disc shows one of several variations of a smiley face and will have one of four background colors. Players must lay a disc showing either the same face or color as the previous disc.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Urmel aus dem Eis
description: "Urmel" is a dinosaur-character from a favored movie series for children. In this game "Urmel" is hunted by evil character "King Pumponell". Hexagon tiles are laid out and the King starts at one end, Urmel & his friends on the other. It's a racing game, where either Urmel & his friends win by reaching their lair or by the Pumponell-team by catching Urmel. Movement is controlled by dice. The interesting mechanic is, that once one of the friends-characters is caught by Pumponell, the player now joins Pumponells team (in the form of a second "servant"-figure).
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Schweinchen Rallye
description: Every player chooses four pigs as a team for a race. Whoever reaches the feeding trough first with all 4 pigs wins. The active player rolls a dice and moves a pig. The player decides either to roll again or to stop. When a "6" is rolled the turn of the player is over and the pig moved last is returned to the starting field as a penalty.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: X-Words
description:
from the box back: "A collection of 3 fun and demanding weird games to torment the grey matter!
1) X-TALK... The quick-fire game of ad lib story telling... tell a tale to get rid of yours cards!
2) X-EYED... A hectic race against the clock... try to use up all of your letters before the time runs out!
3) X-WORDS... From identical letters, all players race to find the longest word that will fit the cross-word grid! No excuses... No dictionary... No let up from start to finish!"

name: Rescue Ollie North
description:
From the Introduction in the rulebook:

Our hero, Lt. Col. Ollie North, USMC ret., is being subjected to a blatantly unfair trial by those leftist-commie-liberals. Your mission, should you choose to accept it is to...

RESCUE OLLIE NORTH!!!!!!!

In this solitaire game, you will attempt to rescue a true, red-blooded, AMERICAN hero. To do this, you must burst through the courtroom doors, blast the bailiffs, blow away those liberal/commie bystanders, and take Ollie out the door marked "EXIT" in as few turns as possible.

name: Deputy Dawg
description: Very basic roll and move game based on the cartoon TV show of the same name that began in 1960. Other characters from the show like Ty Coon, Musky the Muscrat and Vincent Van Gopher race Deputy Dawg around the board.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mr. Know It All
description: Mr. Know It All is a trivia type learning game that can be a played alone or a party game that many can play. Front cover says for Ages 7 - 15.

name: Conquest of Oz
description:
Conquest of Oz is a free game by Warp Spawn Games and is the first in Lloyd's Oz Trilogy series. Card game for 2 players.
Based on the Imaginary world of Oz. One player represents the forces of good. The other player is the forces of evil. The Good & Evil Characters each have their own unique Decks. The deck contains one of each card in the card list.
Card Types include: Characters, Companions, Locations, Items,
Modifiers, Powers, Attacks, Events
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Spider's Web
description:
The Spider's Web is a game that helps children develop strategic thinking in an entertaining team environment.

Every roll of the dice gives players an opportunity to make a simple choice about the direction they want to move. The game pits a Spider player against one to four Firefly players who must escape from the web before the spider captures them.

Starting in the center of a spider's web, the Fireflies have to land on twigs in order to work their way off the web, but they need to stay clear of the Spider, who tries to land on them to send them back to their starting point.

When any one Firefly is able to escape from the web, all the Fireflies win. However, if the Spider can catch the Fireflies four times before any of them escape, the Spider wins.

Awards:
* Creative Child Magazine´s 2006 GAME OF THE YEAR
* Dr. Toy´s 2006 Smart Toy/Smart Play Award
* 2006 iParenting Media HOT AWARD
* The National Parenting Center´s 2006 Seal of Approval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Speak Love Make Love
description: SPEAK LOVE MAKE LOVE is a two-sided game board. The fully opened side is the Speak Love part. When you fold over either half of the upper board the Make Love side of the board comes to play. In addition, the game has a right playing side and a left side. In the game when it's your turn you are the active player and your partner is the passive. In many cases the game requires working together to play an activity. The more cooperative and open you are, the more fun, discovery and experimentation is available.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Mature / Adult, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Storytelling

name: Baseball Game (Epoch Book Game Series)
description: This is a mechanical baseball game. The players sit on opposite sides of the game. The batter locks their side of the spring-loaded spinner then the pitcher locks theirs. The pitcher secretly moves a slider either left or right. Then the pitcher pitches by pulling their unlock switch. The batter than has to hit the ball by pulling their unlock switch. After this is done the result shows through either the left or right window in the game field. This is repeated until there are three outs and then the game is turned around as the sides are switched. There are dials to show the current count, outs and score.

name: Barbapapa Takes a Trip Game
description: "An exciting race game based on the internationally acclaimed cartoon characters who have the wonderful ability to change their shapes. Ages 5 through 9."
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
