name: Secret Lives of the U.S. Presidents: Trivia Card Game
description:
From the publisher:

We've got a big election coming up, and everyone is buzzing with talk of presidents past and future. But if you still can't tell your Tafts from your Tylers, then it s time to play Secret Lives of the U.S. Presidents: Trivia Card Game!
Complete with rules for one, two, or an entire roomful of players, this trivia card game features more than 150 witty, irreverent, and fiendishly challenging trivia questions: Which president walked his pet raccoon on a leash? Which president slept for (literally) half of the day? Who worked as a cover model for Cosmopolitan magazine? Which one blamed air pollution on trees?
Complete with hilarious two-color illustrations of every president, this trivia card game is perfect for Democrats, Republicans, and Independents of all ages. The difficulty level ranges from simple true/false answers to ultra-hard "for history geeks only" challenges. Deal out the cards -- and let the games begin!
categories: Educational, Humor, Novel-based, Party Game, Political, Trivia

name: Hockey Stars
description: The main goal of this game is to score more goals than the other team. Players can make multiple actions with the puck in order to put the puck in the opponent's net. The game contains real hockey rules like offside, penalty, fighting and it is divided into three periods. The game combines the elements of strategy and chance.

name: Pillow-Dex
description:
From an paragraph in Margaret Hofer's book "The games we played"

"In Pillow Dex, a precursor of "Table Tennis" players volley a balloon over a net stretched across a parlor table. The idea being to keep the balloon from landing on your side of the table. If you can make it land on your opponents side 10 times you win the game. Pillow Dex was one of the most heavily advertised games of the period."

name: 7 Answers of Highly Horny People
description: "What’s on your mind? Compare answers in this 'guess what they’re thinking' poll of 7 horny people. Your imagination is the limit! Includes 52 game cards, 8 pads, 8 pencils, timer and rule sheet."
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia

name: Booze, Boobs and Boners
description: "The adult trivia game with an 'all or nothing' payoff! Most likely a naked one! Includes 52 game cards, 8 score pads, 8 pencils, 200 game chips, reference cards, card holder and rule sheet."

name: Can-do Roo
description: In Can-Do Roo, players reach into the kangaroo’s pouch and pull out a Fun Card that will tell them to hop to a particular shape or color. Or they might have to act and sound like a dog, frog, cow or other common animal. The 96 Fun Cards in Roo’s pouch also include letters of the alphabet to help children recognize each letter and learn what words start with that letter. If they pick a number card, they will have fun hopping that number of times while counting. Players who successfully complete their Fun Card keep the card, and the player who collects the most Fun Cards wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Educational

name: Fishing: Jeu De Peche
description:
The fish are moved from the center pool, out of any exit, on a throw of the dice. Fish always move in a clockwise direction. No fish can pass another or occupy same square.
To be caught a fish must land on the square with a fisherman's hook, and the player must throw again to determine size. If he throws a 1,2 or a 3 the fish is Too Small and has to be thrown back into the center of pool. If he throws a 4,5 or 6 the fish is over the correct size and is kept. There are other rules to enhance play. First player to catch 3 fish is the winner.

name: Boerderij Spel
description: A children's game where 2 to 6 players try to sell as soon as possible all their animals

name: Official Radio Baseball Game
description: OFFICIAL RADIO BASEBALL board game. This game was intended to played along with the game on the radio, or with separate rules without the radio. Features quite a few great teams of the day. Colorful graphics of players in action on the front of the game along with a classic image of a radio announcer. Made by TOY CREATIONS, N.Y., N.Y.

name: Spoons Dice
description:
A dice game based on the classic 'Spoons' card game. From the package back:

" Victory is up for grabs in this fast-moving dice game of shake, make, and take.

SHAKE the dice and watch them roll.
MAKE four-of-a-kind, that's your goal.
TAKE the spoon and pluck it up, if you're last to do it, you're out of luck!


Hotshot dice fun for players ages 6 and up.

Contents: 3 spoons, 16 dice, dice container, instruction sheet. "

name: World Wise Asian Realm
description:
(Back of box):PUT THE WORLD IN YOUR HANDS with this great new educational family card game! No matter what your age or education level, no matter how little or how much you know about geography, you can be equally competitive. Parents and children can play and learn together. Prepare for an upcoming vacation or sharpen your knowledge for a business trip. Or just relax and have fun.

There is a card for each country on the Asian Realm and each body of water bounding the Asian Realm, as well as wild cards and super wild cards. Each player must play a card whose geographic location shares a boundary with the card that was last played. Bluffing and using wild cards add strategy to the play.

Exciting and educational for 2-8 players, ages 9 years to senior citizens.

name: World Class Liar
description:
In World Class Liar, players try to be first to score in each of four languages. Rounds are played by discarding cards to the table face down and calling the number of cards and the language. Opponents can call 'liar' in the language of the cards being played, or play can continue to the next player who must also try discard in the same language.
To score a language a player must discard his last cards face up to the table.
There are partnership rules included as well.

name: Millionær Junior
description:
(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Bring your savings to the town which is full of funny stores.

You are attempting to buy as many stores as possible. The more stores you own, the more money you may make. Your opponents do have to pay rent when they stop there! If you are really lucky, and stop by a traffic light, you do not have to pay rent on your next move.

When all the stores have been bought, the player who first earns 30 coins wins.

name: Football
description:
(From the included instructions...)

Let's Play Football was originated to give both the football player and the non-football player some of the thrills of football right in the home, in a car, on a plane, or anywhere.

The game is designed as a twosome - two people, or two teams playing against each other, at the same time, with one game. Let's Play Football can also be played singly.

Part of the Stancraft Super Sport series.
Contents: 108 plastic-coated playing cards; printed football field; marker; instructions.
publishers: DMR Company, Hoyle Products, Stancraft Products

name: Honey War
description:
2-5 players control their own apiary. The goal is to build the largest and best apiary - the first player to get 10 points wins.

Honey War is loosely based on real beekeeping, and includes many of the same problems and solutions real beekeepers face.

The game consists of a board, bee cards (queens and workers), pollen cards, honey cards and action cards. On a players turn they roll the dice and move that number of spaces around the board, collecting special cards as they land on the relevant spaces. These cards are used to get new bees, inflict disease on other players hives, or cure your own infected hives.

name: Seeking Agent X
description:
A deduction game based around the idea that spies send messages to each other using personal ads.

Players are dealt cards that indicate gender, age, and personality traits (romantic, sporty, good looking), and then take turns reading from personal ads (either actual or with the included samples) and revealing how many of their traits appear in the given ad.

Home Page: http://members.aol.com/seekagentx/

name: Planche-Neige
description:
Players compete in a ski resort to be the most popular one.

Published in Jeux & stratégie Nouvelle Formule #2

name: Doggie Bites
description:
A selection from the included English rules of the game "Croc' Toutous" by Janod Jeux of France -

"Contents:
Two cute wooden doggie shakers and 18 numbered dome-shaped doggie bites.

Setup:
Turn over all the Doggie Bites to hide the figures.

Rules:
Each player covers one doggie bite with his doggie shaker. The players then shake their doggie vigorously on the table for a few seconds, and lift to see what they scored. The doggie bite will have turned over to show th numbered side as it was shaken. The player with the higher number takes the piece from the other player

The game ends when there are no more doggie bites, and the winner is the person who collects the most bites."

Suitable for Ages 4 and up, this game familiarizes children with numbers and introduces them to simple sums (in an advanced variant).

name: Spelling Beez
description:
Just as honeybees move from flower to flower collecting nectar to create honey, you'll move around the Spelling Beez game board collecting letters to create words. With two levels of play, children of all ages will enjoy this unique and educational spelling game. While younger children work to collect letters that spell simple words, older children are challenged by collecting letters for more difficult words. Older children will also share and learn interesting facts about honeybees as they try to collect the most pollen and nectar points to win the game. Spelling Beez is all you need to learn your ABC's.

Ages 4 -8

Contents: Spelling Beez Game Board; 80 Pollen/Nectar Cards; 60 Spelling Beez Cards; Honeycomb Score Sheets; 4 Worker Bee Playing Pieces; Rules Booklet
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Bug-A-Boo
description: Rev the bug up and set it in the center of the board. Watch as it spins out into one of the colored holes. That player gets to move his scoring peg.

name: Monopoly: Liverpool Football Club Champions Of Europe
description: The classic boardgame takes on a new shape in this Liverpool edition. Featuring stars from the current squad alongside heroes from Liverpool's illustrious past and two of the club's greatest managers, this version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by aquiring stands and stadiums. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Home and Away cards. It's an absolute must for all Liverpool fans!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Die Schwarzwaldklinik
description:
The hospital personnel of the Schwarzwaldklinik (Black Forest Hospital - a TV-show from the 80's) is charged with trying to treat and make healthy the supplied patients (randomly drawn) as quickly as possible. After each visit, i.e. with each visit (after dice rolling and the moving of the meeple of a player located at the bed of the patient, a playing piece is set on one of the circles (2, 3 or 4) of the patient's card. Rolling a 6 results in reading and obeying some tasks on a randomly drawn event-card. The player, who provides the last playing piece for the individual patient's card, has cured the patient and gets his card.
The player with the most patient's cards wins.

name: My First Card Games
description:
This is children’s game that contains rules and card sets for Math Rummy and Alphabet Go Fish. Also included in the box are four children’s card holders to allow young children hold a hand of cards.

The Math Rummy game has 24 cards that contain number cards (1-10) and plus cards, minus cards and a board to create simple equations. The Math Rummy rules contain the rules for two games of various difficulties as well as teach-me tips on using this game with children.

The Alphabet Go Fish game has 78 cards, three of each letter with a representative item for that letter on the card (ex. key for k). The cards are also in six different colors to allow for color matching games. The Alphabet Go Fish rules contain the rules for three games of various difficulty as well as teach-me tips on using this game with children.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Bookopoly
description:
from the publishers:

OPEN A BOOK! THE WORLD AWAITS YOU!

Book-opoly allows players a glimpse inside the many worlds of classic literature. It’s a traditional property trading game where players buy, sell and trade their way to fun with family and friends. Interesting facts about the books and the authors are printed on the back of each property deed. Roll the dice and advance to Read. Collect Bookstores and trade them in for Libraries. Who knows! You may soon be elected President of the Book Club…or you may be tossed out of the game for three turns and sent to WATCH TV!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Caçada ao Tesouro
description:
Caçada ao Tesouro is the Portuguese for Treasure Hunt. This is a game recommended for children Ages 5 and up.
Translated from the Box:
"Each step must be thought out very well. The one who capturea the hunters or deactivates the robots and finds the best treasures will be the champion of this Super-championship"

It is a chess variant with a child appealing theme pasted on. One player has control of eight pawns and the other of the two knights. The player with the pawns hides the treasures on the opposite side of the board, each treasure has a different point value. You play in two rounds,each player plays one time with the pawns and another with the knights. The players that when playing with the pawns gets the most points is the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Final Demand
description:
Final Demand - The Disconnection Game

From the rulebook:

"Players race to connect their houses to the water, electricity and telephone supplies; then they try to remain connected, while disconnecting the other players.

The winner is the last player to retain all or some of his supplies. Players who lose all of their supplies are out of the game!"

The game consists of a board, counters, cards, 30 coloured rings and 6 telephone poles.

name: Bonk! The Game of Naughty Words
description:
Similar to Balderdash or Call My Bluff, except focusing on words that are (or sound like they could be) "naughty" - generally relating to reproduction, fidelity, anatomy, and amorous activities. Three options are given, but unlike the two aforementioned games, in Bonk! players do not elaborate or make up definitions.

For example, which of the following does "Basifugal" mean?

Chaste, after St. Basil.
Turning away from a kiss.
Unable to bear children.


Players start with 3 points, represented by tiddlywinks (white = 1 point, black = 2 points).

Players take turns to be question master, reading out a word and three definitions. Other players display which they think is correct by holding up the appropriate number card. Players who are wrong give 1 point to the question master.

Players are out of the game when they run out of tiddlywinks. The objective is to get all the tiddlywinks (or in 4+ game, the most tiddlywinks in the final two).

82 cards each contain 4 different words, 2 on front and 2 on back.

name: Equalz
description: Using a deck that contains both digit cards and arithmetic operation cards(addition, subtraction, multiplication, division), players attempt to current target number by creating a mathematical expression that equals that target number. A round ends when 1 or more players use all of their cards making expressions. The first player to reach 500 points wins.

name: Rhino Rush
description:
Throughout the game the Rhino rushes about the board either pushing the poor Looney birds back along the track or knocking them over.

The first player to get both of their colour Looney birds to the safety of the tall grass wins the game.

Similar to Dizzy Dizzy Dinosaur except the Rhino is battery powered !
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: I Spy
description: An observation game using letters, colors, and shapes. Roll the dice to move your counter around the board. If you land on a special marker, spin the spinner and name something in the room that starts with the letter spun. The board can be turned over for an easier version that uses colors and shapes. Also includes category cards.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Las Vegas Style Casino Slot Dice Game
description: Sold in Las Vegas gift shops, this small game comes with five dice, each marked with various slot machine symbols, as well as PASS and LOSE marks. Las Vegas Casino Slot Dice Game is a game of random chance in which players roll the dice and earn points based on what symbols show up. The first person to 5,000 points is the winner.

name: Monopoly: I Love Lucy "California, Here We Come"
description:
from the Publisher's website:

Relive many of the funniest and most memorable “I Love Lucy” episodes in the “California, Here We Come” edition of the world’s most famous board game, MONOPOLY. Travel west with Lucy and the gang as they head to California, finding trouble and fun wherever they go. Buy, sell and trade hilarious episodes like “L.A At Last!,” “Harpo Marx,” and “Lucy Visits Grauman’s” in a quest to own all of Lucy’s California adventures. Comes complete with 6 collectible pewter tokens of Ricky’s Convertible, Derby Hat, Harp, Cement Block, Lucy’s Glasses and Lucy’s Shoes.

Gather friends and family as you reminisce about Lucy’s hilarious shenanigans in Hollywood and get ready for some good old-fashioned fun!
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Zoob The Game
description:
From the publisher's web site:

The game that's a SNAP to play! Race around the board collecting the Zoob pieces you need to put together a secret Zoob creation. Watch out as other players try to steal and swap your pieces! Players will build everything from sea serpents to propellers that actually spin. The first player to finish their creation, wins the game! Zoob is an award-winning construction toy that encourages kids to learn, explore and create using the most important tool of all - your imagination! Zoob pieces move after they snap, click, and pop together in 20 different ways, so there is no limit to what you can build. The Zoob Game is compatible with all Infinitoy Zoob pieces, and includes 24 new Zoob creations not available in any other Zoob construction set. Game comes with 37 Zoob pieces, 24 Zoob Creation Cards, 1 Game board, 4 Playing pieces, 1 Die, and Game instructions. For 2 - 4 Players, Ages 6 and up.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fraction Mania
description:
Fraction Mania is an educational game designed to teach children to represent the fractions 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 1/5, 1/6 and 1/8. The game uses a solar system theme with planets associated with each of the six fractions above, as well as comets (represented by marbles and additional cards for use with some of the variants.

The equipment provided can be used to play four variants:

1) Beginner's Mania -- Each player in turn rolls a die and collects the appropriate piece in a race to fill his/her planets first.

2) Fraction Mania -- The basic game with the addition of event cards and a requirement for a player to trade up and down to the largest possible fraction he/she can use.

3) Double Mania -- A player can now collect multiple fraction pieces in a given turn and exchange them for equivalent sets on the fly.

4) Action Mania -- A timed game using written logs instead of the planets; the players take turns rolling a die and adding the roll to a log, trading up as appropriate.

name: Sieben Auf Einen Streich
description: A charming little children's game whose title translates as "Seven in a Blow." Like the Grimm Fairy Tale, your objective is to collect seven in a blow. Every tile has terrific illustrations of fairy tale characters but also owls, gnomes, fairies and frogs. Your objective is to place tiles so that there are 7 frogs, gnomes, owls or fairies on tiles adjacent to each other. If you do so, you collect all the tiles with the creatures on them. The player who collects the most tiles win.

name: Die Blumenwichtel
description: Who would have thought it? Every flower has a helpful little goblin who protects and looks after it. So that their favorites feel at their best, the goblins dash around the board with their little flower pots, in search of water – because every tiniest drop allows the flowers to grow. And whomever’s flower blossoms out first, is the winner

name: The Restless Gun Game
description: Based on the 1957-1959 TV Western of the same name, this is spin-and-move game using coloured marbles as placeholders. The board uses cut-out divots to hold the marbles, and two spinners are built into the board itself. Players move their marbles around the board in a manner vaguely reminiscent of "Parchesi" or "Sorry". Specific areas on the board and the addition of play money provide some variation on the theme.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit: Set I, Group IV
description:
From the Back of the Box:

1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition...

Happy triviaphiles will recognize the Q&A's in this set from Set I of the award-winning Game of Trivia by the Avalon Hill Game company.

Now - we make these same questions & answers available for devotees of Trivial Pursuit, without having you pay for a complete game.

Here - in this box - are 1,650 additional Q&A's, color-coded for play with Trivial Pursuit (and other similar games of trivia).

And... if 1,650 of them aren't enough, check out the additional groups - labeled 1 thru 4 - to complete the set of 6,600 additional questions and answers.

OMNI Magazine - December '84 - selected Game of Trivia by The Avalon Hill Game Company... "best trivia game of the year, based on its variety of questions and low ratio of arguable answers."

GAMES Magazine - September '84 - editors' choice for GAMES 100 because... "Game of Trivia plays more like a true board game, and there's no reason why you can't use the questions for Trivial Pursuit."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: 1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit: Set I, Group III
description:
From the Back of the Box:

1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition...

Happy triviaphiles will recognize the Q&A's in this set from Set I of the award-winning Game of Trivia by the Avalon Hill Game company.

Now - we make these same questions & answers available for devotees of Trivial Pursuit, without having you pay for a complete game.

Here - in this box - are 1,650 additional Q&A's, color-coded for play with Trivial Pursuit (and other similar games of trivia).

And... if 1,650 of them aren't enough, check out the additional groups - labeled 1 thru 4 - to complete the set of 6,600 additional questions and answers.

OMNI Magazine - December '84 - selected Game of Trivia by The Avalon Hill Game Company... "best trivia game of the year, based on its variety of questions and low ratio of arguable answers."

GAMES Magazine - September '84 - editors' choice for GAMES 100 because... "Game of Trivia plays more like a true board game, and there's no reason why you can't use the questions for Trivial Pursuit."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Start Your Engines!
description:
"A revved-up game book!"

This "book" is actually a set of four game boards, four counters, and a unique stop-light, which replaces dice or spinners by randomly choosing red, yellow or green lights. Each of the boards is essentially a roll-and-move race to the finish board, but some offer variants in how to move.
categories: Book, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Clashes for the Ashes
description:
An exciting cricket game that can be played anywhere using picture cards of actual players from both Test teams. Players can pick their order of batting & bowling.
Dice are used to score runs & take wickets. The game is designed so that the top batsmen have more chance of higher scores & the top bowlers can take more wickets.

name: Monopoly: Library Edition
description: From notes from Games Gone By: This quite rare Edition of Monopoly was produced in 1961 in both a Wooden Box and a Plastic Box version.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Canal Boat Race
description:
This is a simple roll and move style game based on the British waterways of the 19th Century.

Players must negotiate a series of canals to get to the wharf, collect coal and return to the Paper mill.

Players take it in turn to take cards from a pile and move the number of spaces shown on the card. Some cards give specific bonuses like extra movement.

Also included are the rules for a more complex version of the game called Boatman's Bluff. This uses the same components but adds a bit more strategy to the game.

It was published in association with the British Waterways Board

name: Zero Zero
description: In this game, you begin in the middle of the ocean and navigate shark-infested waters! You become an explorer and a pirate as you overcome formidable adversaries in your quest to reach the awe-inspiring volcano, the cozy igloo in the far North, the idyllic tropical beach and the thrilling amusement park. The hero of this great adventure is the first player to land a game piece on each of the four dream destinations in cold, mild, and hot climates utilizing dice rolls combining plus [warm] and minus [cool] symbols as well as number rolls.

name: Music #1
description:
Listed in American Games #4163. 1984, Music, Board Game.

A roll-and-move game in which players try to complete an 8-bar staff and song title by collecting notes and words. While there is education value in teaching recognition of music notation and theory, the game's mechanics have little to do with music.

From the Manufacturer's instructions:
"No musical knowledge required. Just read, count, and roll dice."

"A game of chance by rolling the dice. Each player will encircle board several times in one game. Player keeps moving his token around the board the number of spaces indicated by the total sum of the two dice. Each space landed upon and each card drawn directs the movements of teh player. No one is safe even in his own play area. He must follow directions of space landings. There is no blocking, no bumping players off spaces and no back obligations. First player to fill his staff with notes and complete a song title is the winner. It can be very frustrating at times with continual gains and losses; such as real composers go through as they create a song. A player who has the least notes or words during the game can be the winner at the last minute though it appears he is losing."

"Object of Game: A player must fill his 8 BAR STAFF with 4 beats to each measure containing the right amount of notes and complete a SONG TITLE of four words or more which say something."

"EQUIPMENT: Board with indicated play spaces, four 8 bar staffs, four tokens to represent each composer, two dice, 500 words, 50 whole notes (clear discs) 50 half notes (white discs) 75 quarter notes (black discs) and 75 Directional cards."

name: Peter Rabbit Rummy
description:
Made by E.E. Fairchild Corp., this is exactly what the name implys, A children's Rummy card game
with art based off of Peter Rabbit.

name: National Gallery Artist's Card Game
description:
Four card games using the same pack of commemorative cards from the National Gallery. Each card is of very high quality and features one of 52 famous paintings. Two of the games are familiar e.g. snap or memory. Two of the games have been created especially for this pack of cards.

In 'Collector' you are collecting different paintings from different schools in a game akin to Happy Families. In 'Curator' one player acts as a curator for a museum collecting different schools of paintings in exchange for chips (not provided)
publishers: Past Times, U.S. Games Systems, Inc.

name: Ask Me Another!
description: Trivia game billed as "The Great Fun Family Quiz Game" Great family quiz game. Its fun to challenge the family to a general knowledge contest. You can race ahead if you answer the questions correctly, but, watch out, the tough ones mean you will get sent back. What is the "patella" or who wrote"The day of the Jackal"? If you know the answer you may reach the top space first!
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Spellen, Milton Bradley

name: Opplev Norge-spillet
description: Travel across Norway and answer questions relating to various places and cities you stop at. Everybody starts at Lindesnes. Roll of the die determines where you go from there, but everybody follows the roads printed on the map. If you answer correctly you get to move 2 steps further and answer a bonus question. If you answer this correctly as well you get to roll the die again. The route splits in two at the city of Trondheim. A die roll determines which route you take. The first to get to Kristiansand and the Zoo wins.

name: Sexual Q&A
description:
Published by Avalon Hill's Victory Games. Here's the information from the box:

Front: Sexual Q&A - An Outrageous Card game of Sexual Questions and Answers. Authenticated by Dr. Ruth Westheimer.

Back: This is a provocative sex-oriented card game for 2 or more players of consenting age. The object is to correctly answer situations provided in a true or false format. The situations are taken from those posted by Dr. Ruth Westheimer's long-running "Ask Dr. Ruth" radio and TV program.

See image for example cards on the back of the box.
categories: Educational, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Nature Sauvage
description:
What would you say to a nice trek through the National Parks of France? Based on a subtle blend of visual and question/answer games, Nature Sauvage reveals to you the marvelous secrets of the fauna, flora, and countryside of France. An ideal game to avoid staying at home!


An exploration of French nature like you've never seen before
More than 300 superb photos
An exciting game with two levels of difficulty


Aim of the Game

You set off to discover some of the most unbelievable animals, the most fascinating plants, and the most sumptuous countrysides that make up our natural spaces. The objective: to be the first trekker to rejoin the ranger station by performing mimes, solving puzzles, identifying silhouettes, and answering multiple choice questions. Through its action, thought-provoking nature, and above all its humor, Nature Sauvage will satisfy both young and old, novice and enthusiast.

Contents:
- 1 game board
- 270 Fauna, Flora, Park, and Countryside cards
- 10 Trek cards
- 45 Mime-Puzzle cards
- 30 Tokens
- 6 Mushroom pawns
- 1 wooden die
- 1 rule book

This game is only available in French.

name: Blue's Clues Card Game
description:
This is three games in one. You have the Match 'em! Card Game, the Sneak-a-Peek Card Game and the Memory Matching Game. Each game is played differently.

In Match 'em! Card Game, you are trying to place four cards in a row, in Sneak-a-Peek Card Game, you are trying to collect three matching cards, and in Memory Matching Game, you are trying to collect the most cards by making matches.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Turvapaikka
description:
Turvapaikka (Asylum) is a board game about asylum seekers in European Union. Each player has a certain background story given by his/her profile card and 20 points to begin with. The story has minor effects on gameplay.

Players roll dice and move around the square monopoly-like game board. Most spaces of the track represent countries, but there are also spaces for traffic hubs, Red Cross, immigration detention centre, lawyer and event card pickup (authorities, everyday life). Usually landing on a space decreases player's points.

A player may apply for asylum in one country. The odds for being granted asylum are given by country cards and they reflect some statistic characteristics of the real country.

A player's game ends once he/she has run out of points and so been deported out of EU, or if he/she manages to get asylum (win) or a temporary residence permit (lose). It is possible that none of the players win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Woods Pyramid Game
description: The Woods Pyramid Game is a quick playing abstract strategy game for two players. The game teaches and rewards good math and logic skills. Pieces are arranged on the game board in five rows, forming a pyramid. Two players alternate turns removing either a piece or several pieces from a single row. The last player to remove a piece loses. There are two different levels of play. The game is recommended for children and adults, ages 6 and up.

name: A Journey Through Europe
description:
NOTE: This game page is only for the game from the 1700s, not for the similarly-titled but unrelated game Journey Through Europe (aka Explore Europe) published by Ravensburger et al in the 1950s through 1990s.

This game is believed to be the first or one of the first known games in the English-speaking world to be attributed to an individual designer.

It was first published by Carrington Bowles, a British publisher of hand-tinted, cloth-backed maps. This game reconfigured a map of Europe to provide a game rather than a reference. It's a straightforward track game. The game uses a teetotum, a spinning top with numbered sides, as dice were viewed as gambling instruments that would not be permitted in respectable households. The players begin and end in London, and many spaces advance players or transport them to other portions of the board. For example, a playing piece that lands on Hanover "shall by order of Ye King of Great Britain who is Elector, be conducted to ... Gibraltar to visit his countrymen who keep garrison there" while the playing piece that lands on "Rome for kissing ye Pope's Toe shall be banished for his folly to ... the cold island of Iceland and miss three turns".

http://www.escapistmagazine.com/issue/42/13

name: Jati
description:
Significantly different from the celebrated bookshelf title, this Jati is a solo dexterity game where a player must use a magnet to guide a piece through a maze; in a sense, a bizarre relative of Polarity and Labyrinth.

From the game box:
"Jati, the fascinating action Puzzler, will challenge your skill as it tests your cool. All you do is maneuver the magnet around the Jati maze. Sounds easy - but, here's the catch - you can't touch the magnet! All maneuvering must be done with the magnetic wand. Come too close to the magnet with the wand and - you've had it. The magnet either plunges over the edge or reverses itself and leaps toward the wand. Only a dazzling display of dexterity on your part will maneuver the magnet around the Jati maze and into the center. So, test your skill and dexterity; see if you're a novice or a Jati Master, and score yourself accordingly. As a novice, you'll only score 25 points. To be a JATI Master, you'll have to maneuver the magnet in printed side up - no easy feat! For superb skill, the Jati Master scores 100 points. What if you get the magnet in upside down, you ask. Well, then you're only an advanced Jati player; score 75 points and keep practicing.

Not to be confused with:
Jati, a tile laying game

name: ABC Bingo
description:
ABC Bingo Games help kids acquire valuable pre-reading skills - like alphabet and sound-letter recognition - while they play a fun game.
Players learn to identify, pronounce, and discuss dozens of words as they move their animal playing pieces along the game board. Unlike traditional bingo, ABC Bingo Games do not use a bingo caller. Instead, when players land on a game-board square, they identify the square's animal, person, or object illustration; state the first letter of the word; and, if it's on their alphabet bingo mat, cover the letter with a bingo chip. Each ABC Bingo Game also includes an illustrated Word list for extra practice or review.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Guns and Gadgets 007
description:
In addition to being a normal deck of cards, each card pictures av device from a James Bond movie (like the Q boat from "The world is not enough", or the Marine Scooter from "Thunderball") or James Bond himself (Sean Connery, George Lazenby, Roger Moore, Timothy Dalton, Pierce Brosnan).

Each card also denotes unique values for six variables for the creature on the photo (Damage, Protection, Ingenuity, Stealth, Technology and Multi-purpose). Each player play their top card, and the starting player selects variable. The player with highest value wins the card and is the next rounds starter.

The game separates from other similar card games by having a secret message (e.g. name of next mission card) on the back of every Bond-card, only visible when seen trough a red plastic lens, which goes with the game.

name: Ca$h: das Eine-Million-Mark-Quiz
description:
This is a quiz game based on a German TV show where (if successful) a competitor could win up to a million Deutsch Mark (the currency before Euro).

A spinner decides who is Captain of the team. Then every player spins to see on which "Action field" to put his pawn to.
Those fields may be questions but also the beginning of a Terminator round. With the latter one players can exchange their Captain. Furthermore there are actions like "spin again" or "go directly to next round" (with higher cash reward).
The money is usually distributed to equal parts amongst the players, only the Captain is getting more.

The difficulty of the trivia questions rises every round.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Wir sammeln Pilze
description:
This is an former GDR-game where players roll and move over a board. On some spaces there a mushrooms and players can take another turn if it is eatable and have to go backwards for poisonous mushrooms.
Classical Roll & Move.

name: The Great Grape Ape Game
description: Game based on Hanna-Barber television cartoon series which was a part of the 'Tom & Jerry Show'. The Great Grape Ape (40 feet tall and 2000 pounds) was about an ape and his talking dog Beegle Beagle as they drove around America looking for adventure. A spin and move game. The game included 4 markers, a spinner for movement and a background insert that gave the game a 3-d effect. Ages 7 - 12
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Smokey Bear Game
description:
Milton Bradley issued this very simple roll and move advertising game to go along with the country's Smokey Bear "Only you can prevent forest fires!" campaign.

The colorful board has a forest with Smokey and lots of woodland animals. The object is to be the first to travel through the forest and reach the "finish" spot first. Along the way are several yellow circles where you help Smokey put out a campfire, pick up a candy wrapper and so on. There are 4 pawns and a spinner attached to the inside cardboard instructions.

name: The Twelve
description:
The Twelve
2-6 Players

Who knows the twelve members of the European Economic Community? Who recognizes their flags? Here is a game which helps us to learn both.

Contents
48 Cards

Object of the Game
To make as many flags as possible

Players take turns in turning over cards to collect four cards that make up a flag of an EEC member state

name: The Child Awareness Game
description: This game was endorsed by the Adam Walsh Child Resource Center and is of course the product of the abduction and killing of Adam Walsh in 1981. His father John's successful television show "America's Most Wanted" has successfully caught criminals since. This game tries to teach children how to avoid and what to do when faced with danger.

name: Battle of the Sexes Card Game: Blind Date
description:
Battle of the Sexes Blind Date is about defending your gender and finding out once and for all which sex really knows more about the dating game - Male or Female?

This card game tests one's knowledge of the opposite sex with a series of gender-based questions or challenges on dating, love, friendship and relationships.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Barney Google and Spark Plug Game
description: Spin and move game where Barney is trying to get Sparkplug (his horse) to his Reward of a bail of hay without Sparky winding up in the Glue Factory.
publishers: Jerome M Remmick Co., Milton Bradley

name: The Narrowboat Game
description:
From the Game:

Captain your own narrowboat around the canal system. There are locks to negotiate, a tunnel to go through, an aqueduct to cross, as well as hazard squares and detour points to avoid. Breakdown vans are called to repair your boat in the event of mishap. Climb aboard and select your one or two week narrowboating holiday and Good Luck!

This family boating game is for children of all ages, and recommended playing Ages 7 and up.

It has copyright 1967 R.G. Bryant

It's an Abstract Strategy game, played on a 16x16 grid, 20 pieces to a side, each on own colour. each corner has a 3x3 area that is not playable.

Pieces can move different amounts as per pre game arrangement. by single squares, by one or two squares, one or 3, one of 4, or one or 5, through open squares only. Moves are diagonally backwards or forward, sideways or circular (not really explained in the rules)

three ways to capture (albeit one would be rare as you have to move into a capture position, they call it a 'blunder')

others are by landing on a square not of your colour (again not easy to see how that happens)

Or by having a piece on opposite sides of an opponent's piece.

The three options sound like designer was trying to add depth with options that will rarely come into play

The copy must be Canadian since it's in both English and French. I am in Canada too.

Box is simple, checkerboard design, with nothing more than name and the copyright info.

pieces are plastic, stamped '220' simple. but nice

name: Race Around the Clock Elapsed Time Game
description: Build confidence in solving elapsed time problems with this self-checking game featuring real-life elapsed time scenarios. The first player to advance around the clock face game board wins!

name: Cranium Grab & Go Connect-O-Round
description:
From the publisher:

The classic four-in-a-row game with a twist
Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel
Laugh-out-loud fun for kids -- and adults!
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones
Up and down? Across? Diagonally? Careful -- your opponent already has 3 tokens lined up! Block them, get four in a row, and ta-da -- you win!


Components:
Includes one Connect-O-Round game tube and 42 tokens (21 of each color).

name: IQ Disc
description:
(From the box):
1. Each player takes a turn to throw the dice
2. Stack a disc accordingly on top of the playing stack.
e.g. if a number "2" is thrown, place a disc with its hole over the 2 of the disc on the top of the stack.
3. The player who topples the stack loses.

Contents: 15 Discs and 1 die.

name: Count on Buzz Lightyear Card Game
description:
Count on Buzz Lightyear is a card game in which players must get rid of cards in their hands by creating math equations. Each time an equation can be made, using one card from the hand and two cards from the table, the player gets to put down the card from the hand that was used. When one player has rid himself of all cards in his hand, the other players add up the points left in their hands and another round is dealt. Play continues until all players but one have passed 50 points.

The theme of the game is Toy Story, and each number card, 1-10, features a picture (drawing) of one of the Toy Story characters. Buzz Lightyear cards are wild cards and can represent any number (but, if left in your hand, count for 11 points each). This game would be best for children in early grade school, as they develop their basic math skills. The suggested age of 7+ is pretty accurate, although enjoyment of the game will depend greatly upon the player's math skills.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game
description:
From the Rules
This game was devised to enable the therapist to learn about the underlying psychological processes of such children, in a way that is non-threatening. It utilizes the vehicle of the standard game--so universally appealing to children--and the elicitation of responses via token reinforcement. The game has proved helpful in shortening the therapeutic process--not only because it provides the therapist with information earlier than he would have otherwise obtained it, but also because it facilitates the child's freeing himself enough to reveal his previously suppressed and repressed thoughts, feelings, and actions. The game can be useful in both individual and group psychotherapy with children. And even the child who will engage in direct discussion, psychoanalytic inquiry, and fantasy play can find it a pleasurable additional psychotherapeutic experience. It is most useful in treatment of children between the ages of four (children younger than that cannot usually play board games) and twelve (the adolescent will often consider the game "babyish").

IMPORTANT NOTICE
Talking, Feeling, and Doing Game was designed to be used only by mental health professionals in their therapeutic work with children. Accordingly , every reasonable attempt is made to limit the sale and distribution of the game to such professionals. Use of the game by parents with their own children is therapeutically contraindicated. Most parents are not trained to provide appropriate therapeutic responses to the cards. And even those who are, are not likely to have the objectivity with their own children that is necessary for optimum utilization of the game. Lastly, such play with parents will compromise the child's use of the game with his or her therapist.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Anger Solution Game
description:
The Anger Solution Game helps children learn to control their behavior responses to anger. As players make their way around the board, they are faced with a series of decisions and learn to choose the success route over the victim cycle. The anger solution game is a unique therapeutic tool. The game includes a game board, 100 tokens, 1 solution spinner, 1 6-sided die, 24 empowerment cards, 58 question cards, and 40 solution cards.

From the Rules:
This game is intended to be played with adult supervision. Any empathetic adult (parent, teacher, counselor, etc.) can assist children to effectively identify, express, and manage their anger. Although anger is a natural emotion in response to conflict situations, it can jeopardize relationships if it is not communicated effectively and appropriately.

Typically, people react inappropriately to anger in one of two ways. The first is by overreacting to conflict situations by becoming verbally and/or physically explosive to others after allowing anger to build up. Secondly, a person may react to anger by internalizing their frustration with a conflict situation which often results in physiological or emotional symptoms of stress.

The Anger Solution Game was developed through the integration of a psycho-educational approach with cognitive behavioral intervention modality. The main goal is to help the client to understand that he/she has control over behavioral responses to anger and that he/she can make choices which can result in positive solutions.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Elements
description:
Like Rock-Paper-Scissors, Elements is a fun, fast-paced game of circular dominance. Prepare for action as earth, wind, water and fire collide in a battle of strength and dominance to see which one will prevail. Elements features several different games from quick and easy to delightfully strategic.

The object of Elements is to capture cards. As in nature, each element dominates another and can capture any card in the element regardless of strength, but cards in the same element must rely on the strength of their force.

name: Ice Cream-opoly
description:
from the publisher's website:

It’s our nation’s favorite dessert! We all scream for ice cream! In fact, the average American eats 22 quarts of ice cream per year. We’re the ice cream capital of the world, producing over 1.5 billion gallons of ice cream each year. Seems like most of us just find the stuff to be irresistible!

Ice Cream-opoly is a game celebrating our love of this frozen delight. Players buy favorite ice cream flavors then increase property values by collecting Ice Cream Parlors and trading them in for Ice Cream Factories. It sounds easy enough but pay your double dip fee, get busted in a late night freezer raid, or have the really bad luck of developing Brain Freeze and it becomes a little more difficult, and a lot more fun!

So advance to Scoop! Who knows! You may soon be elected president of the Ice Cream Dream Team…or you may be buying Sugar-Free Toe-Phooey. Gather family and friends. This is one delicious game. And whatever happens, remember - not much goes wrong that a little ice cream won’t fix!

6 custom tokens: Ice Cream Cone, Spoon, Big Smile, Dairy Cow, Scoop, Sundae
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Lifestyles of the Poor and Disgusting
description: This is a roll and move game with no strategy. Basically, roll and hope to get one of the four things required to win (Food/Shelter/Clothing/Transportation). Oh yeah, theres are also spaces where players must "Take a Drink".

name: Spillet om Askepott
description:
Spillet om Askepott (The Cinderella Game) is a children's game where the players compete to become Cinderella. They have the following tasks to fulfill:


Find the Fairy Godmother to transform to a princess
Move to the ball
Find the watch to transform back
Try the lost shoe
Move to the castle again and marry the prince

name: Aladdin
description:
Based on Disney's Aladdin, the players compete to carry Aladdin's lamp to the Sultan's castle. But before the castle opens, they player's must match the cards on his/her hand with the cards laid out on the board.

A spinner decides if a player moves this turn, or if he/she is attacked by the evil Jafar.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Melodifantasi
description:
A team playing game where each turn, one team member gets an item to mime, sing or makes a sound of. If the rest of the team correctly guesses the item, they place a pawn on the board.

The first team to get four-in-a-row wins.

Also released in a travel edition.

name: Star Football
description: This game is based on Aussie Rules Football. Rolls of the dice dictate the direction that the ball heads in. A certain number of dice rolls are equivalent to each quarter of the game. At the end of four quarters the person or team with the highest score wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Disney Prinsessespillet
description:
There are 2 identically named games, the difference is in the picture of the princesses on the box.

Prinsesse Spillet with tiara
In Prinsessespillet (The Princess Game), the players try to get rid of their princess chips. One playing piece is moved around the board and determines if the active player gets to wear the tiara, loses one princess chip, or gives chips to another player.

When a player loses her/his last chip, he/she either wins (if having the tiara on their head), or loses (if not).

Contents:

- Game Board
- Tiara
- One playing piece
- 30 princess chips

Prinsesse Splillet w/o tiara
In Prinsessespillet (The Princess Game), the players have to match princesses with their beloved and find all the gifts of love, like ribbons roses, love letters. The winner is who finds all first.

Contents:

- Game Board
- 1 dice
- 6 playing piece
- 48 princess chips
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Geni Junior
description:
Junior Geni is a children's edition of the very popular Norwegian trivia game Geni, with simplified rules and different question categories.

The goal of this game is to answer one question correctly from each of the four categories, and then answer questions from two given categories, moving to the center of the board. The first player to reach the center is the winner.

Originally released in 1988, the game has been re-released with new questions and categories in 1995, 1998, 2000, 2003 and 2007.

Each game typically contains 250 cards, all with questions from all four categories, including 'Books and music', 'Our world', 'Nature', 'Entertainment', 'Science', varying from the different editions.

name: Kjendis på boks
description:
(Translated from the publisher's site in Norwegian)

Kjendis på boks (Celebrity in a box) is a completely new and hilarious game in the På boks (in a box) series. The game is based on the TV show "Kjendisjakten" (Celebrity hunt), which has been programmed at TV2 since the summer og 2004. The game has been developed in cooperation with the editorial staff of "Kjendisjakten" (RubiconTV).

People in general have great interest for what Hollywood stars, royalty, artists, jet setters and reality wannabes are up to. Therefore you have, together with your family and friends, the chance to hunt for celebrities around the living room table or in the cottage. Each player get to be "presenter" in turn. The object is to guess whom is hiding at the picture behind the pieces. Questions are picked from nine different categories like; movies, sport, culture, power and music.

The game is suitable for teenagers and adults.

name: Junior True or False
description:
Junior True or False is as the name suggests a children's edition of True or False, and has the following categories: "Nature and Animals", "Said and done", "Long time ago" and "Mixed".

Also includes the special die that gives bonus if the die has correct.

Contents:

Game Board
185 question cards
12 true or false cards
Two topic cards
Six pawns
One special die

name: Mimikk
description:
Mimikk (Mimicry) is a game where one player makes faces while the others try to recognize the grimace.

Each turn, a player draws a face card, and the other close their eyes while the first player try and mimic the face on the card (with help from the mirror).

When the player knocks the table, the other players can look at his or her face and try to find the corresponding face on the board.

Contents:

Game board
32 face cards
One mirror
Six pawns

name: Mikke Mus og jakten på B-gjengen
description:
In Mikke Mus og jakten på B-gjengen (Mickey Mouse and the Beagle Boys), the players must find three members of the Beagle Boys and return the stolen money to Uncle Scrooge. Each player gets one finger print card with three finger prints, and must find all thiefs with matching finger prints.

The player must move to houses around Duckburg to find either a Beagle Boy, Super Goofy, Chief O'Hara or the Phantom Blot.

Contents:

Game Board
Five pawns with feet
Two dice
Five finger print cards
15 finger print pieces
24 detective cards
90 gold coins
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Famo: The Historical Card Game
description: The game comes with 45 cards featuring famous people and the items associated with them. The people are Sir Walter Raleigh, Guy Fawkes, Florence Nightingale, Grace Darling, Robert Bruce, Admiral Nelson, Bodicca, Frances Drake, William Tell, James Watts and Dick Turpin. There is a joker and 11 sets of four cards - One a picture of the person and three of associated items. The game is a collecting (quartet) game

name: Cranium Ballpark Blast
description:
Made exclusively for Starbucks Coffee stores. Ballpark Blast uses dice and cards to play a three inning baseball based game. Game contains baseball diamond, 4 game movers, 2 dice representing pitch and hit, pencil, and a score pad. There are basic and advanced rules, both easy for a child to learn.

Game play consists of one player rolling the pitching die and another player the hitting die. Based on the outcome the hitter may draw a card which will indicate the base score an out.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Multimatch I
description:
The equipment for Multimatch I is a set of MacMahon's Three-Color Squares. This contains 24 squares representing all ways to divide a square into four equal triangles (with short edges along the square's diagonals) and color the triangles with 3 colors.

Wade E. Philpott sold a cardboard set of squares, including rules for several games and puzzles, beginning in 1966. Kadon distributed it beginning in 1982 and started producing an acrylic version in 1989.

The second edition Kadon rulebook (dated 1991) contains rules for 4 games, plus variants. The first three were originally designed by Philpott, although they have been changed slightly over the years; Closure was not in the original set and was presumably designed by Kate Jones.

The games are:

Multimatch. Players take turns placing tiles on the 5x5 gameboard. Edges must match and the first piece placed on a border of the board determines the color of that border. Last player wins.

Bingo. Players take turns placing tiles on the 5x5 grid, attempting to be the first to create a row of 5.

Outmatched. Players divide the tiles equally (face-down) and then race to assemble their group into a rectangle, with tile edges matching.

Closure. The tiles are assembled into a random (but edge-matching) group. Players take turns "closing" one of the 3 colors by moving as few tiles as possible. Closing a color requires leaving no exposed edges of that color. Moves may not separate any tiles from the group.

name: The Wacky Tobacky Dice Game
description:
From the publisher:

"The crazy game of pot slang! A player rolls the dice, then selects two of the dice and announces a unique two-word pot slang term. This term must make sense to the other players.
Examples are 'Bong Water', 'Pot Head', and 'Grass Brownies'. For 2-5 players."

name: Noddy-spillet
description:
The players searches for Noddy and his friends all around Toy Land by finding pieces of their puzzle.

The first player to complete his puzzle and return to the starting square is the winner.

Contents:

Game board
12 pices with Noddy and his friends
4 wooden pawns
4 puzzles
Die
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Puzzle, Transportation

name: Cues 'n Clues
description: This is a religious-themed party game aimed at members of the LDS (Mormon) church. The game mechanics are similar to those used in the game show $20,000 Pyramid, and involves competition between teams to identify words on a list from clues given by a team member within a time limit.

name: Scramble for Africa
description:
You try to conquer the most valuable African countries. If you want to attack another player you have to declare war on him first, allowing him to attack you first. Also, there can be only 4 people at war at the same time; the fifth declaration of war ends the oldest conflict.

It's very homemade, including the self-drawn components.

name: Mythes et Légendes: Le jeu des Univers Fantasy et SF
description:
Players in Mythes et Légendes tell a story about a hero with a pre-determind happy ending. Each turn, players add a card to the storyline and add to the story.

If the story makes no sense, other players can vote against the story and the storyteller loses his turn.

When all conditions for the happy ending are met, the first player playing a card with a black marker can tell the ending and win the game.

All cards in the game use artwork used in novels published by Pocket.

There are a few special ¨magic¨ cards that can change the course of the story.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Novel-based, Science Fiction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Storytelling, Voting

name: Gene Autry's Dude Ranch game
description: A simple roll and move game where players collect markers as the circle the board. Interestly, the flip side of the gameboard features a stock car racing game.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Undercover: The Game of Secret Agents
description: Spy themed game has players trying to find an escape route while avoiding enemy agents and hazards. Players use special "Infra-scope" goggles to help find and use underground supporters as they try to escape.

name: Show Business: The New Game from Emile Littler
description:
The Littlers - Emile, Prince & their sister Blanche were at one time the most powerful figures in the theatrical world of the West End & Provincial theater, with almost a total monopoly in producing musicals & pantomime in the UK.

This game was designed by Emile & was intended to give an interesting insight into the numerous hazards to the pursuit of stardom.

Players, starting from the Village Choir, would throw the dice & proceed along the track towards the School of Dramatic Art obeying the various directions on the way.

The correct number required must be thrown to finish on Stardom & the first player to reach here wins the game.

Amongst others Emile Littler was responsible for putting the young Radio & Variety star, Julie Andrews, into his pantomimes as the Princess in 'Aladdin' & this game is a delightfully produced & highly collectible period piece.

name: Sustainability
description:
Free downloadable (Australian) trivia boardgame about environmentalism. Answer 10 points worth of questions about people, the environment and economics, then reach the sustainable Earth space to win.

The board and the question cards are provided. You will need to provide 2 six-sided dice and optionally, an egg timer.

name: Zombie Basketball
description:
Zombie Basketball...

Enjoy the horror, the humour and the blood and guts of a game played by brave young men and shambling undead zombies.

Play against a friend or by yourself.

As a zombie team you can recruit new players from the opposing team... your bite is infectious and there is no cure.

As a human team... will your sharpshooter be good enough to keep the zeds off your back when you're going for the layup?

Try the game and claim some fame.

Zombie Basketball... are you man or are you meat?

name: Tank Trap
description: Although ostensibly about battles between tanks, this game is really an abstract strategy game with some superficial similarities to checkers. The game is played between two players who respectively move their tank pieces on an grid of squares in an effort to trap and destroy the other tanks. While the game has some interesting rules for movement and capture, the components are rather low budget--small cardboard circles for the tanks and a fold out paper map.

name: Moon Probe
description: This is a space race game consisting of a playing board depicting the flight to the moon, six different coloured plastic space ships, a set of instructions, and a dial with spinner. The first player to reach the moon and then make the return journey to earth is the winner. The game board is marked with a variety of bonuses and hazards that have consequences for the players as their moon probes make the journey.

name: Taxi Brousse
description:
Each player is a taxi driver in Africa.
The winner is the first player to arrive in Tchoukoutou with 30 000 F CFA to buy a new car to replace his old Peugeot breack 404 : a true Toyota minibus manufactured in Nigeria in Peugeot factories with Mercedes components coming from Libanon
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Make My Day Card Game
description: This is a card game with a political satire theme. Players take the role of world leaders and compete for power by accumulating positive public relations (PR) points for themselves and damaging the PR scores of other players. Game contents include rules, score pad, marking pen and 216 cards.

name: Seattleopoly
description: Seattleopoly is a Monopoly-style game which uses the theme of the city of Seattle, Washington (USA). Spaces on the gameboard represent well-known attractions, locations, and entities in Seattle. This game comes with: Playing Board, Surprise Cards, Treasure Cards, 2 Dice, Playing pieces, 25 Branch Offices, 15 Skyscrapers, Rules, and Money. The game was produced in connection with Seattle area charities.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: State Geography
description:
State Geography is a deck of cards featuring information about the 50 states of the United States of America. The game was published by AAA as a travel game.

The game includes rules for 5 different games that can be played with the cards:
State Memory Match
Go Travel
State Rummy
Wild World Six Draw
State War
The games are played by either looking at states that have contiguous borders or comparing information on the cards including population, total area and union entrance date.
The cards also include facts about each state and a map indicating where the state is in the union.

name: Qurush
description:
Playable with any 16 dice (25 in a four-player game) and some pawns, Qurush is a quick abstract game where each player is attempting to rearrange the dice to match a secret pattern they design before the game begins.

Full rules (and downloadable "qubes") are available at the Invisible City Productions website:

http://www.invisible-city.com/play/303/qurush

name: Granopoly
description:
Monopoly themed around the Village of Granville, Ohio to celebrate the Granville Bicentennial. Features many of the historic locations and businesses around the community.

The classic boardgame was inspired by Sam Kapland-Goland, created by Mrs. Jeanna Giovannell's 4th Grade Discovery Class of the Granville Intermediate School. This version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by acquiring businesses while avoiding charges for the customers. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Fate and Bicentenial Chest cards. The In Court and Loading Zones spaces replace the Free Parking and Jail spaces. A must for Ohio history fans.

name: Girocolor
description: Each player starts with one of four different game boards and all the puzzle pieces in the middle. Players spin on a color wheel and chose a matching colored puzzle piece that fits their board.

name: Cycling: A Fascinating Game
description:
A simple roll and move game in which players collect cards to overcome obstacles in their bicycle ride. Players roll the dice and advance their pawns on the gameboard. If player landed on certain squares with lamp, oilcan, et c., he takes the card with the item and may use it during the game, e.g., if he landed on squares 20/30 and he doesn't have lamp or bell he must go back to squres 5/18 and get one. There are 9 type of cards, 3 cards each.

Cyclist who reaches first the square with 100 wins the race.

name: Sternkrieg: A Game of Interstellar War
description:
Sternkrieg is a game of interstellar exploration and conquest. Each player represents a colony in the same 'constellation' (per the rules) which builds ships and sends them out to explore other regions, gaining raw materials which can be used to build more ships. Players can also use their ships to attack each other. Combat takes place either on a tactical hex grid (provided by the players, as would be the counters) or on a table using miniatures.

Ships and fortresses (which protect planets) are customizable, being built using a point system.

The game was first published in 1976, with a second edition released in 1977. The differences between the two are not known.
categories: Economic, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: Käpt'n Blaubär Sieben Weltmeere Kartenspiel-Sammlung
description:
Käpt'n Blaubär Sieben Weltmeere Kartenspiel-Sammlung contains 7 simple card games for children.

The game contains German language rules, 32 cards and 30 life belt shaped counters.

It is a promotional free gift game from Deutsche Postbank AG.

name: Game of Alice in Wonderland
description:
Part of Stoll & Edwards' "Two-Games-in-One" series, six games that each included a 16" x 16" board with a simple children's game on one side, usually involving familiar storybook characters, and a checkerboard on the other. Implements and rules were included for one game along with "a full set of checker men" (as a Stoll & Edwards catalog put it) for the other.

In this case, the "A" game is a simple spin-and-move race through the episodes of Lewis Carroll's Alice's Adventures in Wonderland (1865), including the Pool of Tears, the Caucus Race, the Mad Tea Party, and the Queen's Croquet Grounds. Occasional hazard spaces actually tend toward rewarding players, but occasionally they can force players to move back a few spaces or lose one or two turns.

The original Stoll & Edwards edition has a game board printed in three colors (black, orange and green). In their next incarnation as Stoll & Einson, the publisher reissued the game a decade later under their "Playjoy" brand, with board art utilizing a wider variety of colors and some illustrations revised to more strongly resemble Sir John Tenniel's famous book illustrations.

name: Velbert-Spiel
description: The counters represent companies, institutions, leisure facilities or restaurants. The players collect and exchange during the play process these counters, in order to settle it in as valuable a combinations on the play plan as possible. But they receive points, which are noted on the memo pad. Who collected most points at the end of the play or after several plays, wins.

name: Wrinkles in Time
description:
based on description from Angel Fire Site:

Two player card game based on the Time Quartet series of books by Madeleine L’Engle.
One player is the side of Good.
The other player is the side of Evil.

SETUP
Each player begins in possession of 3 Balance Tokens.

TURN SEQUENCE
Each turn has 10 phases:
Destiny Phase I
Fate Phase I
Challenge Phase I
Destiny Phase II
Fate Phase II
Challenge Phase II
Destiny Phase III
Fate Phase III
Challenge Phase III
Test Phase

DESTINY PHASES
Each player draws 7 cards from his deck.
If a Deck runs out, shuffle the discard and draw from it.

VICTORY
The First player to be in control of all 6 Balance Tokens is the winner.

name: Diagnostic
description:
A rally through Europe. Each player drives his car from Geneva to Paris. On their trip, players need to answer questions on car technique. When questions are answered incorrectly, their car is broke and needs help from the road-service cars.

Educational game on car technique

name: Condomania 2000
description:
Players start with $1,000,000 to buy Condominiums at exorbitant prices. Players attempt to buy the properties offering the highest return on their investment, and to own an entire block in order to double their rental income.

Players may gamble at the racetrack. They receive money each time they pass the employment office. They pay a fine or collect a bonus each time they pass the management office or the boardroom. They hit the jackpot when they land in the Country Club.

The game involves luck and management of finances.

Published in Scarborough, Ontario, Canada.

Also available in French.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Whooops!
description:
Each player controls a taxi & a pram. The taxis travel across the board for 10 shilling fares. The prams are used to block the progress of rival taxis.

Contents

1 x Playing board
4 x Taxis
4 x Prams
8 x Plastic bases
50 x 10 shilling notes
1 x Die
1 x Rules leaflet
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: TAASEN
description:
TAASEN
The Game Of Tryslmaistan Chess

A web published game, described as an analogue of Chess (but feeling closer to Checkers in depth). Played on a triangular board made up of triangles. Each player has three pieces. A third set of three pieces (white) is available for use by either play.

On your turn you may move one of your pieces or a white piece.

The objective is to remove your opponent's pieces from the board or immobilize them. Unlike chess, your pieces push your opponent's (and White's) pieces around into free spaces. If no space is free, then the pushed piece is removed.

This game was developed after appearing in the web comic "Unicorn Jelly".

The game's home page : http://www.unicornjelly.com/taasen1.html

name: Maatilakierros
description:
Maatilakierros is a simple children's game where players move around the farm by rolling the dice. The dice is not numbered but instead has different colors on its side. On blue, green, yellow and orange you get to move to the next circle with the appropriate color, on red you move backwards and on white you do not move at all. The winner is the player who reaches the last circle first.

The components are nice - the dice is big, as is the board which is constructed from over 30 pieces. Soft and cute animals (a cat, a dog, a pig and a cow) are used as player tokens.

name: Motor Rally Formula One
description: This is a basic roll and move game where players compete to race on a hexagonally shaped track by rolling the dice and dealing with the traffic icons/rules they encounter.

name: Coronation St. DVD Game
description:
Test your knowledge of Coronation Street as you journey to Roy's Rolls, Underworld, the Corner Shop and, of course, the Rovers Return, while watching clips and answering questions about one of television's most beloved soaps.

How much do you remember about Stan and Hilda or Jack and Vera? What about the love triangle between Ken, Deirdre and Mike or the one between Mike, Linda and Mike's son, Mark? How much do you really know about Roy and his transsexual wife Hayley, Tracy's mystery baby or the Weatherfield One? Find out as you compete for chips and trophies in this game that will prove just how "street smart" you really are.

This interactive DVD board game contains more than 700 questions across 6 different categories using clips, stills and story lines from this popular British soap opera. Question categories include : Families, Workplace, Romance, Rovers, Feuds and Friendship. Includes 12 Pub Quiz 'Beermats', featuring questions about the characters in the soap.
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Only Oregon Trivia
description:
Teams of one or more players travel around the state of Oregon answering questions about Oregon and collecting the six different colored wood chips. The first team to return to its home town having collected a wood chip of each color wins the game.

The wood chips and corresponding categories of questions are:
1. Blue Spruce - history, politics and business
2. White Fir - Oregonians
3. Red Cedar - Arts, Entertainment and Education
4. Black Walnut - Sports
5. Green Douglas Fir - Portland
6. Yellow Hemlock - Geography and Environment

name: Grips
description: Similar to Mastermind - In this game, guess which letter from A-K in a calculation stands for which number from 0-9.

name: Party Games
description:
From the back of the box:

Break the ice, start a friendly family feud, or pump up the
volume of silliness at your next soiree. The Party Games deck features crowd-pleasing classics such as Charades and Spoons as well as soon-to-be-favorites like LoveUm or Hate Um, and Three on the Couch. The fifty games and inventive mixers included in Party Games are guaranteed to get your party rolling.

This is a collection of 50 slightly oversized cards each containing instructions on a party game. Some originals, and some not.

name: EMS Challenge
description:
EMS Challenge - the game that challenges emergency medical professionals! EMS Challenge is a take on the trivia board game intended to be an enjoyable method of reviewing information pertaining to professionals in the pre-hospital care field.

On your turn you must answer a trivia question from one of four categories: definitions, medical terminology, anatomy and physiology, or miscellaneous. A correct answer entitles you to roll the die and advance.

Special squares mix up play slightly including "pick your category" spaces, "player to the right picks your category" spaces, and time trials which are small tasks with a time limit (i.e. roll a 1 in five seconds) and give small rewards (advance one space)

The game contains 400 question cards, 4 tokens, a die, a game board, and instructions.

name: Think of a Word
description:
A leader secretly selects a word then players take turns guessing its letters, yet the game expands upon the familiar Hangman concept.

The leader’s word must contain the letters shown on three cards drawn from a deck containing letters of the alphabet. A player’s guess must state both a letter and the numerical position within the word. The leader will declare the guess to be “Right”, “Wrong”, or “Almost”, where the latter indicates a valid letter but not at that position.

Printed score sheets allow players to track the progress of all guesses. Individual players score a point for each “Right” guess, and get another turn. The leader scores points for all the “Wrong” and “Almost” guesses. The role of leader passes for multiple rounds.

Open ended number of players, can be executed as a party game.

name: 2gether
description:
A party game where you must use your whole body to be ably to win. You play in teams and work together to succeed the different tasks your team gets. Example on tasks can be; get your team to act like famous statues, move a ball around team without using your hands, show one feeling with your mouth and the opposite feeling with your body etc.

You can read more about the game at www.2gether.se

name: Jeepers Leapers
description:
Jeepers Leapers is a children's game suitable for Ages 3 - 6.
"Catch the most frogs before they leap off their lily pads!"

Foam frogs are placed randomly in the holes on a rotating board (the lily pads). A pair of dice with coloured sides are rolled and all the players dive to grab frogs that match the colours on the dice. For example, if the colours red and blue are rolled, then either blue frogs on red lily pads or red frogs on blue lily pads can be collected.
