Players are awarded point tokens for the frogs they hold, and the frogs are returned to the pond. The board is then rotated so each frog is now on a different coloured lily pad.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: NASCAR: Chase for the Nextel Cup 2007
description:
From the press release:

The new for 2007 game features drivers who qualified for The 2007 Chase for the NASCAR Nextel Cup, which is NASCAR’s version of playoffs. The 12 drivers who are highlighted in the game along with their race cars are: Jimmie Johnson, Jeff Gordon, Tony Stewart, Carl Edwards, Kurt Busch, Denny Hamlin, Martin Truex Jr., Matt Kenseth, Kyle Busch, Jeff Burton, Kevin Harvick and Clint Bowyer. The drivers were determined Sept. 8 after the Chevy Rock and Roll 400 race at Richmond International Speedway.

Players race around the racetrack game board, trying to be the first to cross the finish line for the 10 races that make up The Chase. They collect chips for the races they win, and the player with the most race chips at the end of the game is the winner.

Along the way, players try to avoid the Crash Zone and Pit Road but zoom forward when they land on a Drafting Advantage space or play a Pass Card. The game board also has several Chase Challenge spaces, which might help lucky players take the lead or avoid a crash. Players who aren’t so lucky might be warned about changing track conditions or a tire that’s losing air.

name: Eierlauf
description: This is a twist on the usual game in which participants compete in a race while they balance an egg on a spoon. In this one, 10 different items are given to 2 teams of children. You can try to stack as much items on your balancing sticks as you want whenever it is your turn to race, but you risk slower speed, and if any of the items fall, it is back to the starting point. But if you succeed in bringing a stack of items from the start to finish, then you can leave the items at the end point and go back to the starting point to pick up some more or pass to the next player in your team. The team that completes all the items first wins.

name: In the Money
description:
Subtitled "The City Of London Send-Up Game", In The Money allows players to choose a city career and try to make it to the top as a banker, lawyer, stockbroker, accountant or property dealer.

Players attempt to create a valuable team to help them get to the top - blackmail, stress, death, nepotism and luck all feature in this game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mechanic Mac
description: This spin-and-move game, with players moving their colored pawns around a winding track. The spinner features a picture of an old car losing its fender.

name: Benjamin Blümchen: Gute-Nacht-Geschichten
description:
Benjamin Blümchen Gute-Nacht-Geschichten is a storytelling game where different cards make up the story. Different game variants are included. Categories for the stories include places, symbols, persons, weather.

Ages 3 and up. Released: Essen 2007.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Quest: A Family Home Evening Game
description:
Quest A Family Home Evening Game is a religious trivia game designed for members of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints. It is designed for family members to play on "Family Home Evenings" but is also appropriate for other church gatherings.

Players begin at Earth and follow a "Strait and Narrow Path" (a phrase from Mormon scripture) to the Celestial Kingdom. Players advance by answering up to four religious questions per turn. Odd numbered questions are about faith/religious knowledge and even numbered questions are about Good Works. Each questions answered increases the number of spaces the player can move.

If a player answers a Faith question incorrectly, his or her turn is over. If he or she answers a Good Works question incorrectly, then the pawn is moved off the Strait and Narrow Path and onto a detour, which lengthens the route to heaven.

The first person to make it to the Celestial Kingdom is not the winner. Also, the rules encourage helping players that are falling behind. The game ends when all players arrive, thus emphasizing that Families should work together so that everyone makes it to heaven.

name: Interplay
description:
Interplay is a relatively simple abstract strategy game. Play is conducted with metal pegs on a wooden board. When placing a new peg, players place a peg 3 spaces away from the previously played one - either straight, diagonally, or in an L shape.

Players score points for every peg adjacent (orthogonally or diagonally) to the peg they place. A round ends when all 37 pegs are placed (or if, due to the gameplay, no further pegs can be placed).

name: "Play Ball"
description: In 1978, most Topps baseball cards had an at-bat result on the back, like Fly Out, Double, or Ground Out. These were to be used in a two-player game. A few of the cards had the complete rules on them. Players would take turns playing three-out innings, pulling cards from the top of a deck and scoring runs (if any) until three outs were drawn, at which point the turn would pass to the other player. The game would be played to nine innings, with extra innings in the case of ties.

name: Cranium Grab & Go Checkers Extreme
description:
From the publisher:

Checkers with fun Cranium twists!
Compact package makes it ideal for travel
Fun for kids -- and adults!
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones
A fun, affordable gift for family and friends
Are you the king of king me? Get your hands on Checkers Extreme!

Play checkers the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists, like a 6-sided die and special Cranium spots on the board.

What's in the box? Checkers Extreme includes 24 green and yellow checker tokens, 6 checker crowns, the game board, and a 6-sided die.

name: Reward
description:
With marbles and dice, reward money and a villain trying to hide, this game is played on a 3D plastic board. Find the villain and be careful not to fall down the mountain.

The box cover features a head shot of the villain, who is wearing a white hat and has a large mustache.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Edgar Bergen and Charlie McCarthy's Flying Hat Game
description:
This is a children's Game base on the vintage TV Characters Edgar Bergen and is dummy Charlie McCarthy.

It is a simple dexterity game of flicking the "hats" into the game Tin.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Apostolos
description:
From the rules:

Apostle lets you take the role of a first-century apostle of Christ. Each player controls one or more Christian workers who start churches, help them grow, and protect them against false doctrines. You often have to choose between starting a new church or strengthening an existing one; improving your own churches or aiding another player in trouble; and spending score points on a new worker or saving them for a higher score. Hopefully, as you play this game, you'll appreciate what our missionaries have to go through today.

name: The Wars of David
description: The Wars of David is a two-player game set in ancient times: "Ancient warfare between the kingdom of Israel and her eight angry neighbors".

name: Quizmo Multiplication Division
description: An educational lotto game, featuring multiplication and division. Quizmo is a game that helps children understand and memorize the basic number facts in multiplication and division. It is played like Bingo. Cards are double sided, multiplication on one side, division on the other. Mark off answers to math problems on the card.

name: Mystic Egyptian Tomb
description:
From the back of the box:

Dig and find the treasures buried in the mysterious egyptian tomb. Play a treasure hunting board game with the game sheet, and checkers dug out from the treasure. It's exciting. it's cool.

Contains a plaster block with treasures buried inside, specially designed digging tool, a game sheet (420mm x 594mm) where you play you adnenture game, checkers and dice included (to be dug out from the plaster block). Rules of the game are printed on the game sheet. Game for 2 to 4 players. Treasures include: Egyptian cat model, mummy case, Ankh-symbol of life, winged necklace, Egyptian symbol plates.

name: Spooky Scary Math Games
description:
This 2001 sequel to Spooky Math Games is packaged as a thin staple bound book with 5 glow in the dark dice. The book presents a collection of 14 dice rolling games, each with a strong basis in math and each with a kid-friendly spooky theme.

Concepts covered in the games include basic arithmetic, fractions and simple probability.

The games in this volume are:


Roll the Bones
Poltergeist
Snake Eyes
Tiptoe Through the Tombstones
Secret Potion
Insect Attack
Quicksand
GHOST
E.S.P.
Grim Reaper
Stroke of Midnight
Into the Basement
Bats in the Attic
Caught in the Web


Predecessor:

Spooky Math Games

name: The Major Matt Mason Space Exploration Game
description:
Comment from Keith Meyer's site:

" If a kid wasn't satisfied with the ever increasing popularity of the Major Matt Mason toy line, and just couldn't get enough of the toys themselves or the compliment of non-toy items such as note book binders, wallets, puzzles, etc.... There was this really cool looking boardgame! Not a great game, but hey, it's Major Matt Mason so we had to love it!.

The object of play was to explore the moon for signs of life. The first explorer who returns to the space ship and is able to point out where there are three signs of life-- as shown by the moon cards--is the winner.
"

Keith Meyer's MMM collector's site entry:
http://www.majormattmason.net/5453.htm

name: Salt Lakeopoly
description: Salt Lakeopoly is a clone of Monopoly designed by an advertising agency. The real estate squares are all advertisements for Salt Lake City businesses, sports teams, and media. The rules state that the proceeds from the sale of this game are donated to medical research.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Red Square
description:
Red Square is a very rare Monopoly-style board game with a Soviet theme that was marketed in 1990 (with a copyright of 1988).

Unlike Monopoly, Red Square players compete for privileges -- not properties -- to move up the Soviet social ladder through their status in the Soviet Military and Communist Party. Players acquire wealth by buying and selling on the black market and correctly answering trivia questions about Soviet society and other Russian curiosities.

The winner is the first person to weave their way through the three social classes and make it to Red Square. Players exchange their privileges to move to the next social level -- a concept that is known as nomenklatura in Russian.

name: Kvikmyndaspilið
description: In Kvikmyndaspilið (The Movie Game), players form teams (three in each team is best although two player teams can work) and act out scenes from a movie to make their team members guess which movie it is. The opposite team usually chooses the movie and one player of the team tries to act out the scene in less than two minutes. If the team members guess correctly, they can roll the dice and move along the track. Those who are deemed to act exceptionally well get The Oscar statue which gives +1 on a die roll.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Blight of the Living Dead
description:
This is a game based off of a map product, Master Plan: Necropolis, also published by UKG. In "Blight of the Living Dead", up to six players can act as fantasy adventurers seeking out the Lord of the Night (also a player) in the necropolis while battling undead minions and searching chests for treasure that will aid them.

It is a simple game with combat handled by opposed die rolls with variable undead reinforcement also handled by dice.


NOTE: You MUST have the Master Plan: Necropolis product (or just make your own) to make use of this game! **
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Rivers & Rods
description: Rivers and Rods is an LDS-themed variant of Chutes and Ladders. Players navigate through a map of Book of Mormon lands. When they land on the beginning of an iron rod, they can skip several places to go to the end of it and when they land on the beginning of a river they are likewise sent backward. As with many other religiously themed games, the rules specifically state that the first person to reach the end is not the winner; rather, everyone who reaches the end is the winner.

name: Shangzhou-Gold
description:
From Invisibile City Games:

"Area Shangzhou-Gold (64 new sectors!) just opened for development on CyberNet. Your corporation has obtained partially-exclusive initial development (and exploitation) rights to this potentially lucrative market. Your goal? Secure your company’s control over the area by either controlling all four Critical Nodes, laying exclusive claim to more than half of the sectors (33+), or accumulating enough Clout to pay off the regulating officials."

The game can be played with a chessboard, some tokens and tiles printed from Invisible City's website:

http://www.invisible-city.com/play/463/shangzhou-gold
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Tile Placement

name: Arthur's Picture Path Bingo
description: Designed for ages 3 to 6, with no reading requirements. The object of the game is to build a path from the colored edge on one side of the bingo board to the same color on the other edge.

name: Sackgasse
description:
"Sackgasse" (=blind alley") was published in the German magazine Pöppel-Revue 1/86 as "Spiel im Heft".

The board shows a map of a fictive city with a muddle of streets. The streets are marked with large dots, who divide them in several sections.

Both players have only 3 tokens. They are brought into play under the "rule of distance": no token is allowed to be too near of another one, that is it must respect a minimal distance of 3 dots to any other token.

Each turn, a player must move his tokens by 6 dots in total, but he must attack at least 1 opposing token by placing a token on an adjacent dot. Therefore, a move will always begin with a retreat of the attacked token. If it's not possible to reestablish the rule of distance for that token, it is eliminated.

Winner of the game is the player who eliminates 2 opposing tokens first.

name: Fleet Street
description:
Fleet Street is a set collecting game based on buying and selling newspapers. The value of a set depends on how up market the publications are - lowest points are awarded for evening papers (6) then provincials (16), then dailies (24), then Sundays (32) then weeklies (40) then magazines (48). The players don't wait turns but on the word "Go" from the dealer start shouting the name of the paper they want to sell by trading cards. The first to collect a complete set and lay them down shouts "Fleet Street" and scores the points for that set. The cards are reshuffled and dealt again. Winner is the first to reach 250 points.
Each of the 48 newspapers/magazines have their own individual depiction of the front page - the magazines are especially colorful.

name: Barrier
description:
This game is played on an empty NxN square board (such as a 7x7 board).

Each player drops his stone on an empty cell. On each turn, each player must move his stone. The stone moves similar to a chess Knight, but in two steps rather than one. First it moves one (two) cell(s) in one direction, then two (one) cell(s) orthogonally (hence each player has two moves per turn). All positions moved to or jumped over turn into an impenetrable barrier for both players (i.e., they cannot be moved into or jumped over).

Whoever leaves his opponent with no move first wins.

name: Boppin' Bee
description: Use your flower bopper to snatch the honey chip from the Boppin' Bee as he buzzes around in a circle. Snatch more honey chips than your opponents and you'll be the winner!

name: Maisy's First Game Book
description:
Description from publishers web page:

Let the games begin! Join Maisy and her friends in a mad dash around the supermarket, collect the gold crowns in a terrific treasure hunt, and race for the finish line in a totally grand Grand Prix. With its built-in spinner and a selection of game pieces, MAISY'S FIRST GAME BOOK has everything preschoolers need to play five fantastic, fun-packed board games, Maisy-style.

Spin the spinner and see if you’re a winner with this bright, bold book of simple, lively games. One more way to be crazy for Maisy!
categories: Animals, Book, Children's Game, Educational, Racing

name: Daily Mail Footer-Pool
description: The box of this Chad Valley game from 1950 says that this is a thrilling novelty game and is not a pool solver. Cover features famous football "soccer" players from the times.

name: Brooklands Automobile Racing Game
description: CHAD VALLEY BROOKLANDS Automobile Racing Game which features 6 lead racing cars and a very pretty track with all kinds of areas on it that cause special circumstances to happen.

name: Cha·Do: Das Tee-Spiel
description:
A promotional game (subtitled "The Tea Game") based on Alex Randolph's and Michael Matschoss' Enchanted Forest (this is not credited on the box or in the rules; it is obviously produced by Ravensburger though also uncredited).

Dethlefsen & Balk is a tea merchant and so the players travel over a world map where 13 small cardboard tea trees with different symbols on their underside are placed on cities connected to the tea industry.

Players may look under trees and memorize their symbol to collect cards (lying in Hamburg) with the matching symbols.

Some spaces force a player to draw an event card.

name: Heroic Frenzy: Petrograd 1919
description:
In July 1919, General Yudenich was made Commander-in-chief of the Northwestern army of the Whites, and was recognized by Kolchak as his representative. In August, with the aid of England and Esthonia, the Russian “Northwestern Government” was established. Yudenich’s planned Fall offensive was timed to coincide with the pinnacle of the White’s success, as Denikin approached Orel and Tula, the munitions-manufacturing center. From there it was only a short distance to Moscow. Heroic Frenzy covers the battle for Petrograd during this time.

The map scale is about 3-3.5 miles per hex. Each aircraft unit represents one aircraft, each tank unit equals one AFV (armored fighting vehicles), and each armor car unit represents three armor cars. White units are brigades (X), battalions (II). Red units are brigades (X). A game turn represents two days.
categories: Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: East vs. West (Chess)
description:
You've all wondered about it. Some have even argued about it. Now you can play it for yourself to see which side would win.

This game was developed to help cross-understanding of the two different chess systems.

One side plays with the Western Chess pieces, the other with the Chinese Chess pieces.

Due to the differences in western and eastern chess boards, both halves of the board retain the characteristics of each side. The number of squares have been increased to accommodate the slightly larger Chinese chess board. A central row on the Chinese chess side terminates at the "river" to merge into the western chess board. Units playing at the central row interface play as per normal but with a termination at the end of the row. Bishops and Queen moving along the diagonal will side-step across the central row to maintain the same colour of squares.

Because of Eastern initial advantage checkmating with catapults in first move, West starts.

All usual rules apply.


Western - King - 1 step in any direction
Eastern - jiàng/shuai (General/Marshal) - 1 step in any direction (restricted to within fortress) (Korean Chess Rules)
Western - Queen - moves diagonally and vertically/horizontally
Eastern - shì (Scholar/Official) - 1 step in any direction (restricted to within fortress) (Korean Chess Rules)
Western - Bishop - moves diagonally
Eastern - xiàng (Elephant/Minister) - moves in 2 step diagonals (blocked by a piece along its diagonal) (cannot cross river)
Western - Knight - moves in 2/1 step "L" (blocked by a piece along the long side of the "L" when in Eastern territory)
Eastern - ma(Horse/Cavalry) - moves in 2/1 step "L" ( blocked by a piece along the long side of "L" when in Eastern territory)
Western - Castle - moves vertically/diagonally
Eastern - ju (Chariot/Wagon) - moves vertically/diagonally
Eastern - pao (Catapult/Cannon) - moves vertically/horizontally, takes enemy piece by leaping over another piece
Western - Pawn - 1 step forward, takes enemy piece 1 step diagonally (1 or 2 step opening move)
Eastern -zu/bing (Private/Soldier) - 1 step forward (across the river, 1 step vertically/horizontally)


Other rules;
Western Chess Unique Rules
1. Castling
2. Pawns resurrect to any previously "taken" piece upon reaching the end of board <-- no longer applies

Chinese Chess Unique Rules
1. Horses/Cavalry are blocked by pieces straddling the long leg of L <-- only within Eastern Territory
2. Elephants/Ministers are blocked by pieces straddling the diagonal
3. Privates/Soldiers can move horizontally upon crossing the river
4. General/Marshal and Shi cannot exit the fortress except when jumping out to kill opposing King in direct line of sight
5. Elephants/Ministers cannot cross the river

Some Game specific basic notes:
1. West always moves first (or East checkmates with his catapult in 1 move)
2. Korean Chess rules will be used in the case of the Eastern General and both Shi. They can now move both horizontally and diagonally along the fortress lines
3. The Eastern General retains the ability to jump in order to "take" the Western King but not vice-versa so the Western King needs to avoid "seeing" the Eastern General
4. The Western horse upon crossing the river into Eastern territory, will be subjected to the same blocking (horse-leg) rule as Eastern cavalry whilst in Eastern territory
5. The Eastern cavalry upon crossing the river into Western territory, will no longer be subjected to the blocking (horse-leg) rule whist in Western territory
6. The Western pawn no longer has the ability to upgrade to another previously "taken" piece upon reaching the end as it does so within the Eastern board

An article on the game was published in the German daily "Neues Deutschland" (transl.: "New Germany"), 22nd September 2007. http://www.nd-online.de/artikel.asp?AID=116589&;IDC=27

For more info: http://www.act.com.sg/eastvswest/

name: Flying Aces
description:
This is a game of aerial battles.

Each player gets 3 planes and using dice they move them from their take-off (starting) points onto the battle map. The planes follow the paths in circular movement resembling a "dog fight" in the air, for position.
Using the roll of the dice the player may move 1, 2 or all 3 of his planes. Doubles earns an extra roll of the dice, but only twice in a row. If he jumps over an enemy plane by a roll of the dice it is considered shot down.

When only one player's planes are left on the board the game is over and the owner is declared the winner.

name: Quick Flip
description: This is a great way to teach number systems to children. The deck of cards (which is divided into suits of 10 cards each, the suits are words, Arabic numerals, Roman numerals, hash marks, and objects) is divided evenly into 2 piles. 2 starter cards are placed face-up in the center, and 4 cards placed in front of each player. Both players work to get rid of their cards by placing them on top of the starter cards in a sequential manner (ie, 2 on 3, 8 on 9, etc...) while keeping 4 cards in front of him at all times. the first player to get rid of his or her cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Number

name: Pirater på strövtåg
description:
Pirates on a ramble.

Take your ship and find the treasure. Please let the weather be with you so you don't end up on the bottom of the ocean. If you are lucky and find the treasure you have to safely get it back to your harbor, but other pirates can still take it away from you. Happy hunting...
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fun on the Farm Game
description: All of the animals have escaped into the field! Build yourself an animal pen and help collect as many animals as possible before the sun goes down. Collect the most to win the game. A simple enjoyable game of farm fun!

name: I Can Read Game
description:
From game box:
Children discover the thrill of reading with this fun, hands-on learning game.

- Identify shapes using 3-D cloth game pieces
- Practice letter recognition
- Spell and read simple words
- Two levels of play
- 1 to 4 players
- Ages 3 - 7

name: Ötökkäjahti
description: The players are trying to get rid of their chips. The dice are rolled, one showing a color and the other a type of a bug. The player who first puts his chip on a tile matching to both the dice gets rid of a chip. The first player to get rid of all of his chips is the winner. The name of the game means bug hunt.

name: Sealord Rule the waves
description:
An Exciting Sea-battle game - where the weather can be more dangerous than your opponent.

Manoeuvre your fleet of galleons to capture your opponents sailing Admiral before you are caught yourself. You navigate your fleet on treacherous seas and are constantly threatened by unpleasant surprises.

Flow of play is simple. Each player have four ships. One of them has the admiral. Each player can, on his turn move one ship two spaces, attack adjacent enemy ships and let the admiral change the ship his on. You can only do this to adjacent ships in your own colour.
The player who sinks the opponent players ship with his admiral on it wins.

Contents:
1 game board
12 playing pieces 10 galleons, 2 Admirals
1 top compass
1 point table
2 marker tags (small galleons)
1 black dice
1 white (wind) dice

name: In Your Face!
description:
The object of In Your Face! is to get rid of all your cards before the other players do. Play the same color or number on the discard pile, or play Wild Cards. The game is played to an agreed upon score. The player with the fewest points at the end of the game is the winner.

When a player plays a wild card and tells you to draw a card, three cards, or lose a turn, if you have an IN YOUR FACE card you can play it and that player has to do what he/she told you to do, unless that player plays another IN YOUR FACE card, then you must draw or lose a turn.

name: Minnesota On Board
description: Minnesota On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the US state of Minnesota. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit Bolder Options.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Prince Edward Island On Board
description: Prince Edward Island On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the Canadian province. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Junior Achievement of PEI.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Woodlands On Board
description: The Woodlands On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in Texas. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Rotary Club of the Woodlands.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fast Car
description:
"Enjoy the thrills and action of stock car racing in this exciting board game. Race on either of the 2 tracks with as many as 8 racers"

Roll & move racer with a NASCAR flavor but without a NASCAR license. Board is double-sided with a standard oval track on one side and a road course on the other.

Roll & move mechanic is modified by "Lap Cards" and "Track Cards." Track cards [denoted by icons on the board] present move bonuses or penalties.

Drawn as a driver completes a lap, Lap Cards give drivers various numbers of points, instruct drivers whether or not to pit, or present drivers the opportunity to send an opponent to the pits.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gee Wiz Racing Game
description:
This game features a fly wheel and a starting grid for 6 horses. From the rules: Before running the race be certain that all horses are lined up evenly at the barrier (starting point) and that all the flags at the opposite end of the track are lowered. To operate, hook loop in string over the pin in the shaft and wind by turning the fly wheel away from you 5 or 6 times. Then hold the game down with one hand and give a vigorous pull toward you. This should keep the fly wheel spinning with enough power to carry all of the horses the complete length of the track to the point where the flags go up. As the horses finish the flags rise, for instance if the white flag goes up then the white horse has won the race and the flags go up in corresponding sequence as the horses all "come in". To line up the horses for the next race simply pass the string in front of the horses and draw them back to the start line. All horses have an equal chance of winning the race because once the race starts no one can have control of the action of the horses.

The rules then go on to say that in some instances dirt or dust can retard the forward motion of a horse. To avoid this, the grooves in the tracks should be kept clean by occasional use of a soft cloth. Also a drop of lubricating oil on the bearing at each end of the fly wheel now and then is advisable and that GEE-WHIZ should be played on an even and level surface.
publishers: (Unknown), Distribuzione Associata Giocattoli, Wolverine Supply & Manufacturing Co.

name: Zotto
description:
From the box - "The addictive word game of chance and strategy. Form as many three to four letter words as you can by joining letters up, down, side-to-side, and diagonally."

There is a pop-o-matic type bubble which creates random letter sequences. Players write down letters in their own 4x4 grid and try to form 3&4 letter words.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Spelling, Tile Placement

name: Hellup!
description: A simple roll-and-move racing game, where the players use the cards in their hands, or cards stolen from their opponents, to avoid snakes, sharks, volcanoes and crocodiles on their race to the finish.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Totally Untested Volume 2 of Max's Advanced Rules for Axis & Allies
description:
The sequel to Max's Advanced Rules for Axis & Allies, adding ten more variant rules. This is twelve 5.5 x 8.5 pages long, only seven of which are rules. Most of the new rules require Max's original variant in addition to Axis & Allies itself (geekgame 98). The new rules are:
A. Extreme Limitations on Russia's First Turn
B. Relocation of Russian Factories
C. German Night Bombers
D. German and British Night Fighters
E. Survival of Fighter Pilots Shot Down Over Friendly Territories
F. Survival of Fighter Pilots Shot Down Over Occupied Sea Zones
G. Indian Independence Movement
H. Transoceanic Supply Lines and Limited Attacks
I. Finland
J. Artillery Bombardment Attacks

Expands:

Axis & Allies and Max's Advanced Rules for Axis & Allies
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Klomp-it
description:
From the box: "An exciting game for 2 to 4 players featuring Walt Disney characters photographed in 3-D at Disneyland and Walt Disney World."

A Disney game based around the View-master, a plastic stereoscopic toy. Two viewers are included, as are four reels of images. Each player has their own three-by-three board along with a number of cards and a "Klomper," a colored suction-cup pawn of some sort.

name: Wer spart gewinnt
description: Simple children's dice game. Go around the board and pick up event cards depending on what field you get. Either get or pay money. For example: You get your pocket-money (5 DM). You help your dad washing the car (3 DM). You have lost your pencil. (2 DM) You buy an ice (1 DM)... If get around back to the start field you can put money on your savings book for which you yield interests on special fields. The winner is the first player to amount 200 DM.

name: Kokoa kuva
description:
Game for children Ages 4 and up.

Kokoa kuva (Build a picture) is a nice game full of funny animal pictures. One animal picture is formed of two cards. In the game you search the cards and then you can build the picture.

It's a colorful memory game that even the youngest in the family can win. Precise observations and good memory are keys to victory.

By combining cards you can create 552 funny animals like "mousebat" or "fishduck".

name: Eendenjacht
description:
From the back of the box


The aim of the game is to shoot down the ducks of your colour.
Put balls into your handset according to the colour of your choice.
Press the house in the center of the turntable to start the game
Shoot to knock down the ducks of your colour as they swirl around. Beware! Do not knock down the other coloured ducks as your opponents will have the advantages!
The first person to shoot down all the ducks of his colour is the winner

name: The Denbury Resources Oil Game
description:
[From the "Rules of the Game" booklet]:

OBJECTIVE
The object of the Oil Game is to add the most oil reserves by taking carbon dioxide from Jackson Dome to the old oil fields in the region.

Each player "transports" carbon dioxide along the pipeline by moving his/her token along the pipeline and claims the tertiary oil reserves from each oil field that is reached.

The winner is the player who either accumulates the most oil or reaches the winning target for the number of competitors playing.

Remember that this game differs from the real world because Denbury had the only carbon dioxide source in the area. Effectively, it's like playing this game with only one player!

-
-

[comment by tcanderson71, an oil geologist in Wyoming]: Actually, this is very much like the real world -- here in Wyoming, there is only one current CO2 supply, owned and controlled by ExxonMobil, located in the LaBarge Field in southwestern Wyoming. It feeds into a CO2 pipeline delivering it to Chevron in Rangely Field in northwest Colorado, then Anadarko Petroleum at Monell Field and Merit Energy in the Lost Soldier and Wertz Fields (south-central Wyoming), and finally to Anadarko at the Salt Creek Field in east-central Wyoming.

name: The Little Engine That Could
description:
This game recreates the story of "The Little Engine That Could." Each player is a toy trying to get over the mountain and into the city. There are four toy choices: a teddy bear, a plush elephant, a doll, and a monkey wearing a fez.

The first player is the player with the closest upcoming birthday and spins the arrow. The spinner has blue squares, yellow stars, pink hearts, purple triangles, and green clowns. If the player spun to the green clown, the player takes a second turn. A player that ends his or her turn at the bridge can take a shortcut. The first person to get to the city wins.

name: Goppa: The Game That Moves In Leaps & Bounds
description:
A 2-player, 3-dimensional variation on Chinese Chess. Players take turns making Chinese Chess style moves and leaps, but over a set of square grids that are staggered at different levels. The board consists of 6 tiles, each having 16 spaces arranged in a 4x4 square. The tiles are staggered in 3 different heights, and 3d moves are permitted between the tiles. Players make extended Chinese checker jumps with their 16 marbles, trying to maneuver them in to opposing setup region.

---

From the Box (bad grammar authentically transcribed):
"If you enjoy the strategy of Chinese Checkers, the challenge of Backgammon you're sure to have a blast playing Goppa.

Object of the Game. To be the first player to move all 16 of your marbles from your starting positions, across to the starting positions of your opponents marbles.

Helpful Hints. There are 8 main strategic points on the game board. These 8 points allow you to slow your opponent from making Goppa's (long jumps) from one side of the board all the way to the other side of the game board in one turn."

name: Pinky
description:
I'll seek some clarification on this, but here is what I can glean at present:

Pinky is a large pink plastic pig that looks like a traditional piggy bank. Set in Pinky's back is a slot which has a switch and a speaker, so that the game counts when players put in coins and occasionally "oinks". It seems from the rules that players are putting coins in Pinky from a communal stock, but on a certain die-roll get to shake the pig to get coins back out; the coins that come out are a player's score pile for the end of the game.

name: Puzzle Memo
description: Puzzle Memo is a combination of Memory and a puzzle. Each player gets a board with an animal (elephant, lion, hippo, zebra) - divided in 12 spaces. The 48 tiles are spread face down on the table and show a part of the 4x12 images on the player boards. On your turn you flip a tile and see if it fits your puzzle/animal. Whoever finishes his/her puzzle first, wins.

name: Cashspiracy
description:
Players purchase businesses and receive a Return On Investment (ROI) for each business owned. Each “ROI” is based on the risk associated with that business.

Unpredictable dynamics are created by the “News”, “Fate”, and “Cashspiracy” cards which introduce world events affecting business owners throughout the game.

Players request Lines of Credit from the World Bank to increase their “Return On Investment”. However, as in real life, discretion must be used with credit! While not costing anything initially, a $50,000 interest payment must be made for each Line of Credit each time a player goes around the board.

Each player must maintain a passport to buy businesses and to collect “ROI”. If a player loses their passport, their income rights are revoked. But, they are still required to pay their debts!

A player becomes the winner by surviving the world events, by using their cash and credit wisely, and by outperforming the other players.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tour de France Dice Game
description: Small German dice game on the Tour de France. This game appears on the book "Die schönsten Würfelspiele", by Bernd Brucker (Wilhelm Heyne, Verlag, Munchen, 2005)

name: RipperOpoly
description:
This game was produced in a small print run in 2004 but never reached a major publisher. According to the designers' website (http://www.ripperopoly.com/), pre-orders of the game were shipped to buyers. The trademark of the game and 75 copies were purchased in 2006 by Ken Chapman who sold copies via eBay. The game no longer appears to be supported.

From the designers' website:
RipperOpoly™ is a property buying game where up to six players move around the board trying to gather enough money to rent or buy a Doss House (Flophouse to our American enthusiasts) where they can stay safely through the night. All the properties are the locals or actual addresses of Ripper victims, suspects, or establishments central to the Ripper killings."

name: Noddy Merry-Go-Round
description:
Noddy loves Apples and Bananas, Ice Creams, Muffins and Googleberries.

Help him race around the merry-go-round collecting all of the treats from his Toy Town friends. When the dice shows the merry-go-round sign jump on and start the ride. Jump off when it stops. Maybe this will help you collect your treats, but maybe it won't!

<summary text taken from the rules sheet>
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Reise nach Caracas
description:
This is a roll and move game which was published as a marketing give away for Karamalz malt beer company as a give away. It consists of a paper board and states the date of some competition ending 30 June 1982 on the back.

It has some red event points where actions take place (roll twice, move forward/backwards etc.) and so-called Karapoints which gives you 3 extra spaces.

The map depicts the map of Venezuela (without Isla Magherita and los Roques) and Trinidad as well as the neighbouring states of Brazil and Columbia. The objective of the game is to travel from the border of Brazil to Caracas via the most known sights of Venezuela.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pontiki
description:
This is a simple race game for children, to be played with Pontikis, a collectible children's toy. As the player's move along the track, they gain, lose, and trade parts for their Pontikis. However, doing so seems to have no actual effect on whether or not a player wins, as the only victory condition is that a player's Pontiki be the first to reach the goal.

The game came with a set of four Pontiki figures. Since one can buy other figures as well, one could presumably play this game with any number of players.

name: Grimtooth's Dice of Doom
description:
Inside the clear plastic tube are six of Grimtooth's favorite dice: a "trap" die shows six generic trap types, the Grimtooth devil die, a pumpkin die, a ghost die, and a glow-in-the-dark die.

You can use these dice to play all sorts of games! Rules for two are included:

Halloween Candy: Players put their sack of Halloween candy by going around the circle and rolling the dice. Roll a skull and you have to put a piece of your candy into the pot. Avoid the skulls wins you a chance to take it all!

Vampire: Dice are put into a bag and secretly drawn by the players. The player with the glow-in-the-dark die becomes the vampire. Players then search and debate about who the real vampire is, challenging each player until the real vampire is revealed! (This is a variation of "Are you a Warewolf?")

Flying Buffalo product #203.

name: Colonization
description:
A game for the piecepack.

As an interstellar explorer your mission is to colonize more planets then the other species before you run out of time.

Using the tiles from the piecepack set as suns and planets, players take turns attempting to colonize planets. Each turn, players can perform one of the following actions: Draw and place a planet, Colonize a planet, Roll die and move ship, Play a coin and move ship, or Restore power reserves.

The game ends when a player has no more coins left. At this point all other players are allowed one last move. Scores are tallied and the highest scoring player wins.

name: Zathura Promotional Version
description: Simple roll & move 2-player promotional version of Zathura. Published as a promotional item for Zathura the movie. Includes metal dice and spaceship pieces.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Gwiezdna Kohorta
description:
Gwiezdna Kohorta (Space Cohort) is a Polish science-fiction collectible card game.

It takes places in a fictional military space opera universe, portraying a conflict between two factions: Earthers and Kalmians. Each player tries to gain the highest number of Victory Points for destroying enemy's units and controlling locations.

Only the base edition has been released so far (in 2005).

Links:

Homepage: http://wydawnictwoimperium.home.pl/files/gwiezdna_kohorta/in...

name: Chasing Chariots Game
description:
Race against rival charioteers around the Roman racetrack using your action cards.

Players start with 8 cards and choose one of them simultaneously and move their chariot accordingly. Minus cards moves any other chariot backwards the number of spaces as shown on the card. Plus cards moves your chariot forwards that number of spaces. Normal cards moves your chariot forwards based on the difference between the number on your card and the lowest number played. If a player had played a normal card but had a minus card played against him then he cannot move forward that turn at all.

When all 8 cards are played another set of 8 cards are dealt to all players. The game ends when one player reaches the finishing post.

The game supports UK National Curriculum Key Stages I and II for History.

name: Normal ist das nicht!
description:
The Idea is:
To bring the own ten pawns into the field and to beat as many opposite pawns as possible. The last player on the field wins.

name: Lettro
description:
This game is available in English and in French

A terrific card game involving strategy and the letters of the alphabet.

The highest card wins the hand, but watch out for the wild card that can play tricks on you. The player with the most hands wins.

Playing the game:
The players choose at random who deals first. This player deals the cards based on the number of players and places the deck of remaining cards face down on the table. The player cuts the deck to determine the trump colour which is the highest ranking suit. The player then places the trump reminder card face up on the table for all to see. The player to the dealer’s left goes first. The first player lays one card face up on the table. Each player takes turns playing a card of the same colour as the colour requested. If a player does not have a card of the colour requested, he or she may play a trump colour, a card of a different colour or a Lettro TM card. The player with the highest card wins the hand. Then the winner of the hand plays the first card, and so on.

If more than one Lettro card is played in a round, the last player to play a Lettro card wins the hand. When a player plays a Lettro card, he or she can change the trump immediately, but players who have not yet completed
the round must play cards of the colour originally requested. After all the cards have been played, enter each player’s number of hands won. Then change dealers.

Components:
26 red cards from A to Z, 26 blue cards from A to Z, 26 yellow cards from A to Z, 26 green cards from A to Z, 4 Lettro cards, 2 trump, reminder cards, Game rules.

name: Planet der Wunder
description:
Content:
board,
6 water drops,
1 bonus ring,
18 wonder-taler
1 special die
500 cards with 1000 questions

The players travel with their pawns around the planet in order to get to know the wonders of the nature.
Those who answer the question correctly, get ahead quicker, or slower.
Because the questions refer to unusual facts, 3 answers are already printed for your choice.

Winner is the player who has arrived "Start" first.

name: I Spy Spooky Night
description:
From the publisher: "Skeletons dance, pumpkins delight, play I Spy on a Spooky Night!
Matching and memory game. When all of the matches have been made, turn the cards face-up and find the pictures to solve the riddles.
Several ways to play for added fun!"

name: Carrying the Tools to Britain
description:
Quote: This new educational game was designed by the CBC to enable listeners of all ages to better visualize the mobilization of this country's vast resources in the gigantic war effort in which we are now engaged. Its purpose is also to show the problems associated with the transporting of munitions and supplies of all kinds to Great Britain. The part which Canada is playing in the whole war, and in the crucial Battle of the Atlantic in particular, will undoubtedly be better appreciated by both young and old after playing this game and digesting some of the information contained here."

The contents consist of one cardstock sheet, 14" by 35", printed in three colours and folded into four panels like a menu. Six markers are available to be cut out from one margin of the board, as well as a six-sided top to be used as a die. One side of the sheet consists of a map of Canada, the North Atlantic and Great Britain. The other side of the sheet contains instructive data, graphs, charts and other appropriate propaganda.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: JetSet Casino
description:
In Jet Set Casino, you join the distinguished class of people who swan around Europe spreading their fortune over the gambling tables of high-class casinos.

Eager and hungry to "conquer" more casinos than your opponents in a short space of time, you have various means of transport at your disposal: private jets, sports cars, luxury yachts and the like. Each has particular properties that can help you blaze a trail from Monte Carlo across to Gibraltar round to St Petersburg, back to London and on to Helsinki in time for tea. Whoever has been to the most casinos after each player has been the "dealer" once, wins.

Jet Set Casino is all about successful negotiations. You must clinch the best deals with your opponents to get hold of useful casino cards and the right transport cards to get there. Those who have successfully visited a casino during their turn have the right to participate in a genuine casino game: they play a round of 'Seven-and-a-half' (not unlike 'Vingt-Et-Un') to compete for a further free casino visitation. The game also demands a good sense of strategy - from choosing the all-important starting casino, to obtaining the best transport cards for each different phases of the game - plus a little luck, as that's what gambling is all about, really...

Jet Set Casino has just been released in mainland Europe, and will be available shortly in the UK. See www.isimat.fr for details or contact muellbauer@lycos.com
categories: Card Game, Negotiation, Territory Building, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Bowling: A Board Game
description: Perhaps the earliest bowling boardgame, this game's box features a woman bowling while wearing a dress. The board is a grid of 48 squares with various numbers of pins, spares, strikes or fouls listed.

name: Gambit
description: Gambit is a trick taking game where points are awarded not only for the tricks taken, but also for the card that wins the trick.

name: 1838TL
description:
1838TL (1838: The Thuringia Link) is an 18xx game set in central Germany. This game takes the basic mechanics from 1830, and adds several new elements.

Unique features include the absence of private companies and an effectively unlimited amount of money, because the game ends only when a company's share price reaches 516.
The (weird) map is color-coded because companies are only allowed to build in their historical region.

Overview by Chris Lawson:
Location: Central Germany
Corporations: 13
Privates: none
Map Size: 377 hexes (387 total)
Off-Board: Three steps (2 / 3-4 / 5)
Bank: 21520 Thaler
Tile Colours: Yellow / Green / Brown
Stock Market: 2D (Square)
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: K.O.
description:
Each player has a set of pieces numbered 1 through 6. The object is to knock the pieces of your opponents out of the game while keeping your pieces in the game. Two standard dice are rolled for movement. The number rolled indicates both which pieces may be moved (as they are numbered one through six), and the value on the other die indicates the distance of the move. Each piece can only knock out opposing pieces bearing the same number.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/knockout.htm

name: AlphaOmega
description: The game is played on a 10x10 grid having letters of the alphabet marked along the row and column running through the center of the board. The players select a word at the start of the game and seek to visit all of the letters of the word in order. Landing on an opponent's piece sends it back to the start.

name: Puko
description: A Polish (?) game with cards and chips a bit similar to Tripoley. This is playing without the board and with 1 deck of PUKO-cards. In the box are rules for two others cards games too.

name: Happycross
description:
Content:
1 board,
1 Sand glass,
1 dice cup,
13 dice,
1 block

The dice show the different characters of the alphabet with a point score. The rarer a character, the higher the value.
The active player throws 13 dice, and the sand glass starts to run.
Now the player has time to bring the dice into right order at the board so that they lay crossword like at the board.
The sand glass limits the time.

Now the points are counted. Not used characters bring minus points.

name: Pyramx
description:
In former times grave robbers took rich treasures out of the pyramids. Pyramx is a tactical game.. 2 grave robber gangs try to take away captured treasures from the another gang.
The destination of the game is to conquer 3 green framed Pyramid points of the opponent and get into reach of his treasure stones.

name: Passt!
description: The object of the game is to complete an incomplete sentence with a word of the highest possible value

name: Diamantenfieber
description: Money and diamonds - an exiting matter! Who is fit in watching the market amd buy diamonds cheaply and sell them at a high prize will soon find aut the thrill of this game around profit,

name: Von großen und kleinen Tieren
description:
The animals get along well together. Sometimes they talk about who is the bigger animal.
In this game before the turn player opens up the next card he has to foresee or to guess: "Is the next open animal bigger or smaller than the animal that is already open on the table?" For a right guess you get chips.
The player who has filled his chip board totally wins the game.

name: Sarete Famosi
description:
In this game you play the role of a man/woman who wants to fulfill a professional career, selecting a type of character and an objective. You start rolling 2 dice in order to move that number of spaces on the board and get random event drawing cards.
Cards can give you money and other types of fulfillment to reach your goal.
The box contains 6 coloured plastic markers for the players, two wooden dices, a block of sheets to write down your characteristics, a deck of event cards and some "goal card".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Asian Travels
description:
From Old Silk Road: A voyager in the game finds himself on the trade routes which existed at the height of the Tang Dynasty in China (c. 750 AD). He sets out from Chang An, the cosmopolitan Chinese capital. Traveling across northern China and then to Central Asia, with a lucky roll of the die he will arrive at Samarkand, an important trading center. There, glass, fruit and horses may be purchased. At Merv, the traveler must decide whether to follow the overland or sea route. Going by sea, one has the opportunity to buy incense at the port of Hormoz, collect rubies, sapphires and pearls in the kingdom of Anuradhapura (now in Sri Lanka), visit the wondrous temples at Elephanta and Kancipuram and buy spices in Srivijaya (Sumatra). But beware! There are mighty perils on this route. On the overland route, the traveler visits magnificent Buddhist temples in India and beyond, encounter tigers in the jungles of Bengal and purchase luxuries such as kingfisher feathers and rhino horn at Angkor. The final leg of the journey passes through the the bustling port of Guangzhou (Canton) and then off to Japan and Korea where the traveler will be able to visit foreign temples and complete final trading before returning home by way of the Grand Canal.

Each location includes a special paragraph of text describing what happens to the traveler there. Often they include special trading opportunities. Major trading centers have specific products which they sell and also another list which they want to purchase. Commodity holdings are shown by cards which list the differing values of these items at various locations. Includes short history and glossary of terms.
publishers: Asian Art Museum of San Francisco

name: Last Word Game
description: This is John Weber Manufactory's entry into the realm of letter dice games. The game comes with 8 Nu-process letter dice and proudly proclaims the dice are plastic-coated and bear 'official typography'.

name: Pare los Facists! Battle for La Coruna Road: Jan.1937
description:
PARE LOS FACISTS (Stop the Facists) is a simulation on the critical battle also known as the Battle for the La Coruna Road that took place from Jan. 3 to 16th, 1937. In this particular phase of this Nationalist offensive (planned by the German advisers and their Blitzkrieg tech-nique) it was the first time the German Panzers met the Russian T26B tanks. Although their numbers were small both altered their doctrines because of them.

Game Scale:
Each Day Game Turn represents one day of real time.
Each map hexagon represents 500 yds from side to side.
Each unit counter represents a battalion or company.
Tank units represent 4-5 tanks, each air-craft is a squadron, each AT unit is a battery of 4 guns.

name: Mit Pauken und Trompeten
description: The idea of the game is to collect as many musicians as possible. All musicians and the director must have found their places in the orchestra. Each player counts how many musicians he has collected. The player with the biggest orchestra wins the game.

name: Tresorknacker
description: The idea of the game is to guess the combination of the safe with as little tries as possible. After two rounds the winner is the player who cracked the code with the least guess tries.

name: Zahlenklau
description: The games' idea is to catch as many number cards as possible. But beware: The number cards may be collected only in the correct order.

name: N.Carolinaopoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

If God isn't a Tarheel fan, why is the sky Carolina Blue?
Can’t get enough of UNC? We have a game for you! Ever dream of owning Dean Smith Center, Ram’s Head Rathskeller, Franklin Street, or The Old Well? They’re all for sale in Carolinaopoly, a game designed for alumni, students and friends of Carolina. Of course the box is Carolina Blue! It’s your roll! You may soon be the newest member of The Marching Tarheels…or you may be bumming quarters to do your laundry!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Sooneropoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

Boomer Sooner!
Owen Field could be yours for a mere $250! Or maybe you’d rather own North and South Ovals so you can double your rent. Buy, sell and trade University of Oklahoma properties in this game designed for alumni, students and fans of Oklahoma. Boomer Sooner…and own it all!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: UVAopoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

Wahoo!
O Hill, Beta Bridge and the Rotunda are up for sale! UVA OPOLY allows players to buy, sell and trade the University of Virginia. Did you ever dream of owning Mad Bowl, Edgar Allan Poe’s Room or 7 Society? Choose your token and advance to Register and Proceed. You may soon be hanging out on Rugby Road…or you may be sent home on Academic Probation!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Animal 2x2
description: This is a great game for toddlers that will help them learn shapes, animals, as well as colors. The object of the game is to match up three pairs of animals and place them into your rows in the ark. Each row has a different shape and color.

name: Warum ist die Banane krumm?
description: 165 cards are mixed. The left neighbour always asks the question. On each card side a question is printed with three wrong answers. That is the joke of the thing, and this means for the players: listen exactly and watch out! With every correct answer there is a banana as reward. If an ape on the board is completely equipped with 6 bananas, the player who has that ape wins.

name: Poker face
description:
24 cards are distributed evenly to all fellow players.
The player with the “start” - card puts these on the table and begins the round, by pulling a card of any fellow player. Afterwards this Turn player is now to pull with a fellow player etc.
If he pulls a point card, he puts it wordless to its other cards. He must show an action card and had to fulfill it immediately. As soon as a player pulls the “stop” - card, the round is terminated, and everyone recounts the points, which he holds straight on the hand.

name: UNO: Spider-Man 2
description: This themed version of Uno is based on the movie "Spider-Man 2" (although the card uses comic-book style illustrations as opposed to pictures from the movie itself). This version of Uno includes a special card/rule which does not correlate to any card found in regular Uno, the "Justice" card.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: UNO: Happy Feet
description: This themed version of Uno is based on the family film, "Happy Feet." This version has an additional, special card/rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "MAMBO!" card.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Who Said...Follow the Prophets Game
description:
Card game for families/children aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community.

Players try to match up ancient and modern prophets with things they said and facts about them.

name: Action
description:
From the publishers homepage:

Fun and entertaining cardgame for children and families. ACTION is an advanced Memory game where it matters when you make the pairs/tricks. Each trick contains an ACTION you have to execute when the trick is made.

In ACTION you will play cards on both hand and table. Pair the cards to make tricks. Each trick results in an ACTION - maybe stealing or switching cards and tricks. Courage, patience and a good memory are vital skills in ACTION!

ACTION can be played by 2 to 6 players, so the entire family can join in. It's easy and quick to learn. ACTION recreate the fun in challenging each other in the skills of memory and planning. ACTION is for bigger children and families.

ACTION contains 108 cards (a total of 2x27 pairs.) More players can pursue the same tricks at the same time. Game rules in 11 languages are provided, so you can easily find your new ACTION opponent during your next vacation.

name: Punch and Judy
description:
This is a Rummy Game variant with 34 cards in the pack.

Object of the game is to be the first to dispose of all the cards in hand by laying down a set or sets of 3 or 4 of the same character.
Name giving characters of Punch and Judy can be used as Jokers.

Cards are significantly smaller than usual card games and of a lesser component quality than most of the Pepys card games, albeit the print quality is stunning !

name: UNO: Arsenal Highbury Legends
description:
Themed Uno game based on the football (soccer) club, Arsenal Highbury.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Red Card" and "Yellow Card" cards and rules (referring to the card penalties given by players for infractions), which do not correlate to cards/rules in regular Uno.

name: UNO: Derek Jeter Limited
description:
An Uno variation featuring the theme of Derek Jeter, the star player for the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the New York Yankees.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Captain" card and rule (referring to Jeter's position as team captain), which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.

name: Pirate Ship
description: Pirate Ship is a game that tests players balancing and identifying skills. Players have to fit the components without making the ship topple, or do their best to make the opponents topple it!

name: American Kennel Club Best in Show Board Game
description:
From the publisher:

The ultimate game of canine contests! With this board game, you choose the breed, register your dog, and enter the most exciting canine show in town. You act as the dog handler and take your purebred through the course to win best of breed and ultimately best in show. Players roll the die and travel the board collecting facts and items to fill up their dog dish. Events in the center ring allow players to take their breeds through a fantasy dog show. For 2 to 4 players. Ages 6 and up.

name: Word Slam
description: The idea is to find words for certain categories whose initials are drawn. The referee gives his OK for the best word with a hammer. The pawns are moved forwards after a word has won. The first player with his pawn at the finish wins the game.

name: Box
description:
Content:
board, 1 big die, 4 pawns, 20 colored chips

Each player tries to lay down his chips on the alley first. Opposing teams are try to mutually interfering using an attractive throw-out-system.

Game No. 8 (of at least 12) in a family called "Miniplays".

name: Grapsch
description: The sliding cover of the game box contains a number band with characters 1 - 10. With this piece the players can measure reactions of other players in the game. One player holds the number band by the 10 and lets it fall while another player tries to catch it as fast as possible. The number where you caught the wooden piece is the number of small wooden sticks you get for the construction of a playing field. The player with the best reaction wins the game.

name: Fast 5
description:
There are 5 cards each representing a person in the community (teacher, firefighter, etc) - one card is a picture of that person - the other 4 match the person. Deal out person cards to all players. Place the rest of the cards face-up randomly on the table. One, two, three go - all players at once must grab the object cards that belong to their person. Whoever grabs all 4 first rings the bell. There are different ways to play this game, to be enjoyed by a wide age-range of players. Players: 2 to 4. Ages 4 and up

The Educa Salent SA version includes 3 different games to play.

Contents: 56 object cards, 14 "career" cards, 1 bell
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game
publishers: Educa Sallent SA, John N. Hansen Co., Inc.

name: Wonder Letters
description:
This is a crossword-style game for children Ages 6 - 11. Players build words from letters rolled on dice. The dice are hollow, however, and are intended to contain small prizes rewarding players for having made words.

From the publisher: "Wonder Letters is the first crossword game where players create words and open WonderLetters to claim hidden prizes. Prizes are customizable - they can be tricks or treats, ranging from motivational stickers or jelly beans to jumping jacks! WonderLetters rounds out the fun with its unique triple-play rule and fast-paced, all-play piggyback round."

name: Bananowy Szał
description: Game contents 54 cards. 30 with palm trees, 15 with monkeys and 9 with bananas. Players collect cards with bananas.

name: Fantastic Fairytales Game
description:
From the publisher:
"Fifteen well-loved fairy tales are colorfully illustrated on game cards. Players travel the game board collecting these cards, memorizing them and placing them in their card holder, face-out so they cannot see the pictures. When you land on a "scroll" space, you must recite the cards you have collected! The first player to collect 7 fairytale cards, land on a "scroll" space and name all 7 cards correctly wins the game. No reading skills required.
Contents: game board, 4 game pawns, 4 stands to hold fairytale cards, 30 fairytale cards, game die, rules."
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rupicola
description:
Contents:

Board with spinner
Six tokens
Cardboard counters:
24 gates
18 single keys
24 double keys
6 triple keys

Instruction booklet in five languages


Players begin with a supply of gates and keys and move clockwise on concentric paths connected at certain points via gateways. If someone has blocked a gateway by placing a gate across it, you need one or more keys to open it, then that gate becomes yours. You can gain more keys by moving away from the center or landing on another player. First player to reach the center wins.

When there are three or more players, two may negotiate a contract specifying how many gates will be placed during the current turn and where. A player involved in a contract receives a key for each gate he places as part of that contract.

Rupicola doesn't include trivia questions, but the spaces on the board are color-coded to allow players to incorporate trivia cards from Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition (or any other such question-and-answer set) into the game. Playing time (average 10 minutes for two players up to 60 minutes for six) can be twice as long when playing with trivia.

name: Het Grote Babyspel
description:
An educational trivia game for young and expecting parents. Contains more than 300 questions related to pregnancy and the care of infants.

Each player gets a babycare card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the babycare card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the babycare card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

name: FSUopoly
description:
Monopoly like game based on Florida State University.

Tokens include: Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, and Graduation Cap. Board Spaces include: College Avenue, Lake Bradford, Seminole Marching Band, The Phyrst, Sweet Shop, Landis, and University Union.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Fantasy Adventurers
description:
This is a light weight 'filler' strategy game where you explore dungeons, kill things, take their stuff, return to town, heal your party, gain some levels, then start all over again with an even harder dungeon.

It's basically the stereotypical fantasy RPG done up as a strategy game where you manage a party of characters rather than role play a single character.

Fantasy Adventurers is designed to be a light, simple and quick two-player game that can be played almost anywhere, but includes rules for solo play and three players.

In addition to the game rules you will need a sheet of paper, something to write with and a single d20.

The game is only available as a PDF download and includes these PDF files: Adventurers Guide, Game Play Guide, Dungeon Builders Guide, and Character Sheets.

name: Caught in the Web
description: Children's game themed on insect knowledge. Players play one of four insects (butterfly, bee, dragonfly, or grasshopper) and navigate the gameboard (depicting a spiderweb) by answering trivia questions about insects. The first player to successfully make it through the web to return to his habitat is the winner.

name: What Did I Step In?
description:
From the publisher:
"Here is a crazy mixed-up matching memory game. Use the sneaker to step on a card - the suction-cup heel will pick it up! If the card you step on matches a card in your hand you get to keep the match. Players compete to collect the most, all the while trying to avoid the worst thing you can step in - dog poop! Contents: 21 Step-In cards, 28 Step-In squares, sneaker with built-in suction cup, game rules."

name: Wie bitte ???
description:
"gnidaer sdrawkcab " = reading backwards and guess the word, this is what this game is about.

There are as many as 110 Cards with each 6 words spelled backwards.
Which one will be chosen is determined by a roll of die. A player takes a card and reads out loud the backward spelled word.
If a player recognises the word correctly he/she gets that word card. The first player that collects 7 cards wins the game.

name: Gladius Maximus
description:
In Gladius Maximus, two or more players play the part of patrons who purchase, train and equip a cadre (or "familia") of gladiators and pit them against each other's gladiators in the arena.

Gladiator matches are almost always to the death. Gladiators who survive must deal with nagging injuries from previous fights, but can learn new skills and earn better equipment. The first player to kill off all of his opponent's gladiators or have one of his own gladiators
survive 5 fights (thereby earning fame and freedom) wins the game.

The game models gladiatorial combat between two or more gladiators, including teams.

Combat is broken down into melee combat turns, with each turn consisting of 5 phases:

1. Movement
2. Initiative/Maneuver
3. Attack/Parry
4. Riposte/Counter Parry
5. Remise/Counter Parry

Get the full rules here:
http://www3.sympatico.ca/green27/
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Have Gladius Will Fight
description:
These rules allow quick and fun gladiator combats involving just two gladiators or a whole crowd. Animals such as lions and tigers can also be included.
Each player controls one or more units. A unit can be a gladiator OR animal such as a lion or tiger. Each unit requires a unit sheet. Mark in pencil or use pins in the shaded squares.
The playing area is divided into squares to regulate movement and which units fight. Players roll 1d6 for each unit to determine initiative. The units will be moved in the order of lowest initiative to highest initiative. Roll another dice to separate tied rolls. This second roll is only used to separate initial tied rolls and does not change the order of others who initially rolled higher or lower.
It costs 1 move point to move a unit to a vacant adjacent square (including an adjacent diagonal square). A unit can only use up to the number of move points shown in the gladiator table each turn, but does not have to use all of their move points each turn. Move points not used that turn are lost. A unit cannot move into or through a space occupied by another unit.
The combat phase occurs after all movement has been completed. A player does nothing in the combat phase if that unit is not adjacent to any other unit. Adjacent also includes the touching diagonal spaces. Otherwise :- Players secretly choose which (if any) adjacent unit they will attack this turn. A player also secretly chooses the aggro level. The aggro level chosen will affect the attack and defense factors for that unit. This is how aggressive or defensive that unit will be for all combats this turn.
When a unit reaches 0 or less hit points, it is dead, and is removed from the board. A unit scores a victory point each time it inflicts a hit point of damage on another unit.
The winner is the owner of the gladiator who survives, or the gladiator who scored more Victory Points.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Play-Beck
description:
Quiz game based on the German legal system. Its main use seems to be to help law students preparing for the exam.

It is sold mainly through bookshops.

name: Der gestiefelte Kater
description:
Content:
4 cat cards, 20 landscape cards, 1 color die

Who accompanies the booted cat on his way? With big steps he rushes forward - across fields and woods, along a lake and through the middle of the village. It is the aim to reach the end of the line with his cat to turn back and ran back to the beginning again.

name: TZAP Rummy
description:
TZAP Rummy is a fast-paced game. Like all rummy games, it involves creation of 3-card RUNS (sequences) and SETS (3 of a kind). And, like the Rummikub tile rummy game, it involves rearranging already-melded cards on the table to the best of your advantage. The deck of standard cards also includes six special TZAP cards which have both strategic and laugh-generating functions that provide twists not found in other rummy games. The game is for ages 8 and up, 2 to 8 players, and can be played individually or as partners.

TZAP Rummy claims to set itself apart from other rummy games by:

FIRST, it involves manipulation of melded cards on the table to help get rid of cards from hand, i.e., to "go out."

SECOND, it involves manipulation of opponents by strategically "zapping" the right opponent at the right time to improve your chances of going out, while at the same time inhibiting others from going out. This requires some tough decisions on whether to use TZAP cards for melding or for penalizing an opponent.

Home Page: http://www.tzaprummy.com/

name: Sticks and Stones
description:
Sticks and Stones is an easy to learn game for 2-4 players that combines the elements of luck and strategy into a fun-filled game that you can take anywhere. Be the first player to collect all four differently colored stones to win.

Sticks and Stones will provide hours of fun for family gatherings, parties or any time friends get together.

Sticks and Stones requires only a small surface for play and can be played virtually anywhere! Play the game that's packed with strategy with a twist of luck.

Sticks and Stones -- a Great Big Game in a Little Box.

name: Guldgrävarspelet
description: A very old and rare Walt Disney game, which also have unusual game mechanics for a Disney-game. The players shall collect gold, and also steal gold from each other and try to hide their own gold.

name: On the Spot
description: The book consists of over a thousand moral dilemmas in the form of questions. A turn consists of a player answering a question from the book by secretly voting either 'yes' or 'no'. The other players must try to correctly guess that players' answer. A short discussion is allowed between the other players. Once all other players have made guess, each scores one point if correctly determining the questioned players answer . The player taking the turn will only score one point if there is a majority or equal number of other players that correctly guessed his/her answer.

name: Ta & Ge
description: For two players or more. The goal is to receive as many white pieces as possible. One player selects something on the wheel. The other player doesn't know what the other has selected and has to guess. Among the alternatives are "take two pieces", "give two pieces" and so on. Correct guesses are rewarded and wrong ones punished.

name: Donald Duck's Birthday Surprise Game
description: Children game in which players move in a maze looking for Donald Duck's Birthday Cake.
categories: Children's Game, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Emprendiendo
description:
From game's web page (translated from Spanish):

"Emprendiendo it's the most exciting business board game. The only game with real cases and with real enterprises. The things you'll experience with it will help you to understand the business world and the situations you will in it it a amusing and exciting way. Discover how good you can be in the thrilling entrepreneur world. To win you must collect enough money to buy the Emprendiendo corporation."

name: Kulltour
description:
Content:
board, 5 x 4 bowls, 1 die

All players follow the same spiral way with their bowls to the finish points in the middle of the board. Bowls can earn points there. The later you come the more points you get. So each player tries to be late and to push other bowls forwards to places with less points. Sometimes you push forward a whole row of bowls. If a bowl falls into a hollow it has to start again.

name: Peril of the Pole
description:
Do you have the nerve, the skill and the derring-do to challenge the wind and play PERIL OF THE POLE?
