“Board & card game for 2 players. Two Rival Teams of Zoid Warriors Face-off. Each figure represents a single Zoid. Victory: Destroy all opposing Zoids.”

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Several spaces are designated as obstacles (hills, crags, or cliffs.) Miniatures or counters are used to represent the Zoids. Each side starts with fifty points worth of Zoid Warriors. Each Zoid is rated for speed, hand-to-hand combat, toughness, and attack range.

A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Przygody w dżungli
description:
Old Polish game. Each player becomes an explorer in the tropical jungle. Pawns can move only in straight lines, you cannot jump over another pawns or "dangers of the jungle". However, the amount of fields covered in one move is not limited. After finishing a movement player picks up one adjacent tile. It can be:

- a desired object or animal, helpful in explorations (elephant for example)
- object scoring VP
- "danger of the jungle"

One player is not a usual explorer. Instead he plays the role of the "jungle". He aims to trap the players (by guarding the exits). When a "danger" tile is discovered, it enters the maze and "jungle" player is able to move it from this moment.

In any moment players acting as "explorers" may exit the jungle. They count VP on gathered tiles. At the end of the game (when everybody left the jungle or is not able to do it). The player acting as "jungle" earns VP for:

- every tile, that has not been discovered
- every VP tile gathered by trapped players, who did not leave the jungle.

Player with the most VP is the winner.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Humor, Maze, Party Game, Travel

name: Men in Black
description:
“Card game for 2+ players. Players are Men in Black, protecting the Earth from the Scum of the Universe.”

The game uses a custom card deck containing nine types of cards: Agents, Major Aliens, Lesser Aliens, Clues, Plot Twists, Helpers, Equipment, Weapons, and Events.

“Victory: The first player to defeat 3 Major Aliens is the winner.”
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Monopoly: Den Haag
description:
The classic game of Monopoly, with a theme from the city of Den Haag in the Netherlands. Every street has a name from the city, and added to that has banners/commercials from companies in that neighborhood.

This is an authorized edition.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., Winning Moves Germany

name: Naughty & Nice
description:
Naughty & Nice is a quick playing card game I made for a friend's 30th birthday. During the game you play cards on yourself and on other players to increase or decrease your Naughty and Nice ratings. The object of the game is to end with the highest Naughty and Nice ratings with the smallest difference between them.

There are also Shiny! cards. You can play Shiny! cards to take cards from other players. At the end of the game, each Shiny! card has a 50/50 chance of being worth points. If a Shiny! card is worth points, you can add it to your Naughty score or your Nice score.

Naughty & Nice is a game for two to four players. It uses a custom card deck and a single die. A four-player game takes about 30 minutes to play. While the gameplay is rather simple, the ever-so-slightly mature theme of the game makes Naughty & Nice appropriate for Ages 16 and up.

name: War for Atlantis
description:
"One player takes the side of the Atlanteans. The other player takes command of the combined Armies of the Five Foes of Atlantis."

The game is played on a hex map. The continent of Atlantism containing the main city of Atlantis, is at the center of the map, surrounded by water. A thin border of land around the outer edges of the map represents the homelands of the enemies: The Barbarians, Greeks, Egyptians, Africans, and Lemurians.

Each enemy has a unique set of forces. Units are rated for power and movement. Some units are amphibious, some cannot leave the water, and others may fly. Mage and Priest units have magic powers.

"Victory: The Atlanteans are victorious if they destroy their enemies completely. The Five Foes win if they destroy all the Atlanteans or a have a spellcaster cast the cataclysm spell in the Temple of Posideon. The Atlanteans win a minor victory if there is no winner after 20 turns."

name: War in Hell
description:
"2 Player Card game. Diabolic Fantasy theme. The Arch Devils Intrigue and do battle to control the 9 Planes of Hell. Each player controls a Faction of Arch Devils."

The object of the game is to control all Nine Planes of Hell. The players use the various units (Arch Devils, Dukes of Hell, Greater Devils, and Lesser Devils) to fight for control. Event Cards can be used to give advantages in battle.

name: Third World
description:
"Card game for 2+ players. Simulation of problems facing third world countries. Each player controls his own Third World country."

The deck includes six types of cards: Political Reforms, Economic Reforms, Ecological Reforms, Political Crises, Economic Crises, and Ecological Crises.

Each player has three statistics that are tracked during the game: Political Stability, Economic Stability, and Ecological Stability. Each category starts with a value of 20.

A value of zero or less in Political Stability represents Anarchy & Civil War. Zero or less in Economic Stability represents Economic Collapse, and zero or less in Ecological Stability represents an Ecological Disaster.

A player wins by achieving a score of 30 or more in all three categories.
publishers: Academic Gaming Review, Warp Spawn Games

name: Wizards & Warlords
description:
A game of fantasy warfare between the forces of competing warlords.

The game is played on an area mapsheet. Three types of special territories are marked on the board: water areas, barren areas, and strongholds. Each stronghold is identified with one of the warring factions: Dwarf, Kobold, Goblin, Hobgoblin, Orc, Shaman, Elf, Halfling, Illusionist, Fey, Gnome, Artificer, Necromancer, Vampire, Knight, etc. Each of the factions has an associated warlord which a player may choose to play.

"Tokens represent an abstract combination of military, tactical, and magical strength at your disposal. The identity of a stronghold determines what type of token it produces. For example, a Dwarf stronghold produces dwarf tokens. In battle a dwarf token allows one roll on the dwarf warlord table."

"The objective is to destroy your opponents Warlord token and capture all of your opponents strongholds."

name: Water Gun Fight
description:
“Card game for 2+ players. Each player controls a group of Kids with Water guns.” The winner is the first player to soak ten opposing kids.

The card deck includes twenty-three different types of water guns, each rated for Volume (amount of water expended per attack) and Capacity (amount of water held). There are also cards for each type of Kid, rated for Hits (amount of water required to soak) and any special advantages. There are also Modifier and Event Cards which can offer assistance in attack or defense.

In addition to the arsenal of water guns, the players may also be able to obtain Water Balloon tokens during the game. A six-sided die is used to resolve Water Balloon and Water Gun combat.

name: Wuxia
description:
"Card Game for 2+ Players. Chinese Sword & Sorcery. Each Player is a Secret Society recruiting Sword fighters with Mystical Powers."

The game uses two card decks, the Recruit Deck and the Action Deck. The Recruit Deck has four card types: Fighters, Weapons, Events, and Enhancements. The Action Deck has six card types: Locales, Specials, Attack, Move, Defend, and Minions. Each player keeps a separate hand of cards for each deck.

The object of the game is to recruit fighters and defeat opposing fighters in duels. Each fighter has a Skill Rating. Fighters can have up to one Weapon Card and five Enhancement Cards attached. Most Fighters also have some sort of special ability.

To win, you must control at least four Fighters and kill all opposing fighters.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology

name: Thieves Guild
description:
"Players control rival Thieves Guilds in a Medieval Middle-Eastern city."

The game is played on an area map displaying the city. The city is divided into nine areas, some of which have special effects. The game uses a custom deck of ninety cards which provide for various events. Each turn a card is placed face down in each section of the map of the city. The players compete to win cards by placing thieves on them.

"Object: Have the most gold at the end of 10 turns. Each thief you control at the end of the game is worth 2 gold."

name: Treasure Hunter
description:
"Adventuring parties compete to claim the most treasure."

The game uses a custom deck containing over 140 cards. These include Hero Cards (used to build an adventuring party), Location Cards, Spell Cards, Magic Item Cards, Guardian Cards (foes and traps), Treasure Cards, and Event Cards.

"Object: After going through the deck once, the player with the most treasure points wins the game."
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Underdark Adventures
description:
A boardgame set in the Dungeons & Dragons Underdark campaign setting. Each player starts with a party of six adventurers attempting to acquire and return with the Underdark Maps.

The game is played on a 40 space track. The first party to reach the end of the track obtains the Underdark Maps. That party must then return the Maps to the start space to win. However, if an opposing party is able to defeat the party carrying the Maps, then the victorious party obtains the Maps and may return them to the start space to win the game.

name: War Wind
description:
"Card game for 2-4 players. SF Theme. Based on the 1996 PC game."

The players play as one of four Clans: Tha’Roon, Obblinox, Eaggra, and Shama’Li.

Each player has a unique Settlement Card and Clan Deck. The players also share a common World Deck.

The object of the game is to eliminate opposing players by destroying their Settlements.

name: Wizarding Duels
description:
"Card game depicting a Wizard Duel in the Harry Potter Universe. Game for 2+ players. Each Player & Deck represents a single Character."

Wizard characters have twelve Stats: Alignment, House, Age, Race, Knowledge, Courage, Endurance, Speed, Aim, Experience, Intellect, and Power.

"Each player will have to make a deck for his Wizard (Character). A Wizard can be one from the stories or one you make up. The card list contains a list of every possible card. Choose cards appropriate to your Character (According to his Stats). A Deck should have a minimum of 40 cards. A Deck may contain no more than 1 copy of any single card."

The object of the game is to defeat the opposing Wizards. An wizard is defeated by being killed, immobilized, heavily wounded, knocked out, or by suffering memory loss.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Trist
description: "Trist is an abstract strategy game played on a grid of interlocking triangles. Players each get a supply of tokens of a unique color. Players take turns placing their tokens on the triangles. Only one token can be on a triangle. The winner is the first player to make a combination of six tokens.” Two optional rules are provided for play variation.

name: WH40K Squads
description:
A two-player squad level card game based on the Games Workshop Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition) universe.

Each player uses a separate deck, depending on the force the player is leading. There are decks for the Space Marine Squads, Ork Squadz, Eldar Squads, Chaos Space Marine Squads, and Tyranid Brood. The cards represent Units, Attachments (weapons), and Events. The Units are primarily squad sized.

The players deploy Units, which may be accompanied by Attachments, and all units in play can attack an opposing unit once per turn. All combat is considered simultaneous, so every unit has a chance to attack, even on a turn in which it is destroyed.

The object of the game is to eliminate all of your opponent’s cards.

name: WH40KARDS
description:
"Two player Card Game based on the Games Workshop Epic Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition) Universe."

Each player uses a separate deck, depending on the army the player is leading. There are decks for the Ork, Imperial, Eldar, Squat, and Chaos forces. Each unit is rated for movement, hits, close combat, attack, range, and type. The units are divided into three different types: Infantry, Vehicle, and Titan.

The players deploy up to three units at a time, positioned at left, right, and center. An additional unit is deployed by one of the players to reflect a flanking maneuver. Units then exchange attacks which are resolved by die roll.

“Victory: The first player to have 30 hits worth of his own units destroyed breaks and leaves the field. Or 40 if you have a Command unit deployed. 50 if you have a Leader unit deployed. If a player loses 3 turns in a row (has all his units in 3 turns destroyed) he breaks and routs.”
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Wizardly
description:
"Each player controls a Covenant of Wizards. Players try to build up the prestige of their Covenant by Accumulating Victory Points."

The game is played using a custom deck of cards. There are seven types of cards in the deck: Wizards, Spells, Followers, Quests, Events, Items, and Duel.

The players earn Victory Points for controlling Wizards and Resources. Victory Points are also awarded for completing Quests. The first player to reach 25 Victory Points wins the game.

name: Word Poker
description:
A word game played using cards. The deck contains forty-seven cards, three of which are Wild Cards. The remainder of the cards have a letter of the alphabet marked on them.

The game is played in a seven card draw fashion. The players attempt to form words with the seven cards in their hand. Proper names are not allowed.

The value of the possible hands are ranked as follows, from lowest to highest: three letter word, two three letter words, four letter word, four letter word with three letter word, followed by five, six, and seven letter words. Each hand is also ranked with a point value.

name: Warborn
description:
A card game of fantasy combat for two or more players. The game uses a deck with eight types of cards: Heroes, Weapons, Armor, Mounts, Armies, Actions, Traits, and Spells.

Each round, the players draw hands of twelve cards. The players simultaneously play a meld of one hero and one other card from the other seven types.

The players then take turns activating cards in their meld. Depending on the type of card activated, this may allow players to add to their melds, to draw new cards from the deck, or to cause an opponent's card to be discarded. A player may also choose to pass rather than activating a card. If all of the players consecutively pass, the round ends and the winner of the round is determined based on the total force value of each player's meld.

The winner is the first player to win five rounds.

The designer notes: "I was working on a Heroscape mod and this is where I wound up."

name: University
description:
"Card game for 2-4+ players. Each player represents a University."

The players play as one of two types of universities: "A Public University gets to draw 1 extra card on its first turn. A Private University may put 1 specialty card into play during the game."

The card deck includes five types of cards: School, Facility, Title, Specialty, and Event Cards. Event Cards have various effects. All of the other cards are used to describe characteristics of the player's university.

School Cards come in six suits: Associates Degree, Bachelors Degree, Masters Degree, Doctorate Degree, Research Institution, and World Class Institution. Each suit is worth a different amount of Curriculum Points. Facility, Title, and Specialty cards also add to the player's Curriculum Points total.

"The Player with the most Curriculum points at the end of the game wins."

name: Titan Attack
description:
"Two player Card Game based on the Games Workshop Epic Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition) Universe."

Each player uses a separate deck, depending on the army the player is leading. There are decks for the Ork Gargant, Imperial Titan, Eldar Titan, and Chaos Titan forces. Each deck contains fifty-five cards.

The players attempt to make three card melds consisting of a Titan Card, Weapon Card, and Range Card.

The object of the game is to get the other player to run out of cards.

name: Time to Tell
description:
"Educational Party game for 2-8+ players. Players must answer trivia type questions involving Historical dates."

The game involves arranging cards listing historical events into chronological order. The number of cards that must be arranged, from two to five, is randomly determined. If the player is able to arrange the cards in correct order, he receives a chip for each card.

The first player to accumulate twenty-five chips is the winner.

name: Tic-Tac-Tics
description:
"Abstract Game for 2 Players. Tac-tac-toe variant with a regular deck of cards and played on 3 Boards."

"Each board is a 3 x 3 grid. Each space (square) on each board is numbered. The Spaces on a board are numbered 1 through 9. Each player gets 1 Home Board. The third board which is placed between the players is called the Mid Board."

Card play allows you to transfer one of your pieces to another board or to switch your piece's position for that of another.

"To achieve victory, you must get two simultaneous three-in-a- rows (TIARS). TIARS cannot be on your Home Board. You could have both TIARS on your opponents board or the Mid board, or 1 TIAR each on the Mid board and your opponent’s board. If both TIARS are on the same board, they may share a space."

name: The Diet Game
description:
"Gamers are trying to lose weight prior to their 15 year high school reunion. Card game for 2+ players."

There are seven types of cards in the game: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Snack, Cheat, Exercise, and Negate. With the exception of the Negate Cards, all of the cards are marked with an amount of weight gain or loss. Play weight loss cards on yourself and weight gain cards on your opponents.

"Winning: Be the First player to lose 10 pounds. (i.e. score of –10)"

name: The Backbone
description:
As described in the box:
"Just only for intelligent people"

This a game for two players. The player who gets six of his chips each of then in each of the six squares of the same color on the wooden gameboard, divided into six zones of different colors and tones forming a polygon, wins.

The game includes 20 wooden chips, 10 for each player.

A rare abstract game designed by Nike and Cooper (NAC). A 'rara avis' considering that NAC developed wargames mainly

name: Dictators
description:
"Card game for 2-4+ players. Each player takes the role of 1 or more successive 20th century Dictators."

The game uses a custom deck composed of five types of cards: Challenge cards, Military Power cards, Political Power cards, Atrocity cards, and Wealth cards. Players score Victory Points for playing Political Power, Atrocity, and Wealth Cards.

"The game ends when a turn starts and there are no cards left in the deck. The player with the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins."

name: Deutschland-Rallye
description:
The object is to move from city to city throughout Germany, answering questions about the specific cities, and collecting chips for correct answers.

There is a 6-sided die for determining the question area and two 12-sided dice for determining which city is the target.

The rulebook includes all the pertinent information for each city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tumbili
description:
A fun family game. Goal: To be the first to reach the top of the tree with three peanuts.

You will need to guard against predators! And earn peanuts by getting to the end of the branches or by collecting families of monkeys.

Un jeu très rigolo pour jouer en famille. Pour gagner, il faut arriver le premier en haut de l’arbre avec trois cacahuètes.
Gare aux prédateurs.
On attrape ces fameuses cacahuètes soit au bout des branches ou en reconstituant des familles de singes.
Mais gare aux prédateurs et vive les régimes de bananes et les noix de coco.

name: Piet Piraat: Schattenjacht
description: Goal of the game is to get as quickly as possible to the treasure. In order to get there you have to collect some items. Without these items you cannot get past the obstacles.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Armageddon
description:
Armageddon is a simple multi-player wargame played on a map of the world. Each player has an identical force of land, sea, and air War Machines with which he or she tries to destroy the opposing forces. There are decks of Satellite and Anti-Satellite cards which may provide the appropriate orbital War Machines: satellites can destroy units in 4x4 sections of the board and anti-satellites can destroy satellites.

From the box cover: "... in the future, non-violent electronic wars will be fought on land, at sea, in the air and outer space on simulated battlefields by unmanned war machines ..." "... there will be six superpowers involved in a total struggle for non-violent economic dominance of the planet earth: strategic skills bring victory, not death ..."

Components:

Board
Rules
Die
12 satellite cards (6 good, 6 blank)
12 anti-satellite cards (same)
6 sets of counters, each containing 7 sea units, 7 land units, 6 air units, and 4 satellites

name: GuldGraver
description:
In GuldGraver ("Gold Digger") players try to find gold. The first to dig gold worth of $500 wins the game.

The game board is divided in two areas: the village and the woods. In the village you have to make some money first to buy a shovel and a pick axe and optionally buy or rent a horse to travel faster. Then you can go and look for gold from the woods.

During the game players face (though action cards) various incidents; some good, some bad. You may for example lose all your money to Indians, find lost gold, get into a saloon fight or win in the casino. Players pull action cards to determine what happens.

name: Acoso en Nicaragua
description:
"Super Juegos" was a pioneer Spanish magazine about both, board and computer games, which was published between 1984-1985. Every issue included a board game inside, with rules and cut-out counters. As far as I know only eight numbers were published, at least in its first epoch (another publication with the same name would appear years later, this time focusing on computer games only).

Issue 5 included "Acoso en Nicaragua" which, despite its name ("Pursuit in Nicaragua"), it´s not properly a wargame. The board is a squared one. Each player has a commandant and 36 soldiers (Americans and Sandinistas). Each turn, they move the commandant one square, then places a soldier counter (which can´t never move) trying to immobilize the enemy leader. It´s that simple.

name: Sadowa
description:
Sadowa covers the one day battle (spread over 13 turns) between the Prussians and the Austrians (and their Saxon allies) during the 1866 Bohemian campaign. Standard game (4 pages of rules), and a more advanced game with setup information (an additional 4 rules pages) with simultaneous plotting and some minor changes to the core system. Units represent infantry, cavalry, and artillery. Rules cover combat (ranged fire and close assault), line of sight, terrain, stacking, zones of control, redoubts, reinforcements, superior Prussian morale, optional Prussian Command, and Austrian "Kamikaze" Hussars!

Sadowa is a rather simple tactical design, with amateur production values, die-cut counters, and a color 22 x 14 inch map. Published by Fusilier Games (Aberdeen, Scotland), this game game was un-boxed (zip) with a cardboard cover sheet.

name: Go for the Dough: The Game of Word Meanings and More!
description: From the Box: "Go for the Dough is a fast-paced, vocabulary building and word meaning (semantics) game for children Ages 4 and up. This highly motivational board game helps children improve their word recall, word knowledge, describing skills, semantic flexibility, and phonemic awareness skills.

name: Automany
description:
Automany - The road hazard game

(Resume of the game from the publisher)

The Automany game consists of an unending road on which players travel by car and experience various misadventures. When on the way a player loses his car, he must get another one immediately either by purchasing or renting. He pays the registration fees along with the insurance premium and then resumes his way on the game board.

For the most audacious players who like to take chances, the game gives opportunities to launch into business (business squares) and eventually make money. But beware, the richest player is not necessarily the one who wins; a player without money, who succeeds in keeping his car till the end, has many chances to win.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Niko
description:
(From the box)

Niko, Julius, Wilma and Essie have gone out to play. They slide down the Icy Slide and suddenly end up on the lands of the Black Wolf – help them find a way back home!

You move freely on the game board by rolling the die. After finding two of your animal character’s treats from underneath the snowdrifts, hurry towards the Snowy Steps – but don’t let other players’ animals snatch your treats, and beware of the Black Wolf! The first one to reach the Snowy Steps wins the game.

name: Bugs
description:
From the back of the box: "A fun numbers game that can be played by all the family. The object of the game is to score the most points by placing/matching the bugs in the best way."

Players take it in turns to place tiles so that edges match, and they score points according to how many dots are on the relevant bugs. An egg-timer is included to speed up play.

name: Kechukan
description:
Ancient wargame from the Mapuche people of southern Chile.
From the publisher: "The literary translation of this game refers to the 5 sides of the dice made of stone (Kechukawe). Considering that the Mapuches were a warrior people, it is not strange for them to have games, which represented battlefields. This is a game played only by men, who have the counters called Kona (soldiers) to conquer the enemy's field. Chance, which appears when throwing the dice, is nothing else but gods' will which, by the swing of the Kechukawe (or the wheel of fortune, as it might be called today), is indicating the fate of the rival players."

name: Leben in Münster
description:
A game published with the support of the Government of the City of Münster, Germany, with the aim of learning about the city. During the game, players have the opportunity to learn about some historical and touristic aspects of the city and its shops. On each turn a six-sided dice is rolled to determine how many spaces the player’s pawn may move along a game-board depicting a simplified map of Münster. At certain spaces, cards of the shops can be acquired or the player can go sightseeing by following the instructions written on the back of a card. Such instructions can be only a mere historical/touristic information, sometimes you need to pay or you may earn some money. The game ends when the last player reaches the final space and the winner is who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.
Since the game idea was developed by an advertisement agency, other German cities were focused in other similar games (for example, the game related to the city of Paderborn can be found at http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/25735)

name: Dirty Dancing: the Boardgame
description:
Players relive the summer magic as they travel the game board, full of movie imagery. Each turn, they take on a challenge. Challenges touch on the story, the music and dancing, and the actors and actresses who made this film a classic. Challenge categories include Who Said It?, The Entertainment Staff, Feel the Music, Behind the Scenes and Surprise Dance Move. Even players who answer incorrectly get a chance to move ahead if they are willing to strut their stuff. The grand finale, of course, is the talent show. It's everyone's chance to shine! It's everyone's chance to win!

Contents include Game Board, 4 Game Pieces, 396 Challenges, 36 Dirty Dancing Move cards, 30 Talent Show Act cards, Die and Instructions. For 2 to 4 players. Ages 12 and up.

name: The Baby Boomer Retirement Game
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to complete his retirement portfolio by collecting 6 tokens in each of three categories - Life Experiences, Health, and Assets - as you strive to reach Inner Peace. The first player to reach Inner Peace wins.

The game consists of a game board, 2 dice, 6 retirement portfolios, 6 game markers, a pad of wills, tokens in three colors, 6 resuscitation cards, and three decks of cards: Baby Boomer, Trivia, and Inner Peace.

--from www.babyboomerretirementgame.com

name: Domino-Puzzle
description:
The game of Domino-Puzzle combines the fun of dominoes and puzzles. The game uses the basic rules of Dominoes, except players can play as many tiles during their turn that they can match to existing tiles You could, for example, play 5 tiles in one turn by chaining them end to end.

The pictures on the tiles are animals. And each end contains half an animal. Each end of the tile can only be matched to one other tile so when you are done, you have one long chain that wraps around to form a rectangle.

name: Schnappburg
description:
A lot is going on in the castle of King Konrad. On the castle merlons, in the tower room, by the drawbridge and at many other places Robert the Knight, Gunther the Ghost, Princess Paula, Zapperlapapp the Magician and the other castle inhabitants can be found. The children are asked to help King Konrad and tell him who is not in the castle at the moment. They have to snap the pawn of the castle inhabitant who is not pictured on a particular castle board. However, the should be careful, because easily the wrong pawn is snapped ...

Schnappburg is a fast-paced childrens' game.

Schnappburg, 2 to 6 players, Ages 4 and up, 10 minutes .

Contents:
16 castle boards, 16 pawns, 1 rulebook.

name: Milk & Cookies Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Set up the tiles, spin the spinner, move your cookie jar marker, collect cookie tiles - catch the most cookies to win.

Get a MILK - Go Again!

15 - 30 minutes to play

Two ways to play for twice as much fun. Basic game or challenge game - either way, it's fun with Milk & Cookies!

A simple game children can play on their own.
- Teaches color recognition
- Helps children learn to count and see directional moves of play
- Little reading required to play
- Reinforces the lesson of taking turns

Ages 4 and up
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Forest of the Undead
description:
It starts simply enough. You and your pal decide to cut through the forest to save some time. Instead, you experience the adventure and horror of your young life as you encounter enough Undead to populate a dozen George Romero films!

2-4 players take turns placing forest path tiles, then moving your pieces along the winding routes. Using cards, you do your best to ward off the gruesome creatures as well as create some to eliminate your opponent- but watch out! If he dies, he can come back as the Undead and still win the game if you are unable to flee the forest in time!

The game uses a variety of path tiles and event cards, and the player will need to supply his/her own Explorer and Undead figures (easily borrowed from games already on the market), as well as a few D6 dice.

This is currently a Print and Play game, and is now available here on BGG as well as other websites approved by Steve Bullock.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Baseball Game in a Tin
description: This is a dice game for 2 players. The theme is baseball and players attempt to roll certain combinations on dice to get singles, doubles, homeruns, etc. Game includes folding gameboard, dice, rules, and all packaged in an attractive tin.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Red vs. Gray
description:
Red vs. Gray is hex-and-counter wargame without a historical background. It is relatively light and plays in about an hour, although the time will depend not only on the speed of the players but their style of play.

Counter density is low at ten units per player. The rules are less than five pages and should be easily picked up by those familiar with hex-and-counter games.

The game has a few unique elements in the rules. Including conditional casualties in the combat resolution table, and a distinct endgame phase triggered when one side loses a certain amount of combat strength.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Action Zulu
description: Game similar to Action D-Day, with a chessboard that simulates the battleground where (with 4 mountains to be positioned to liking) you are moved the miniatures through the game of the card and draughts of die.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Queen of Hearts
description: Queen of Hearts is an Alice in Wonderland themed Hearts variant. It is played with a 36 card, non-standard deck (spades, diamonds, and clubs suits contain cards A-9, hearts consists of A-8,Q). The 36 card deck allows the full deck to be used when playing with 2, 3, or 4 players.

name: Madagascar Escape 2 Africa Game
description:
Educational matching and race game based on the characters from the movie Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa

From the box:
"No Animal Left Behind!
Take off on a journey of fun with the cast of Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa. Players move their characters across the game board on a trip to Africa. Any time they match a card with the space they are on, they choose a Colorforms "Stick-On". The story board fills up as the matches are made. The more matches the better the final story. The player to reach Africa with the most matches wins, but everyone wins by creating a unique story every time!

The game teaches and enhances memorization, matching, and comparison skills. It also encourages young childrens' imaginations as they build stories around their favorite characters.

Contents:
Game board
15 picture cards
4 character game pieces
Spinner
Story Board
Sheet of 15 Colorforms Stick-ons
Instructions
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Vulcano
description:
Each player represents an island inhabitant, who all are members of the mafia. Each player gets a set of certain tasks to fulfill, that means to get to certain places on the board.
After rolling the dice you move your meeple, if you stop on a green field, you have to fulfill a randomly drawn card, if you stop on a field occupied by another meeple, you can put money in your private "pocket". If the white and the red dice show the same number, the Vulcano erupts, that means you lose your money. The winner is the one with the most money after fulfilling all task-cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Famous Name Us!
description:
From the back of the box:

Did you know that Barry B. Benson (Bee Movie) broke the "never talk to a human" rule? Or that Bow Wow was born Shad Gregory Moss?

Actors, musicians, move and animation characters! Play the game and guess who they are! Famous Name Us! gives you 4 clues that start out vague and get specific. If your team members guess the famous name on the first clue you earn 20 points. Guess it on the fourth REALLY specific clue and you earn only 5 points. Be the first team to earn 300 points and win the game!

name: Batwinged Bimbos from Hell
description:
A spin-off of Macho Women With Guns, introduces flight rules and demons.

Integrates with:

Macho Women With Guns
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Judge, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Macho Women with Guns: The Final Chapter (Part One)
description:
An expansion to Macho Women with Guns with new maps, scenarios, rules and counters.
Includes the bonus game Walker Wars. A game of senile savagery where you, the 90 year old survivors of WWIII must battle to the death for the vital supplies necessary for survival in a hostile world.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Player Judge, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Kalahari
description: Kalahari consists of a triangular wooden board with cups numbered 0-9. Place the ball in cup #0 and flip it to cup #1, then #2, in order. Once you get to 9, you go to 1-0 for ten, 1-1 for eleven 1-2 for twelve and so on. The goal is to see how high of a score you can get without dropping the ball. When the ball is dropped, or land in the wrong cup, you must start over. Once the basic game is mastered, you can change to odd or even numbers only or in descending order.

name: Isolo
description:
Isolo (according to Kalumbete also called isumbi) is the name given to three related mancala games played by the Sukuma, in Tanzania. This is the more simple one, the "women's game" (in fact, the girls' game).

The game begins with 2 seeds per hole. (In a 4x8 grid of holes with one of the longer sides facing each player.) On the first game the beginning player is chosen at random. On the following games, it alternates.
Each player controls the two rows closer to her.
Moves are multiple lap.
On her turn the player takes all the seeds from a hole on her side and sows them one by one on the following holes on her side, on a counterclockwise sense.
If the last seed of a lap is sown in an empty hole the move ends.
If the last seed of a lap is sown in a hole not allowing a capture she takes all the seeds on this hole and keeps on sowing another lap.
If the last seed of a lap is sown in a hole of the inner row and on the opponent's facing holes there are any seeds she captures them and sows them in another lap starting on the same hole the capturing lap started.
If on her turn a player can not move (she has no seeds, or all of them are singletons) she has lost the game."

That is the basic game. An intermediate form is:

"This is the middle (according to difficulty) one, the "boys' game".

The game begins with a special position" Thesame board as the above but with a non-uniform starting position. 17 seeds start in the pit at the bottom right corner for each player. The adjacent pit in the same row starts with 2 seeds as does each other pit in the same row thereafter. In the middle two rows, pits with an empty pit behind them (i.e., closer to the nearer player) start with 2 seeds and the hole diagonally next to the corner starts wth 1 seed on each side. Other pits start empty.

"On the first game the beginning player is chosen at random. On the following games, it alternates.
Each player controls the two rows closer to him.
General rules
General rules are as those of women's game.
Moves are multiple lap.
On his turn the player takes all the seeds from a hole on his side and sows them one by one on the following holes on his side, on a counterclockwise sense.
If the last seed of a lap is sown in an empty hole the move ends.
If the last seed of a lap is sown in a hole not allowing a capture he takes all the seeds on this hole and keeps on sowing another lap.
If the last seed of a lap is sown in a hole of the inner row and in the opponent's facing holes there are any seeds he captures them and sows them in another lap starting on the same hole the capturing lap started.
If on his turn a player can not move (he has no seeds, or all of them are singletons) he has lost the game.
Overture
At the beginning of the game some special rules apply.
Both pits containing 17 seeds are called ng'hana (privileged pits).
During the player's overture (each player overture can last differently) seeds are sowed only on his 14 left most holes, and the contents of the ng'hana can not be captured.

Once a player decides to (or must, as all other pits are empty or singletons) play the ng'hana his overture is over, he sows the seeds on the full board and all his seeds can be captured, from any pit. However, he can not capture the opponent's ng'hana as far as the opponent is still playing his own overture. "

name: Byggare Bob: Samla verktygen
description:
Use the roundel to randomly identify tools the players may add to their player boards (toolbox) to complete the pattern consisting of tiles of tools.

First one to collect all the tools, and having placed them in the right order, wins. If all tools have been properly placed, the players have also made a picture of Bob and his friends. Turn the toolbox upside down and see if all the tiles were correctly placed.

name: The Raiders Attack: Banana Village Minigame
description:
The Raiders are attacking Banana village again! This time they are not going to hold back!

This is a game for 2 players where one player control the Raiders while the other controls the villagers. Villagers set traps and save routes, while Raiders maneuver through the map, both players collect points according to their strategy and player with the highest points is the winner.

name: Starfall Speedway Game
description:
From the Publisher's Description:

This is more than a simple board game. It contains 2 complete games, which can easily be tailored to your child's reading or pre-reading level. Beginning readers can learn their ABCs driving on Starfall Alphabet Avenue, and learn to read short-vowel words and high-frequency words while racing on the Starfall Speedway. Children start with letter names and sounds, and then progress to reading words, producing rhymes, or using words in simple sentences. Both games easily grow with your child's expanding literacy skills, and foster a love of reading that lasts a lifetime. You will be amazed that learning to read can be so much fun!

This exceptional game set is packaged in a sturdy, colorful box, and includes a large 2-sided game board, 3 decks of high-quality Starfall Phonics Skill Cards, a spinner, and 8 race-car playing pieces. Instructions in English, Spanish, French and Chinese are included.

name: Joc de la Festa Major
description:
The celebration of Vilafranca is annual and is typical of Catalonia.In the 1994 they published this game to collect money.
The game is similar to game of goose but acclimated in the celebration.

name: Frantic Frogs
description: In this game you hit a 'leaf' (plastic 'flipper') which catapults your magnetic frog up a stem to try and collect metal 'bug' discs while your opponents are doing the same. It's a race to see who can finish with the most 'bugs'.

name: Pachgarhwa
description:
Pachgarhwa was first described in 1906 by E. de M. Humphries, a civil servant appointed as the Sub-divisional Officer at Karwi Sub-division at United Provinces, Northern India (today in the Bandi District of Uttar Pradesh).

No cultural background is given except that it "appears to be more popular than its intrinsic interest would seem to merit".

A similar games appears to be Longbeu-a-cha in Assam.




RulesThe board is made of two rows of five holes.

At the beginning, there are in each hole five pieces made of a material called kankar (presumably a mineral used as a construction material, a calcareous laterite with a high lime content).

Each player controls the holes on her side of the board.

At your turn you take all the pieces from any hole on your side of the board and sow them in an anticlockwise sense, one in each hole. After you have sown them, you take the ones in the next hole and keep on sowing with them.

Your turn ends when you put the last piece of a sowing in a hole followed by an empty one.

If the hole following the empty one is not empty, after a player has finished sowing, he captures its contents.

The winner of a game is the one who captures more seeds.

According to the description the game ends when "all the pieces on the board are exhausted"

This is indeed possible, although it is a rather unusual ending. Humphries failed to explain what would happen if a player has no pieces to distribute, while his opponent has still pieces left in his holes.

Similar games (e.g. Bay Khom, Walak-pussa) include the following rule:

The game ends when a player has no legal move and the remaining pieces are captured by his adversary.

The game was played in several rounds, in which holes could be captured, but the exact rules weren't given as "by that time things began to get complicated and I was unable to discover how, if ever, the game ended"."

name: Rio kadalis
description:
A mancala game. From http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Rio_Kadalis:

Rio Kadalis ("helping a female goat to give birth") is a mancala game, which is played by the Habr Awal tribe and other clans in Hargheisa and in the Jigjiga area in Somalia. The game was first described by Richard Pankhurst in 1971. Similar games exist in western Eritrea and in some parts of Ethiopia (Tigre, Shoa), e.g. Lahemay Waladat, Lam Waladach, and Lamosh.

Rules:

Rio Kadalis is played on a board of two rows of six holes (the Habr Awal also use sometimes just five). There are four stones in each hole at the outset of the game.
On his turn a player distributes the contents of one of his holes anti-clockwise (some Somalis also play clockwise), one at a time, into the following holes.

If the last stone is sown into an occupied hole, its contents are distributed in another lap.

The move ends when the last stone falls into an empty hole or makes a group of four stones, a situation referred to in Somali as binikh ("wasting").

Any groups of four made during a turn belong to the owner of the row, except a group of four effected by binikh, which is won by the player whose hand it was.

The game ends when a player can't move at his turn. The stones that remain are won by the player on whose side of the board they are.

The player who wins more fours wins the round.

For the next round each player fills his holes with four stones from his winnings. Any holes that could not be filled are closed down with sand, but can be re-opened in a later round.

The aim of the game is to close down all the opponent's holes, that is, to reduce his provision to less than four stones."

Pankhurst, R. 1971. 'Gabata and Related Board Games of Ethiopia and the Horn of Africa', in Ethiopia Observer; 14 (3): 204.

name: L'Evaso
description:
This card game is the first game of Waryson, an Italian publisher. The game comes with Italian rules only, but is otherwise language-independent.
The topic is that of a breakout from prison. One of the players will become the escapee in the course of the game, and to be successful he needs to collect certain cards that allow him to "escape", such as a passport, a destination country, and a transport to go there.
The game seems to be rather simple, and so are the graphics.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Building Roads
description:
Building Roads is a board game for 2 to 4 players, where each player takes control of a construction that must build the road network in a developing country.

The game consists of "building" a board with modular pieces that represent cities, farms, mountains, lakes, forests, hamlets and roads.

In each round the players form a part of the board, seeking to build its road linking the cities and at the same time, looking developed country around the road, generating more points which will take you to victory!

The Board Game is Print & Play

name: Truck Welt
description:
From the publisher's website:
"Create your own transportation mega corporation... But beware: The game experience is based on rules of reality. The game offers many scenarios, interesting changes and enjoyment for the whole family!"

Players take command of a Truck and are bidding on Transportation Contracts, which state from where to where a freight needs to be transported. Training the truck driver to higher levels of his driver's license allows to bid for better paid contracts, containing goods with need for cooling, for example.

Delivery time for the active contract is marked on the turn clock, so that all players see how many turns a player has left to reach his target. If a player manages to move his truck on the map form startpoint to endpoint stated in the contract (movement via d6), he earns money.

In addition to contracts, event cards can be purchased, which allow for certain special actions (like blocking certain countries for all players or promoting a player's driver to next level).

The game ends if either one player manages to deliver a freight to five different European countries pictured on the game's map or after the turn clock reaches a defined point. Winner is then the player with most money.

name: 4/Play
description:
4/Play is the third and final supplement for Hentacle and contains two new girls and a plethora of new cards for you game with a new and interesting '!' card to sabotage other players.

4/Play also contains new rules for playing Hentacle head to head until only one player is left standing and for a simplified version of this VS play that does away with point scoring.

This new way to play is a sneak preview of the forthcoming Call of Cthentacle!

Expands:

Hentacle
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Print & Play

name: Disney Fairies Fancy Flight
description: Players move along the board based on the spin of the spinner. In the first phase they are searching for the different parts of a special dress-up outfit, using luck of the spin and memory. Once they are all dressed up, they move around the board collecting fairy dust. Player with the most fairy dust collected at the end of the game wins.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pusteblume
description:
Each child takes the role of the little elephant Willi trying to blow the dandelions around the meadow. Who would like to help Willi to collect as many dandelions as possible in order to let them dance in the wind?

You have to collect the most flowers from the board. Each player gets a card which shows the color they have to collect.

On the board flower cards are put randomly. A player at his turn may blow a small ball over the board. When the player gets it between four flowertiles he may take all the flower tiles in his color. When the ball ends on a flower he can take one of his flowers from anywhere on the board.

The player that collects all his flowers first wins the game.

name: UnJumble
description:
Handy 2-game set with star-shaped pocket-sized mixers. Includes 2 mixers and 2 score pads.

Stellar Speller: Scramble to score the most points with words created using the seven letter cubes in the mixer. Great for both beginning and advanced spellers. Number

Jumbler: Add the 2 black cubes and list the most computational combinations using the 5 colored cubes to match this sum.

name: Villa Rustica
description:
from the Warp Spawn site:

Villa Rustica a game of Senators and Slaves

INTRODUCTION
Each player is a Senator of the Roman Empire.
Players compete for Gold, Influence, and Prestige.

VICTORY
The first player to accumulate 100 or more Prestige Points is the Winner.

name: El juego de Mazinger Z
description:
Goal of the game:

Beat Doctor Hell and become Mazinger Z. All players want to become the invincible Mazinger Z, but only one can get. To achieve this you'll have to fight among themselves and the then the survivor will have to defeat Doctor Hell.

Components of the game.
One board, one dice and 12 plastic chips.

name: Married!  The Game of Marriage and Money
description:
From the back of the box:

"This exciting, positive game offers lots of fun as it takes you through the ups and downs of marriage and money-making. There's the opportunity to win it all or lose it all on the draw of a single card...

A game that is as modern as today, yet as old as marriage itself..."

name: Golf
description: Golf has two parts: A luck-based starting phase in which the players try do get their golf ball onto the green by rolling dice, and a dexterity phase on the green in which a mechanical golfer statue pushes the ball into the hole (for this, you have to press down the shoulders and then let go, and the golfer will hit the ball with a corresponding strength).

name: Hans im Glück
description: Based on a Fairy Tale (Hans im Glück) in which an allegedly naive man swaps his belongings into less and less valuable items, players try to follow a certain order of trades (gold into a horse, a horse into a cow, a cow into a pig etc.). This is done by moving over a layout of 30 face down tiles by help of a die roll. The players move to a tile, flip it over and see if it matches their needs. In the beginning, it is pure luck, later there is a memory aspect to the game.

name: Cirkle Mind
description:
Cirkle Mind is a must play board game.The strategy is based on your ability to memorize the shapes and the colors of the players' pieces, which are not shown to your opponent.
The Strategy of the movements, by associating the forms and the colors of the pawns, is vital.
Goal of the game: to find the target (top piece) of the other player among 24 figurines (which have different colors and forms). To capture the units and to control the best spaces on the board. The combat system is similar to Stratego. Beware: the black piece is the strongest one and if your pawn match shape and colour on the board, it gets a high defense value.
Another board game connected to the Series: Cirkle.

name: WWE Undisputed The Board Game
description:
WWE Undisputed The Board Game allows players to take on the role of one of WWE top Wrestling Superstars, Triple H, Kurt Angle, The Undertaker or Hulk Hogan.

Players take turns moving their Superstar around the board until they collect cards that they can use later in the game. When a Superstar lands on a Match Fight space the player may challenge any other player to a Wrestling Match, preferably a player who holds a Championship Belt (Harcore, European, Intercontinental & World Heavyweight). The Wrestlers Fight by putting their Superstars in the ring in the middle of the board and playing Grapple Cards.

The objective of the game is to win all four Championship Belts.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Pirates Ahoy Game
description: The pirate's are leaving port in their ships and are racing to the treasure island. As you help them sail the seven seas, guess which ship will reach the treasure island first and which will reach it last.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fan Tan
description:
This game is different from the card game Fan Tan.
For the Piecepack Games version, see Piecepack Fan Tan.

Stewart Culin describes it in his book "The Gambling Games of the Chinese in America" as:

"a game usually played upon a mat-covered table, with a quantity of Chinese coins or other small objects which are covered with a cup. The players guess what remainder will be left when the pile is divided by four, and bet upon the result. The name means "repeatedly spreading out," and refers to the manner in which the coins or other objects are spread out upon the table."

The equipment needed to play includes:

The playing mat (called the t'an ching)
Coins, buttons, or something that is numerous and can be spread out
A cup or cover for the coins (called a t'an kun)
A rod used to separate the coins (called a t'an pong)

It takes two people to run the game, One is called the "t'an kun" (ruler of the spreading out) and the other one is called the "ho kun" who acts as a cashier.

Culin writes that the game is believed to have been invented by Kwan Chung, a renowned statesmen of antiquity who died in 645BC. Culin also mentions the likelihood that the game was invented for soldiers as a way for them to pass the time in camp.

This game is identical to the Phillipine game Capona.

name: Spacefarer Starship Simulator
description:
Spacefarer Starship Simulator allows you to design your own starship right down to the weapon systems, power system, living area, armor and personnel.
The movement system allows for three dimensional combat and allows play on any surface without need of maps, hex fields etc.
A free print and play game that allows as many players as desired to play.

name: Maya
description:
Maya is a game for one player. You have to find the right treasure chest by going through a labyrinth.
You start at one of the seven rooms and have to pass all other rooms. The difficulty is that every passing room changes the rules your movement.
For example: If you leave the room of the rabbit you may walk only right or left but never straight forward through the labyrinth.

This game was published as Spielbox Edition No.24 in Spielbox issue 6/1996.

name: Wygraj z maturą
description:
Polish game designed specially to help students to pass the high school exams. It's designed for the Ministry of Education by a group of grad teachers. It has 3000 questions in five different categories: Polish language/literature, history, geography, English language, others (culture, art, philosophy...).

Components:
- board
- dice
- pawns
- 360 cards with questions
- 60 cards "chance".

Official website: http://www.wygrajzmatura.pl

name: M Squad
description:
M Squad is a roll-and-move game featuring the famous TV-series of the late 50ies/early 60ies with male actor Lee Marvin starring and depicted on the box cover.

It's a light family game using the box inlay as game board.

You have to travel the town with small plastic cars in order to locate the daughter of a famous citizen who became a victim of a criminal act.

If you find some hints you can cover the name of the girl with small discs on the various locations.
The player who succeeds the first to cover the whole name with his discs is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Redline
description:
This is a square tile placement game in which every tile has one or more red lines that cross one, two, or three of its edges or vertices. Additionally, each tile has either a yellow or a blue background.

After an initial deal, tiles must be placed so as to directly continue some red line already in play, while alternating the background color from that of the tile whose line is being continued.
An extra tile may be pulled from the kitty when the player creates a line of three or more tiles of the same background color, or four or more tiles of alternating background colors. The winner is the last player able to place a tile. There is a non-compulsory scoring system that may be used.

Unlike most other tile-laying games of this sort, the player is not required to place a new tile so that its edge is flush against a previous tile, but can also place a tile vertex-to-vertex, provided that the edges are collinear with the tile whose red line is being continued.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Generals: A trivia Game celebrating the heritage of The Salvation Army
description:
Generals is a trivia game about the history of The Salvation Army. Your pawn is an early leader of The Salvation Army. You roll dice to move around the board and answer questions related to the early history of The Salvation Army.

There are spaces which you would draw a "Scalawags or Scoundrel" card. This card asks you a relevant personal question for you to talk about with the other players.

The board is adapted from the illustration that accompanies William Booth's, the founder and first General of The Salvation Army, book, "In Darkest England and the Way Out."

name: Brain Quest Card Game: Grades 5 & 6
description: BRAIN QUEST card game comes with two decks. The Questions deck is like a normal deck of playing cards with the addition of 4 trivia questions on them. These can be used to play variants of Rummy, Solitaire, or Go Fish (instructions included.) The Game Deck is used only with the BRAIN QUEST card game in which players draw from the Game Deck to get instructions on how to play their Questions cards. The first player to get rid of his or her cards wins.

name: Dekko
description:
From the rules:
DEKKO contains a series of SIX new and exciting word card games, all specifically designed to generate improvements in spelling and vocabulary, for people of ALL ages.
The use of a Dictionary is desirable in all games, for, when used in conjunction with the cards, the two produce an extremely powerful partnership for learning.

The games included are:
Penalty
Take-A-Word
Boxwords
Foil
Starwords
Declaration

name: High School Musical Party Alias
description:
Alias word explaining game is one of the most popular game classics in the Tactic game collection. High School Musical Party Alias is a groovy new version of this popular word explaining game. Use your voice, body and facial expressions to help your team mates guess the word, movie character or pose on your card. To succeed in the game, you must know the world of the High School Musical inside out.

Based on Alias.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Racing, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Revolutionary War Command
description:
Revolutionary War Command is a trivia-based wargame.

The novice can play the expert with ample opportunity to win. Move your pawns around the board capturing objectives as you answer questions and place your flag. Play defense and remove the opponents flag. Offer combat by landing on the same space, but watch out its not an automatic victory. Two ways to win keep each game different from the last and with over 400 questions in the game.

Questions deal with the time periods including the politics, leaders, battles, weapons, the home-fronts and quotes.

name: Streets of Cairo
description:
A very strategic tile laying and area control game that is highly interactive. The rules are easy to learn, winning requires cunning and clever play.

What treasures lay within the undiscovered Tomb of Akhenaton? Its location is rumored to be contained in a great mosaic created by those that worshiped the legendary pharaoh. Pieces of this mysterious and valuable mosaic have been hidden for ages in Egypt's greatest city. Can you lead your team of archeologists to make the discovery of a lifetime?

Players place city tiles to form the map of old Cairo and secure mosaic pieces known to be found in its three great mosques. As the city is developed, the players will reveal hidden followers, temples and leaders in the "Cult of Akhenaton." These hidden features are scored both during in-game play and the final "end game" round. Only with a carefully planned strategy and well execute tactics will the player be able to amass the largest collection of mosaic pieces and reveal its hidden secrets.

name: Salatut Elämät
description: A quiz game about the most popular Finnish TV drama. The questions are mainly about the characters and plot twists of the episodes between autumn 2008 and spring 2009. A fantastic quiz for all Salatut elämät fans!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Horses are the Best!
description: This game is a combination of rolling the dice to move around the board and answering trivia about horses. The game pieces are little plastic horses. The game board is in the shape of a circle with a pasture in the middle. To advance in the game you roll the dice. Depending on the space that you land, you may have to do do some math to advance or you may answer a question about horses. To win the game the player much advance to the middle space or "pasture".

name: Rambles Through Our Country
description: The box claims that this is "An Instructive Geographical Game" for the young. The game features a map of the United States with all 48 states and geography questions about the United States. The game was published by the American Publishing Company out of Hartford Connecticut and has a copyright date of 1881-1890.

name: New Zealand Rugger
description:
Object of Rugger is to score tries, convert tries and ultimately win the match. First Strike: A scuffler (plastic disc) is used to send the rubber ball down the table. Second Strike: From the position where the scuffler stops, strike it again.If the scuffler stops with a portion hanging over edge of your opponents end, you score a try (5 points). If the scuffler does not have a portion over the edge, or goes off table completely, play moves to opponent.
Converting the try: If try is scored player gets opportunity to convert try In direct line of where ball scored a try - anywhere from goal-line to half way flag ball is loaded onto kicker (stand that is used as a flicker). Ball must go between wooden goal posts to score 2 points, miss gets no points. Play swaps to opponent. The game has a time limit of 10 mins (2 x 5 minute halves).

name: Folly
description:
A childrens' card game. The object is to be the first to get rid of all your cards.

The dealer shuffles the pack and deals the required number of cards to each player. He spreads out the "spare" cards, face up, in the centre of the table. On their turn a player turns up his top card and tries to place it on any of the "spare" cards in ascending or descending order. If he can't follow the sequence they place the card face up next to his own pile. Other players who can't play a card on the "spare" cards can instead play a card in seqence onto any of the other player's face-up cards. If they can't, they put the card in their own face-up pile.

If a player places a card incorrectly the other players shout "Folly" and they each give you a card from their face-down piles to add to your pile. When your face-down pile runs out, turn your face-up pile face-down and carry on. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

name: Kunskap på tvärs
description:
Answer science questions and move around the board in the hunt for the questions that give you points. Guess the year of an event and the closer to the year you get, the more points you earn.
The playing pieces are famous scientists like Einstein and Pasteur.
Like in Trivial Pursuit knowledge is the most important factor in deciding the winner.

name: Atak Dinozaurów
description:
Description from box back translated from Polish:

Meet eye to eye with dangerous dinosaurs!!! Learn and master the habits each of them and trail the most dangerous - Tyrannosaurus. When you finish pursuit of the lord of prehistoric animals - try your force, playing cards with the most interesting and dangerous reptiles.

Box Content:
game board, 32 cards with dinosaurs, Tyrannosaurus card, 8 big mat to colour, 4 pawns, dice, rules

name: Die wilden Schwäne
description:
Which child will get the most swans?

The 9 swans start at one end of the board and each player chooses a child to be. In turn each player rolls the dice and moves along the track of the appropriate colour from lily pad to lily pad. If you roll purple you may move any swan one space. The aim is to move the swans on to the beach where your child is standing. When all swans have reached the beach the game ends and the player whose child has the most swans is the winner.

name: H2O
description: A drinking game (hence the name), designed by students in an inventors seminar. Their object was to design a low cost, easily manufactured product. Players roll the die and progress along the track, drawing cards with instructions and actions they have to follow - usually having to drink something as a result.

name: Leap Frogs
description:
It's a leaping and laughing frog giggle RIOT!

Boing, pop, the frogs start flying! Be quick and steady, don't stop trying! Use the net and don't let them fall! Win the game if you catch them all!

A motorized pond turns and shoots out ten frogs at random times. The players try to catch them in mini nets.
publishers: Champ Loisirs, El Greco, Ideal, Schaper

name: Zoka: The Battle of the Baristas
description:
From the back of the box:

As a Barista in one of Seattle's finest coffeehouses, you strive to earn the respect and praise of the regular customers. The object of Zoka: The Battle of the Baristas is to become the most popular Zoka Barista by providing the highest level of customer satisfaction. This goal is accomplished by "satisfying the customers," i.e., helping the customers acquire the specific types of drinks, food, and seating they long for.

name: Rooftop Runner
description: In a city ruled by a totalitarian regime, where citizens possess safety and conformity at the loss of their liberty and independence, there are those who still resist. They operate in separate cells, but strike as one With total lock down of high-tech communication techniques, they orchestrate their efforts through couriers, highly trained in the arts of Parkour and evasion. They take to the rooftops of the city to pass their critical information throughout the network. It is on these Rooftop Runners that the resistance may ever hope to strike a fatal blow to the oppressors and usher in a new era of freedom.

name: Dots
description:
Dots is a casual dexterity game in which 3 or 4 players take turns tossing cards onto a table attempting to cover up as many dots as possible.

Dots was created for Mike Barlow's "4 cards or tiles only" contest.

name: Nebulous
description:
Nebulous is an abstract 2 or 3 player race game created for the 4-tile contest.

Players rush to get their ships ahead, but they must be careful not to leave themselves open to being jumped and set back by their opponent. The game uses 4 tiles which are laid as the game progresses.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Na Ponta da Lingua
description: From the game's box: Bet on your grammar and vocabulary knowledge! In this game you bet on the answers you believe are correct to win chip's from other players. One player asks a question and draws the value of the bet. Those players who think they know the correct answer bet or raise the bet. Those who don't can give up. Who correctly guessed wins all chips bet.

name: Destination Bournemouth & Poole
description:
DESTINATION is the award winning fast moving Taxi game that will take you on a journey through the streets of Bournemouth in your very own cab!

As the driver you will visit famous destinations in the city, collecting fares and trying to avoid the traffic lights. You must not run out of fuel, or lose your license and be careful not to upgrade to a Turbo Taxi too quickly as you could run out of cash and may need a logbook loan to bail you out!

The aim of this game is to be the player with the highest earnings... if you survive the shift!

name: Panzer Warfare
description:
A set of rules for Mass-Armor Battles of WW II with Small-Scale Miniature Figures.

Forward by Gary Gygax
Panzer Warfare is specifically designed so as to capitalize on the small size of the 1:200 - 1:300 scale models, and at the same time provide a system where divisional, corps, and even army-sized battles can be fought. Furthermore such battles can be fought with relative ease and over the course of but a single (pleasant) afternoon....
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Zappelfisch
description: There is a small basin with fish. Each player has a fish catching device which is battery driven and vibrates. With this, the players try (all at the same time) to catch as many fishes as possible and put them in their basket. This is difficult, as due to the vibration, the fishes fall down easily.

name: Gybe-Oh! Round Britain Sailing Race
description:
Fun sailing game for between 2-8 adults or children. Uses a mixture of good luck, skill and chance as is the way with sailing. Object is to race over a set course, say Plymouth to Castle Bay in the Hebrides first home being the winner. On the way you'll have changing forecasts (32 real ones from a previous Round Britain come with the game), tide and Perils! to contend with. At the end of the race, which can last as you like it, from 10 minutes to 2 hours, you'll have found out amusing and interesting things about sailing offshore, all without necessarily having to know a thing about sailing. So Good sailing. Gybe-Oh!

Gybe-Oh! is printed on plastic, rolls up and comes with two unusual dice, eight boats and Gybe-Oh! and Peril! cards plus, of course, the forecasts. And it is all packed in a tube.

name: Backstab
description:
Who can you really trust?

With 2 players, Backstab is a game of skill and luck. Negotiation, trust and the art of bluffing come into play with 3 or more players. You can give each other a fair go, you can go out out of your way to help someone else or you can be as ruthless as you like.

Both games give you the chance to put your ethics up on the table where everyone can see them.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Code Master
description:
An exciting, educational and fun game for 1 to 6 players. Played in several languages.
Code Master is based on an ancient number code for letters. The aim of the game is to form words on rolled dice. Numbers corresponding to letters give an amazing array of scores. Designed to allow versatility through a rainbow of variations and options, involving skill and chance; play can be as easy or as challenging as desired.

name: Cover It
description:
Setup
Each player secretly draws one of the tiles and checks which symbol is duplicated on the tile. This is the secret symbol for that player. All tiles are then placed next to the game area.

Goal of the game
To get four visible symbols of your type to form a square. The square doesn't have to be orthogonal to the tiles.

Game play
During the first two turns the players take turns picking a tile turning and rotating it freely and then placing in on top of the play area. Every tile after the first must either touch or overlay an already placed tile. After the fourth tile has been placed the player must take an already placed tile an replay it on the game area still touching or overlaying already placed tiles. The tile replayed cannot be the last tile placed by the opponent. The tile replayed doesn't have to be free, when it is taken.
As soon as one player manages to get four of his symbols to form a square he or she has won.

Part of the 4 Tile Contest:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/383408

Freely available:

name: Rock Paper Scissors Stratego
description:
Equipment: Four double sided tiles: marshal-spy, miner-miner, bomb-colonel, general-colonel, as shown in this picture:

Goal of the game: to be the first player to ten points.

Before each turn the tiles are mixed under the table, it is important to turn the tiles while mixing them. They are then placed standing up between the players so that each player can see only one side of each tile. Each player secretly selects a figure on their side by holding a number of fingers below the table indicating the tile's position. The players simultaneously reveal their selected number.

Each of them wins against some of the other types.

Part of the 4 Tile Contest:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/383408

Freely available: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/3165795#3165795

name: Faust's Wonder Indiana Hoosier Trivia
description:
There are six categories of questions about Indiana. They are History, Sports, Business, Celebrities, Geography, and Potpourri. They are designated by color.

There are six cities that score points. They are Gary, Evansville, Fort Wayne, Jeffersonville, Terre Haute, and Richmond. These cities are placed on the game board with a map of Indiana in the background.

You must land on each of the six cites mentioned above and answer the questions correctly, then race back to Indianapolis to answer a seventh question correctly to win the game.

name: Fridge Roulette
description:
This is one in a series of magnetic games designed to be played on your refrigerator (or file cabinet at work, or any other metallic surface).

Players take turns being the Croupier as well as betting. Instead of a roulette wheel, you have a fridge spinner.

The game may be played face to face, or over the course of time, utilizing a Your turn square. Take your turn, flip the square so that your opponent's color is on top, signifying that it's his turn, then walk away. When your opponent sees that he's up, he can stop, play out his turn, flip the square, and go on about his business.

This feature justifies the magnetic aspect of the game. It can be set up indefinitely and be played out as quickly or as slowly as you desire. This makes it suitable for home or office play when you don't have time to sit down and play an entire game start to finish.

name: Petworld
description:
From the game box:

If you love animals, then you'll love playing Petworld! Move around the gameboard, adopting pets as you go. See how many cute animals you can adopt and call your own! You could adopt a dog or a cat, or even a cow, a snake, or a swan!

Players pay you money when they land on pet spaces that you've adopted! Try not to plan on the Pet Pound space or you'll have to take a trip to the pound. If you land on draw, you take a draw card, which can pay you money, take away a pet or send you to the pound! Players attempt to adopt all the pets of Petworld and the player with the most money at the end of the game wins!

Contents: Gameboard, 50 Draw Cards, Die, 4 Pawns, 14 Pet Pieces, 14 Pairs

name: BrainBox: USA
description:
Children learn better and retain more when they are having fun. So if you can teach with a game, why wouldn't you? BrainBox games will teach your children basic geography facts in a way that makes them eager to play; when have you ever been able to say that about flashcards?

BrainBox games develop both short and long term memory by challenging children to recall what they saw. Players study a game card for 10 seconds trying to memorize a variety of features such as surrounding countries or states, flag colors, famous landmarks, historical figures, and so forth. A die is rolled and if the player can answer the corresponding question, the card is his. Play until one child has won a set amount of cards or play until all cards are acquired. With 55 cards and 10 questions per card, this is a painless way to learn 550 geography facts. Designed for readers, but pre-readers do not have to be left out; just adapt the questions to their level.

Players with the most points win.

name: Knock Out
description: You try to score points by making rows as long as possible. Each player has a paper wheel with the numbers 1 to 8.
