Two different games can be played.

Espresso-Rapido is a two-player game like 'Snap' played with dice. Players get to steal the other player's dice if they spot matching symbols.

Espresso-Grande is a game for up to six players where players get up to three rolls of the dice to try to score the best combination.

name: Monster in My Pocket Monster Clash
description:
Avoid your opponent's glow in the dark rubber balls as you attempt to capture his monsters

The Monster Clash Action Game and Playset (1991 Matchbox) came with 12 Series 1 figures: purple Bigfoot, yellow Kali, red Catoblepas, green Harpy, green Cerberus, red Zombie, purple Chimera, yellow Ghost, purple Mummy, yellow Charon, green Witch, and red Spring-Heeled Jack.

Game includes 12 monsters, 2 castles, 2 volcanoes, 2 spinners, 2 dungeons, 2 launcher / catapults, 1 21" x 30" play board, 2 balls.

The dimensions of the Monster Clash box are 56 cm wide, 39.4 cm tall and 8.2 cm thick.

name: Disney Pixar Cars Supercharged Raceway Game
description:
Race through the world of Cars! It's a race to the finish line with Lightning McQueen, Doc Hudson, Mater and Sally...but be careful of the bumps in the road!

From included Instructions:
Object: move your game piece around the raceway, through roadblocks, switching lanes, and avoiding stop signs. Be the first player to get your Car back to his/her area and win the race.
Let's Play: Youngest player goes first. He must roll a color in order to move a playing piece into play, onto the next space of that color outside his start space. If a player rolls "STOP," he cannot move a playing piece out of his start space.

In essence, the game is a CARS version of CandyLand with one die instead of color cards. There are spaces with special purposes, e.g., "gas station" = roll again. The game is very simplistic and would be perfect for a 3 year old. Game play takes about 5 minutes to complete.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wer war's?
description:
This game contains about 400 cards with famous people. One player reads out bits of information about those people, and the earlier the other players know who he/she is talking about, the more points they get to proceed their pawn toward the goal.
The game mechanics are old; the "designer" basically just added the score track to it.

name: Het Gezelligste Sinterklaas Spel
description: "Het Gezelligste Sinterklaas Spel" is a dutch party game to be played around Sinterklaas (5 december), a Dutch version of Santa Claus. The box contains a rulebook, a die and a set of cards. On each of the cards a task is printed (like singing a song or making as many words using the letters from another word). The die may be used to skip a task. The winner may open a present.

name: Piet Piraat: Het gevaarlijke oerwoud
description: In this game there are four masks (Piet, Berend, Stien and Steven al from the studio 100 TV-show Piet Piraat) each masks has a matching dice. Piet => purple (normal), Berend => white (4's, 5's , 6's), Steven => green (1's, 2's, 3's) and stien => red (1's and 6's). During this game you try to get through the woods to the treasure as fast as possible while having to change frequently from Mask (and dice accordingly).

name: Spin-Jenny
description: On their turn, Spin-Jenny has players spin a top in the center of a round, concave board containing nine holes, each assigned a different colour and value from 0-8. There are nine coloured wooden balls, free to move on the board, which are scattered by the top when it is spun. Points are scored according to the number assigned to a hole in which a ball has been scored. Double the points are awarded if a ball has scored on the hole of the same colour. If all balls score in one spin, a 20 point bonus is added. The winner is the first player to reach a predetermined score.

name: Oh Heilige Nacht
description: Christmas-related trivia game, in which points are scored for correct, but also for creative answers. Categories are determined by a die roll. The game is humorous in nature and not suitable for smaller children.

name: Top Chef Quickfire Challenge
description: The highest-rated food show on cable television serves up a hot new trivia game! Up to six people can play individually or more can form teams and vie for the glory--and the title--of Top Chef. Relive favorite episode moments by answering questions about the contestants, the judges, and the food. What part of the pig does ham come from: the belly, the hind leg, or the back? Which Top Chef judge earned three Michelin stars by the age of 26? Answer correctly and become Top Chef. Answer incorrectly and it’s time to "pack your knives and go!"

name: Findus roliga vinterspel
description: A roll and move game for children. Based on Pettson and Findus (in Swedish: Pettson och Findus), a series of children’s books written and illustrated by the Swedish author Sven Nordqvist. The books feature an old farmer (Pettson) and his cat (Findus) who live in a small farmhouse in the countryside.
publishers: Happy Life animation AB/SF, Kärnan, TV Loonland AG

name: Questions And Answers About Australian Wildlife Card Game
description:
A game for up to 6 players from Steve Parish Publishing, with Questions and Answers about Australian Wildlife.

Five different games can be played - Blue, Red, Green, Yellow, and Purple.

The game has 8 cards in each of 5 categories: Mammals, Birds, Frogs & Reptiles, Insects & Spiders, and Marine Life. The winner is the first player to collect 6 cards in a category.

The cards can also be used to play Go Fish! and Snap! with younger children.

name: Predicting Outcomes: Gypsy Fortune Teller
description:
Move around the board and picking up story cards. Read the story card and if you can answer the subsequent reading comprehension question, you can continue moving.

Winnng consists of visitng the four gypsy fortune tellers areas on the board and then meeting the final gypsy fortune teller chllenge.

name: Limonaadi matkamäng
description:
This game was published in 2004 and never made it to stores. This game was given as gift to the partners of firm Limonaad and to some random lucky people who got it from Limonaad's mascot.
This is a short Estonian discovery game, where the main character is Limonaad's mascot called Limpa. He starts discovering Estonia and things happen with him on the way. For example: Limpa gives fihes too much soda to drink, so they die or Limpa gets abducted by aliens and wakes up in a random place on the game board. This humors game is for children mostly and you win this game by going through all the red spots on the game board first. It doesn't matter in witch order you go them trough, just be first to do so. Sometimes you may need to work together with other players.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: The Southwold Pier Game
description:
Basic roll-and-move game, designed as a souvenir for visitors to Southwold Pier, a 810 foot long, 26 foot wide pier in Southwold, Suffolk, England, originally built in 1900.

The game box is designed so that the board can sit on top to give a visual impression of a pier. The game play is a standrard roll-and move race along the pier and back, including spaces which move the tokens forward or back, cause them to miss turns or to take cards which provide other hazards.

name: Mit Dem Tiger Um Die Welt
description:
Up to 6 animals travel around the world by rolling the die.

Contents:

1 large mounted board with circular track and the 6 populated continents pictured in inset on the sides.
1 6-sided die.
6 animal cardboard cutouts with plastic stands.

Game is language independent, but rules are in German.

name: The Priest Game
description: Players try to fill their card (a different color for each player) with cardboard cutouts representing different items used in the liturgy (the Eucharist, etc.).

name: Operation Game Pen
description: A mini-travel version of Operation, where the game is self-contained inside a large ball-point pen. Unscrew the cap for the tweezers and on the outside is the patient with five organs available to 'tweeze' out without setting off the alarm. Each organ is attached to the pen with monofilament line so they cannot be lost.

name: Bullseye
description:
A quiz game launched in Denmark with the newspaper Ekstra Bladet. The 8 categories was available for 1 category a week.

Categories are music/soccer/sport/politics/crime/headlines/movies and last royal´n´celebreties.

The object of the game is to move from the outer ring into the center of the game (Bullseye). Every time you give an correct answer you move one ring closer. Each category has sub-categories representing each ring.

If you land on a bullseye-bomb you must give an opponent a question, selecting which category and sub-category your opponent gets. If they can´t answer you´ll move one ring closer and if they answer correct they´ll move closer.

A bomb-sign on the question-card means you´ll move away from the center if you fail to answer correctly.

name: The Great British Trivia Challenge
description:
Are you the nation's most knowledgeable quizzer? Are you up to a top trivia challenge? If so, this great game is just for you.

Pit Your wits against the cards to tackle questions on everything from pop to politics. Categories cover culture, history, people and places so there's something for everyone to try. Play in teams for points or quiz with a friend for quick fire-fun. What are you waiting for? Give it a go!

name: Leaves: Earth Operating System
description:
Leaves is a game about life, earth, humanity and the relationship between them.

Players compete, cooperate, or roll the dice to earn green leaves by answering questions about life, earth, humanity and the relationship between them.

When players contribute green leaves to the board, they are rewarded with benefit coins. The player to end the game with the most benefits wins. However, enough green leaves must be place on the game board to sustain the earth and make the individual victory meaningful.

In 2009, Leaves won two Dr. Toy awards, received recognition in the press, and gained entrance into prestigious museum gift shops as well as game stores.

Additionally, its question cards were used at The Youth Energy Summit in Sacramento, and the games were included in two celebrity venues: Earth Day in Hollywood and the Grammy Green Room.

name: Sachsenreise
description: The player travels through Saxony and attempts to reach all destinations. He must fulfill several tasks. There are a lot of information about the places and landscapes. The winner is who has visited all the places and has no more cards.

name: French Roulette
description: This game is played similar to Roulette. It includes a cardboard spinner with the standard black and red betting amounts and a paper playing mat with all of the spaces for placing your bets, using blue cardboard markers. The spinner does not use a ball. Instead there is a black line in the base which shows through a hole punched above each betting mark.

name: Golf
description: Golf From Milton Bradley one of the first Golf Games ever published. No other info on this game is availble. If you know anything about the game please add to this description. I have a picture of the game box but no description of how the game was played

name: Whirlpool
description:
6 blue, red and yellow balls are supplied. The game has a big spinning wheel in the center. Each of the four corners, outside the circle, is called a Bank and each Bank contains five holes in which the balls won in play are placed.

Each player selects a corner Bank. The balls are placed in the corresponding color holes inside the game center. The first player spins the arrow and the others follow in turn clockwise. Each turn consists of 1 spin. If a colored ball is pointed at, and their is room, it is moved to the players Bank. The winner is the first player to win balls in this order 1=red, 2=blue, 3=yellow, 4=red or blue, 5=red or blue (whichever was not won in the 4th position.)

This game also plays another version called Merry-Go-Round. This game plays the same, but does not require the balls to be won in any specific sequence.

name: Argotics
description:
Argotics is a trivia game about French slang ("argot").
Players roll 1 die to know how many questions will be asked, and another (special) one to know which one of the following category those questions will belong to :
- translations
- language culture
- multiple choice questions
- human relations

They then have the duration of a sand timer to answer the questions and gain one bead for each right answer. The first player to get 7 beads win the game.

name: Ett frågespel från SCB
description:
Promotional trivia game from the Swedish bureau of statistics. The game features a simple push your luck mechanic: two teams take turns to answer questions and can stop at 1 point for one correct answer or attempt to gain 3 points by answering two questions in succession.

The pack of cards in the 2009 edition includes around 100 questions related to Swedish statistics in the years 2006-2008, e.g. "How many babies were born in 2007 on the day of that year when the least number of babies were born?" Unlike the typical trivia game, answers are accompanied by additional related trivia or historical comparisons.

Later editions seem to have dropped the rules, leaving the "game" as just a deck of questions, and have fewer notes to accompany the answers.

name: Das Südtirolspiel
description:
You have to travel trough Südtirol (its a province in the north of Italy) and gather money, possessions and figures.
After fixing the duration of the match and then you start your journey trough the land.
To gather money you have to answer correctly to trivia cards about Südtirol or just hit the right field, same for possessions.

Easy to learn, fun to play if you live there.
publishers: Ideen-Werkstatt KG, des Klaus Wagner & Co

name: Fix Mix
description:
A game for quick eyes and fast fingers.
A player roll the 3 special dice (on with colored squares for the frame, one with colored circles for the background and one with symbols for the item) and everyone must quickly combine the results and try to be the first to point the right tile.

Many variants are possible.

Content :
4 boards
3 special dice
29 chips
1 X chip

name: Chronicles of Prince Valiant
description:
A card game based on the Prince Valiant comic strip.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. The game requires a custom deck of approximately 120 cards and a set of coins or poker chips to use as Victory Tokens.

The deck is composed of seven types of cards: Trait, Plot, Location, Woman, Ally, Villain, and Foe. Players are awarded Victory Tokens for playing melds, with larger melds receiving more tokens. The first player to obtain ten Victory Tokens wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Medieval

name: Urbs Romana
description:
"Tile laying game for 2-4 players. Players are constructing a city of the Roman Empire."

The game is played on an 8x8 grid board such as a standard chess board. During the course of the game the players fill the board with tiles representing different structures and resources found in a Roman city.

The players score points based on various factors, including tile type and location. Control markers are used to denote which player played a tile to aid in scoring. The object is to have the most victory points once the board has been filled.

name: The Stock Exchange
description: A stock market manipulation game, in which players move around a board buying, selling and trading stocks. In addition to the usual fluctuation of share values and events (from the 'Bulls' and 'Bears' cards), the game introduces more sophisticated ideas such as buying and calling stock options, margin buying, and cornering the market.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Battle of Camlann
description:
"The last battle of King Arthur, where Arthur was mortally wounded and Mordred was slain. Card game for 2 Players."

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. The game is played using a custom deck of approximately 50 cards. The cards represent individual knights, weapons, magic, troops, events, traits, and mortal wounds.

A series of ten hands are played. The winner is the first player to win three hands in a row, win six of the ten hands, or to kill the opponent's leader.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: Showdown! Battle Royal
description:
Showdown! is a turn based card game. Each player starts with a leader that is out of play and five cards (max hand size). Two cards are drawn each turn and the players may play any number of soldiers and weapons on his/her turn. In order to attack another player's soldier he/she must have an attack card. The attacker chooses both his soldier and the target soldier and may disarm the target with a disarm card. The defender may respond at this point with a disarm if he/she has one. Each player in the fight rolls a die and adds up the bonuses from weapons, upgrades and one shot cards. The highest number wins with ties going to the defender. The loser may play a reroll card on his/her opponent if the player has one. Once three soldiers are in a players soldier discard pile, that players leader is in play and may attack. The leader may only be attacked if the player has no other soldiers out. Be the last one left with a leader in play and win the battle!

This card based battle game that will require both strategy and luck. Get ready to choose a side in this epic fight that will answer the question once and for all. Who's cooler?

This set combines Ninjas, Pirates, Knights and the Undead!

Play your soldiers! Protect your leaders! Equip them with weapons and accessories! Play attack cards on your opponents soldiers in order to clear the way to their leader. Roll the dice and add your bonuses and hope it's more than your opponent. He rolled a 6? Play your card that forces him to reroll! Why not disarm him before attacking next time? Do you have your base card that gives a bonus to all your soldiers? Find the weakest link and kick him while he's down!

Kill all your opponents leaders and be the last one standing to win!
publishers: Paperboy Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Ein Platz für Tiere
description:
This game is mostly about knowledge about animals. There are animal cards with a photo on the front side and the answers to 6 questions ("What's the name?", "Where does it live?", "What does it eat?", ...) on the back. (The questions are the same for all cards.)

Additionally, the game contains one board per continent, with 12 numbered fields. Accordingly, there are 12 animal cards per continent in the game.

The game comes with several game variants that are similar to other quiz games. Most of the variants given in the official rules however are neither very playable nor very balanced. At least the game comes with plenty of material for making up your own rules.

Based on the TV documentation series of the same name with Prof.Dr.Dr.h.c. Bernhard Grzimek.
categories: Animals, Educational, Environmental, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Anatomy Rummy
description:
The players will be able to memorize the names of anatomical structure and their placement in relation to other anatomical structures. In the affective domain, the students will have fun learning what it often considered a difficult subject.

The object of the game is to get two runs of three and four cards representing the sequential (deep to superficial) order of the five main anatomical components composing each suit. The dealer deals seven cards to each player. The remaining cards are placed face down and the top card is turned over to begin the discard stack. Moving clockwise from the dealer, the first player chooses either the discarded card or a card from the face down pile. The player determines which cards to keep and discards the extra card. The first player to create two runs of three and four cards places the cards down and must name three structures (e.g., three bones, three muscles) represented on each card. The other players refer to a reference sheet that indicates all the structures on each card to ascertain whether the player is correct. If the player cannot name at least three structures on each card, the player subtracts 1 point from his or her score for each card on which he or she failed to name three structures. The player with the winning hand adds the value of the cards laid down, subtracts the points for any unnamed structures and adds the total to his or her score. The players with the losing hands add the value of their cards and subtract it from their scores. The game is over when a player reaches a predetermined score. If a time limit is set instead, the winner is the player with the highest score at the end of the period.

Components:
40 cards

name: Talisman Quests: The Rainforest (fan expansion for Talisman)
description:
Talisman Quests: Rainforest is an unofficial expansion that is compatible with both 2nd & 4th edition Talisman and is my largest print & play project completed to date. It was created to address a problem my friends saw with two official cards: The Pool of Wisdom and the Pool of Strength. Whenever these two cards came into play, those with characters closest to the cards benefit greatly letting them to pull away in the game.
This expansion comes into play when either of the cards mentioned above come into play. Players now have to enter the Rainforest board and follow one of several paths to the pools in order to gain its benefits. Now players have to think about the time it takes to do the quest versus staying closer to the Crown of Command.

Talisman Quests includes:

Rule book in PDF format, Two playing board images, One full sized jpeg for large format printing, 9 Letter sized jpegs for home printers, 60 Quest cards to challenger adventurers, 30 Curses cards for those who offend the gods, 2 New Characters and Character Cards (The Conquistador & Cannibal Warrior), 24 New Purchase Cards, 4 Special Cards (Two Large Legend Cards, One Retreat Card, One Gibbering Horror).

Talisman Quests is designed by Scott "Fenris" Davenport and is self-published under Wolf Creek Games. The free files are currently hosted at www.TalismanIsland.com and on the Wolf Creek Games Yahoo Group http://games.groups.yahoo.com/group/WolfCreekGames/
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Bli Borgmästare i Uppsala
description:
This game consists of 3 more or less localized sub games.

The predominant game is economic. The player moves around the board and if possible tries to buy the companies landed on. If another player already owns it, an industrial spy fine must be payed instead.

The second game is a localized trivia game which kicks in at different events. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Third there is a voting process about which player should be the next mayor. The mayor has some advantages and disadvantages in the economic game. Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the player who reaches the target number.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Voting

name: Elementaurs Boot Camp
description:
Players play from a hand of cards which have creatures with attributes that are based on the properties of the elements on the periodic table. Each player is trying to collect the largest army, there is no actual fighting in the base game but this is planed for adding into future expansions.
The top card of the draw pile is turned over, and each player tried to win that card to their army by playing a card from their hand that can match to that card and also using their standard multiplier cards that they can keep and reuse in the game. The winning player, which is determined by the actually chemical reactivity printed on the card, adds wining pair of cards to his army, and the loser takes the card they played back into their hand. The winner then draws back their hand to starting number and reveals the next card off the draw deck to win.
When the entire draw deck is emptied players can attempt to combine cards from their had and if that is possible can then add them to their army. The winner is the player with the largest army.

From the publisher's website:

The ELEMENTAURS were originally created as nanorobots but through a fortuitous accident in a bioreactor these synthesised beings took on a life of their own. They are living beings who have much to offer the human race. They can teach us many things, give us gifts, help us solve problems and defeat our enemies. Neither good nor bad, tame nor wild, they take on some of the personality of the human who releases them.

ELEMENTAURS BOOT CAMP is an exciting new card game with adventures on a subatomic level. In this game you meet the first eighteen of the ELEMENTAURS. You learn which clans they belong to, how they might behave and, most importantly, how to recruit them to your team.

ELEMENTAURS BOOT CAMP may be played at many different levels, depending on the age and ability of the players. From the simplest games through to the challenging COMBAT COMBOS there is something for everyone. And after the games are played, just looking at the cards is an enlightening experience. There is much to be learned and laughed about in the images and text on each of the cards as you decide which is your favourite ELEMENTAUR.

This starter deck is just the beginning as there are 92 ELEMENTAUR creatures to meet. Soon the next series of 18 will be released along with enemy, challenge and rare cards in packs of 10. There is also a series of books that will be published telling about the creation of the ELEMENTAURS and the adventures of a group of children in their quest to release them.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Math
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Trick-taking

name: Das Kleine Gespenst: BMM
description:
Kai Haferkamp's Das Kleine Gespenst won the 2005 Kinderspiel des Jahres, and now the little ghost returns in a smaller, "bring with me" game that maintains the sassy ghost spirit in a new way. The little ghost is hiding somewhere in the box, and the policeman is searching for it, peering into each manhole with a modicum of fear in his heart, waiting to feel the spectre push cold fingers through his forehead and whisk his cerebellum into a frothy pink smoothie.

Ha ha, you believed that? No, the little ghost – should he be under the manhole upon which the policeman stands – will blow off his cap. If you, the player, have been wise enough to be the one who placed the policeman on that manhole, you receive a reward chip. The box is then shaken vigorously in order to spirit the ghost away to some other manhole and await for the policeman's attention there. The first player to blow a cop's hat off five times wins.

name: What Everyone Should Know About THE AMAZING EARTH
description:
From the publisher:
This game will take you to the hottest deserts and the deepest oceans, and even beyond the Moon! Do you know how many bridges cross the Amazon River, or what causes solar eclipses? If you don’t, find out with What everyone should know about the amazing Earth!
On each turn players take one card and try to answer to the question on there! When getting the answer right you get 10 of the money the game uses! Then you have another change to go! Get it right again, you get 20, then 50, then 100 and then you have to give away your turn!
You win the game when collecting amount of money agreed with other players at the beginning of the game! For example you win, when you get 250 that money!

name: Lexico DK-UK
description:
From the publisher:
Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language!

name: Lexico NL-UK
description:
From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

name: The Prisoner of Zenda
description: In this game there is a board on which are illustrated the castle at Zenda and the palace at Streslau and numerous playing tracks representing the roads between them. There are 3 dice, 4 large pieces and 8 small green pieces who are soldiers. The large red piece represents the king who was the Prizoner of Zenda, 2 large yellow pieces represent Rudolph and Colonel Sapt and the large Green piece represents Black Michael. To win the Zenda player has to capture green pieces with his yellow pieces to open a hole in the green line through which his red piece may slip to Streslau and thus win the game. The Streslau player should try and stop all paths leading to his city by blockade at critical points.

name: Dino Duel
description:
Get ready for the battle of the ages when you go head to head in a series of dinosaur duels!

Is your Stegosaurus strong enough to defeat your opponent's Apatosaurus?

Let the fun and the dino duels begin!

The Dino Duel Card Game is one dino-mite game to play! Players lay down their cards in a duel. On the top of the cards is located the point value. If your Stegosaurus card contains more points than your opponent's T-Rex card, then you win that set of cards. The cards feature the Tyrannosaurus Rex, Apatosaurus, Stegosaurus, and wild cards. Any number of combinations can create different outcomes. The player with the most sets wins!

Contains 48 cards (measuring 4 1/2" x 3") and instructions. No reading required to play.

name: Iskelmäkaraoke
description:
From the publisher:
In this game, correct singing is not as important as convincing singing. The goal is to move on its own clubs, local karaoke cruises through every karaoke championship. On the way you present a well-known songs(finnish): "What to do with the special discs", "Sounds like the sea", "Do you know how sick" can you sing them or do you have the soap that is stuck in your throat? Other players are referees, and will have to present themselves convincingly if keep track of your performance sub-standard. The game has been carried out in collaboration with the popular songs in the radio. Words come with the game!
You win by getting right the all songs and by convincing the players about your singing abilties!

name: Meatball Madness
description:
From the manufacturer:

How long will it take for you to get all three meatballs from the cook's pot onto the customer's plate of spaghetti? Meatball Madness is a game of speed and skill! Use the air-powered ladle to float meatballs through the kitchen-themed obstacle course. The three obstacles can be placed as close or as far apart and as high and low as you want. You control the level of difficulty. Don't drop the meatball because you'll need to go back to start! The built-in timer indicates each player's time. The player who is the fastest wins!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: Plop Grabbelpaddenstoel
description: Based on a popular Belgian TV-show, Plop Grabbelpaddenstoel is a game like Bingo. Players try to be the first to complete their scorecard by drawing cards (items) from a cardboard toadstool. The amount of cards you draw is determined by dice-roll. Special cards may let you take another turn or have you clear your scorecard.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Apple Picking
description:
All players pick apples from the trees, hoping to be the one who picks most.
Taking the top basket card from the pack a player picks as many apples as the cards says and places them in whichever basket it says.

name: Birmingham-Opoly
description:
From the Late for the Sky Website:

A board game about the GREAT city of Birmingham! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some Southern hospitality, great food, a little jazz, the arts, and some BIG FUN...and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; BIRMINGHAM-OPOLY!
Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play!

Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Birmingham!
It's Your Roll!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: PODS
description:
PODS is a game for 2 players.
There is not enough place for every Pods in the cavern ... Try to place your own Pods and beware of your opponents feet.

Pods are tiny animals, living in the darkness of unknown caverns. They are made of a head and some feet (bipod have 2 feet, tripod: 3 ... octopod:8). A foot may be small: a foot for walking (controls 1 square forward) or big: a foot for running (controls the aligned squares forward).

Players alternate turns and place their pods in the cavern (a 7x7 grid) but have to deal with the Pods 'way of life': respect your opponent tiny space. So each foot of any pod can never threat a square occupied by an enemy pod. When a player is unable to enter a new pod in the cavern, he loses the game.

In the advanced rules, the pods may move on the board an threat their enemies ... if a pod has no longer a foot able to walk, he dies and is removed from the board. Players then have to enter their 14 pods into the cavern to win.

name: Race to Pooh Corner
description:
User Summary...

Spin and move game with a colorful game board and 3D trees.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Fish Links
description:
From the game box:

Get into the swim with this exciting water game that's fun for the whole family! Players throw their fishing lines into the water and try to catch the colorful sea animals with their fishing rods. For added fun, sea animals also link to each other so you can catch a bunch in one try. The player who catches the most sea animals wins!

Components:
2 fishing rods, 10 assorted sea animals (2 goldfish, 2 sharks, 2 octopus, 2 starfish and 2 lobsters). The animals float to allow for play in or out of water. The sea animals are placed in between the two players.

There are four ways to play:

For younger players - both players try to fish for the sea animals at the same time. They must hook an animal with the fishing rod and bring it out of the water in order to retrieve it. The player who collects the most animals wins.

For older players:

Links - players fish for the sea animals, trying to link as many of them as possible until all have been collected. The player with the most sea animals linked together wins.

Collect-A-Set - players fish, trying to catch one of every type of sea animal. The first player to collect a complete set wins.

High Score - some sea animals are easier to catch than others because they have more arms, legs, tails and fins. Each animal has a different point value: starfish & octopus are worth 5 points; goldfish & shark are worth 10 points; lobster is worth 20 points. The player with the most points when all animals have been collected wins.

name: Interpol Calling
description: From the game cover: Enthralling game of international intrigue, based on the fascinating exciting television series from the 1950's starring Charles Korvin as Paul Duval. Pursuit of criminals by international police throughout many countries of the world.

name: Principality:  A Choir of Angels
description:
Publisher's website:

In Principality, players lead the angelic Hosts of heaven in an exciting and challenging battle against the dark Deceivers and their fiendish minions.

Now, the Choir of Angels expansion set presents a host of all-new heavenly protectors to add to your Principality base set. Introducing Emerald and Pearl Angels and archangels to reinforce the original Blue and Gold host. A Choir of Angels also presents a slippery new Deceiver and its two twisted minions!

Just as in the Principality base set, the angelic hosts of heaven battle demons called deceivers. Players play as team of angels – gold, blue, pearl, and emerald. (the addition of two new color teams of angels expands this game to 4 player) The first player to capture 3 of the 5 Deceiver cards wins the game.

name: The Gates
description:
The Gates is an abstract strategy game for 2 or 4 players. The board features a series of circles connected by color-coded "gate" symbols. Each player has eight plastic tokens; two each of red, yellow, blue, and green. The players maneuver these tokens through patterns of adjacent circles by moving a playing piece through a "gate" of a matching color.

The object of the game is to reach the starting circles of the opponent's playing pieces. Players are allowed to enter circles containing enemy pieces of the same color but can be "trapped" by enemy pieces of a different color.

Four players can enjoy the game by working as teams.

Includes a small 11.5" x 7.5" board, 16 high quality playing pieces, a storage insert, and rules.

name: Składaki
description:
From the back of the box (in Polish):

1320 możliwości ułożenia najdziwniejszych pojazdów!

Zanim zamienisz marzenia o niezwykłych mechanicznych rumakach na konkretny, bardzo ekonomiczny samochód (tak, jak to czynią dorośli), dajemy Ci możliwość pofantazjowania!!!

Dzięki układance zamienisz się w szalonego mechanika, który ma możliwość ułożenia z jej części mnóstwa nowych kombinacji.

Na poszczególnych częściach układanki znajdują się znaki drogowe. Jeżeli na wszystkich trzech częściach będzie taki sam znak, znaczy to, że pojazd taki wymyślił dla Ciebie projektant.

English translation:

1320 possibilities of assembling the strangest vehicle ever!

Before you fulfil your dream of a beautiful, economical car (like adults do) we give you the chance to let your fantasy free.

You can change yourself into a crazy car-designer who has the opportunity to create a new car in a thousand ways!

On the different pieces of this game there are road signs. If on all the three pieces, that you used to create your car, the signs are the same, then this particular vehicle was proposed by the game designers.

Further information:
"Składaki" may be used both as a puzzle and as a game. In the competitive version players take turns in which they may perform one of the following actions:

1) Drawing a piece of a vehicle (they are all turned upside down at the beginning). The piece may be added to the reserve or used to build a vehicle at once.
2) Exchanging two own, unused pieces from the reserve with one chosen piece from the reserve the other player. The chosen piece must share the road sign symbol with one of the pieces previously owned. The acquired piece is placed in the player's reserve who may choose at this point to use it to build a new vehicle with it.

The game ends when all the pieces have been drawn. Both players have a final possibility of building ONE final vehicle and the scoring takes place.

Each vehicle is worth 1 point. If the vehicle is composed of three pieces with the same road sign on them, then such a vehicle is worth 2 points. The player with the most points wins.

name: Gespenster-ABC
description: Collection of games on the subject of letters and the alphabet – the material enables children to name, list and paint the numbers from 1-10 and to intensify their knowledge with several games.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Number, Word Game

name: World's Greatest Trivia Game
description:
More questions in more categories than you can imagine. Four thousand questions, many of which are True/False or Multiple Choice.

Eight fascinating categories: MOVIES, MUSIC, SPORTS, POP CULTURE, TV, LITERATURE, GEOGRAPHY, NATURE. Unique scoring system on the game board keeps track of where each player stands in the race to the finish and it’s always anybody’s game.

Family fun for age 13 and up.

from Barnesandnoble.com

name: De Boer Sjopspel
description:
De Boer Sjopspel is a game where players try to obtain all products listed on a shopping list. They do so by rolling a die to move on the board, trying to get to the items they need. The first person to get all the items and return to the cash register is the winner.

The pawns are in the shape of shopping cards, made from plastic.
The items come in the form of thick cardboard pieces which will be randomly placed on the board. Each card has a picture of the product printed on it.

--user summary
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Television Trivia Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Small enough to go anywhere, Television trivia travels well, whether on a trip, in the car for long drives, or over to a friend's house for hours of trivia fun. There are no complex rules or pieces to keep track of - just open and enjoy!

Categories test your knowledge of five great TV decades from the 1950's to the 1990's.

There is no board or any such pieces, There are 5 questions per card (a question about a show from the 50's, 60's, 70's, 80's, and 90's)
You decide how many points you want to play to before starting the game. A correct answer is worth 1 point.

name: Bed of Pearls
description:
Bed of Pearls is the game that comes with the collectible Octopi named Pearl. The game is vaguely similar to Yahtzee. Players roll dice trying to get good combination. A player can keep rolling until he is happy with the roll or rolls out.

However when you finish your roll and pass the dice. The next player can decide to roll all dice allowing you to score or try and build on your roll.

name: Scrabble People Letter-Matching Board Game
description: From the back of the box: Youngsters will enjoy this exciting race game. Players choose a word card from the 18 colorfully illustrated cards in this game and must match letter cards to complete their word. Everytime they spin the spinner and land on a matching colored space, they receive 1, 2 or 3 letter cards. The player who completes his 3 letter word first must then head to Sir Scrabble's castle and receive the gold key to win the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: British and Foreign Animals
description:
The game is described as 'designed to allure the minds of youth to an acquaintance with the wonders of nature'. The playing surface has 37 playing spaces each with an animal. The game is played with a teetotum marked on eight sides. The animals featured include the otter, armadillo, beaver, sheep, rat, lynx, monkey and fox. The end of the game is marked by the lion. The game comes with a booklet which describes the animals.

Two or three persons may amuse themselves with this agreeable pastime; and if a double set of counters and pyramids are purchased, six persons may play at it.

name: World's Greatest Party Game
description:
Acting, Searching, Drawing, Creating! More ways to have fun at a party than you can shake a stick at!

Incredible Value -- three complete games in one box

Drawing Game: with a twist -- everyone draws (no special skill necessary) amd all players are involved with the game at all times.

Charades Game: has categories with outrageous content leading to great fun for all.

Scavenger Hunt -- game allows everyone to get up and have fun while creating things and finding stuff in and around the house

Back of box.

A die roll determines the nature of the challenge, This collection offers charades, scavenger hunt and an unusual drawing game in which people try to guess what a player is going to choose to draw from a short list of terms.

name: Floating Fortress
description:
Floating Fortress is a Print-n-Play game featuring a navel battle between two players using standard d6 dice. The game is played on a 8x8 board with each player having 2 bases and 14 ships under their control. Each turn a player may move a single ship or use multiple ships to fire on a single target. Ships have to reload their ammunition between shots and are controlled with attack and defense dice that determine their shots power, their movement speed, their firing range and how much life they have remaining. The object of the game is to be the first player to eliminate both of their opponent's bases.

The game requires each player to have their own set of 36 dice with the 2 sets being a different color and it can played on the back of the unfolded rulebook. The rulebook and board fit on a single sheet of printed paper.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Nautical, Print & Play

name: Funny Friends Line
description:
The small players thread the animals one by one according to the order of the cards. Once all animals have been threaded in the correct order and are placed in the middle of the table the game is over and all the players have won.

This game with our Funny friends is convenient for the youngest. Even at two years children are able to follow easy instructions and the game figures are extra big so that the small hand can grasp easily. The clear shapes and colours are especially age oriented.

Contents:
• 6 animals (dog, cat, sheep, horse, cow, pig)
• 6 wooden cards
• 1 string
• 1 lacing stick
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

name: The New Game of Illustrated Proverbs
description:
This game of 63 cards uses proverbs with humorous illustrations as its teaching tool. The idea of the game being to collect the words that make up the proverb.

The Twelve Proverbs are shuffled and dealt out to the players. The player on the left hand of the dealer commences the play by asking any other player for a card of any Proverb of which he holds one or more in his hand. If he obtains it he may continue asking until he asks for a card which the player asked does not hold. The right of asking in then transferred to him and he in the same way continues to ask till in like manner disqualified. When any player has obtained all the cards of a set forming the complete proverb, he turns them up on the table. The player who first completes all the Proverbs of which he holds cards at the commencement of the game, of which any cards remain to him as the game progresses, wins.

name: Muppet Babies: A Color Matching Game
description:
Text from box insert:

MUPPET BABIES - A color matching game for 2 to 4 players

Just imagine being a fairy princess, a super hero, the King of the Sea, or an Olympic star. These are the Muppet Babies fantasies and you can make them all come true by racing around the gameboard, collecting dreams and doing some very clever color matching.

Contents: 1 gameboard, 4 Muppet Baby playing pieces, 8 dream disks, dice cup, 1 die

Object:
Collect your two dream disks and be first to enter your Fantasy Circle
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Das kleine Bücherquiz
description:
Small trivia game about literature; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 nswers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

The graphic design is very similar to Huch & Friends' larger "Welt der Bücher".

(User summary by HilkMAN, with data from WIN407 and the publisher's website)

name: The Pink Panther Chase Game
description:
Pink Panther is a game for 2 to 4 players, in which one player pretends to be the Pink panther and the other players pretend to be either the Inspector, the Commissioner or the Constable. The Pink Panther is chased through the streets of Paris by the Inspector, the Commissioner and the Constable and has to reach the safety of one of his hideaways before he is caught

(from publisher's blurb)
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: ESCANDALOS
description:
Is a game for adults that was concibe in the rumors about facts, peoples and situations publics that wake up the interest of the society in argentina and the world.Is a recopilation of 1080 scandals in 5 themes

1)arts ( literature,music,painting)
2)movies
3)miscelaneas
4)history
5)financiary

es un juego para adultos que no ha sido concebido sobre una memoria académica rigurosa y precisa. Se apoya en el "boca a boca" de situaciones que se hicieron públicas y que despertaron el interés general, sea por las circunstamcias que las rodearon, sea por sus protagonistas, o por lo que sea.
Es una recopilaciónde 1.080 escándalos de los ámbitos: POLITICA-ECONOMIA-DEPORTES-ESPECTACULOS en 5 cuadernillos subdivididos en:

* ARTES (Literatura-pintura-música-etc)
* CINE Y MEDIOS (tv-prensa y radio)
* VARIOS (juegos-deportes-naturaleza-drogas-accidentes-etc)
* POLITICOS E HISTORICOS
* JUDICIALES Y FINANCIEROS

name: United States Lotto
description:
A matching game in which the object is to become the first player to cover all 8 states on the player's board. As the game is played, children learn many interesting and useful facts about each state, such as its shape, neighboring states, capital, nickname, state flower, important products, etc.

(From rules card with game; Milton Bradley, 1958)

name: Pinocchio Game
description:
This is a trick-taking game for four players.

From the back of the box:
Each player is dealt 11 cards and the last 4 cards are laid in the center of the table. The player to the left of the dealer estimates how many tricks he thinks he can take, and the highest bidder may substitute any or all of the 4 cards in the center for his 4 lowest cards. Taking the four lowest cards from his hand he lays them down in front of him as one trick and then leads a card. Each of the other players in turn plays a higher card if possible and the one who plays the card with the highest number takes the trick. The winner then leads a card from his hand. If the highest bidder doesn't get the number of tricks he bid, he will have that amount deducted from his score. All other players get one point for each trick they take. The first player to get 50 points wins the game.

The miniature cards have illustrations on them from Pinocchio. The instructions are written on the back of the box. The cards range in number from 1 to 11 with fewer cards for each number as the number increases:

7 copies of #1 featuring Monstro
6 copies of #2 featuring Lampwick
6 copies of #3 featuring The Coachman
5 copies of #4 featuring Stromboli
5 copies of #5 featuring Fox and Cat
4 copies of #6 featuring Figaro
4 copies of #7 featuring Cleo
4 copies of #8 featuring Jiminy Cricket
4 copies of #9 featuring Geppetto
2 copies of #10 featuring The Blue Fairy
1 copy of #11 featuring Pinocchio

The illustrations are copyright W.D.P. [Walt Disney Pictures]. This is Volume 2 in a series.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Clara
description:
Clara is abstract connection game similar to hex or twixt, but stones are placed (drawing) freely on board.

Similar as in hex or twist, players place stones (draw circle) on board and goal is connect oposite sides of board. Two near (max 2 diameters) stones are connected and connection is draw. Connections cannot be crossed. Stones cannot overlap.

Game can be played as paper and pencil game, but play on computer is far simpler. Length of game is dependent on size of stones (circles).

Version: Stones can overlap, but new stones (circles) are drawn under old circles.

name: Civil War Battlefield
description:
YOU are the general today. YOU command the infantry, send out the cavalry and position the cannon. YOU decide to fight, attack, retreat or defend. Our "battlefield" series offers easy to learn rules and simple strategy for all ages. (From the game insert.)

Players take turns rolling dice and moving their troops around the board. Using railroads or Shenandoah Valley can speed movement of tenacious infantry, mobile cavalry, and defensive cannons around the Eastern theater of war. Once three strategic objectives are achieved players can close in on their opponent's capital. Winning an infantry battle over the enemy capital wins the game.

name: Transformech
description:
ENG:
Transformech is a card game for 2 players. It simulates a fight between two battle robots (Transformechs), which are designed by players and transform the during game, adapting to changing game conditions. The goal is to destroy opponent's T-mech's Central Control Module.

PL:
Transformech jest grą karcianą przeznaczoną dla 2 osób. Symuluje walkę dwóch robotów (Transformechów), które są konstruowane przez graczy, i które przeobrażają się (transformują) w trakcie rozgrywki, dostosowując się do zmieniających się warunków w grze. Celem gry jest zniszczenie Modułu Centralnego Sterowania Transformecha (w skrócie Tmecha) przeciwnika.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Cardgame Solomon
description:
Covers the Solomon campaign in 1942.
The game is a the deck-building type cardgame with 2 players.
It is very different from other Nakamura's game.
Players have their fleet in front and try to attack enemy's by cardplay. Victory is determined by VP calculation.

Issue game of old Game Journal 58.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Giant Globetrotter
description:
The aim of the game is to be the first to travel round the world, following the route specific to your vehicle, of which there are three. There are spaces on the gameboard which have printed instructions (some good, some bad) which must be followed if that space is landed upon. Some spaces allow a player to swap places (and wehicles) with another player.

The game consists of a giant playmat (105 x 78 cm), 3 plastic vehicles and a large die.

(User summary)

name: Politie Verhoor
description:
A trivia game with a police and detective theme.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Strik Vragen
description:
A trivia game.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player.
Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Alias DVD
description:
From the publisher:
Play now super popular Alias Word Explanation game in your living room with Marco Bjurström! The game includes a familiar word explanation of the tasks, but this time there is also an interactive DVD, where the rules of the game are "Marco says", to explain the words, and gymnastics to pull a break to surprise the players in many different ways along the play. Players guess word while doing what Marko tells them do to. Alias DVD represents a completely new gaming club form and is part of every modern home gaming classic!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Team-Based Game

name: Pittsburgh-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Pittsburgh! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some bridges, beautiful scenery, great food, the arts, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; PITTSBURGH-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Pittsburgh! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Brennan's ExBEARdition
description:
Based on part of the Brennan Bear Series games and books.
Brennan's ExBEARdition is designed to help your student's listening skills grow through thinking and discussion. Students will have fun as they practice listening skills in basic concepts, vocabulary, and language.

Players will answer questions, roll the die, and move along the game board to collect 4 different souvenir picture cards- one from each of the Brennan's destinations (Kool Kat's, Tiffany's, Tweet's, and the Milky Way). The first student or team to collect the 4 different souvenir picture cards wins the game.

Each Stimulus card contains questions for the young and advanced. Questions are based on- basic concepts, vocabulary, and language- with 15 listening cards for an All Play activity.

name: Super Scooper: The Ice Cream Collectin' Card Game
description: User Summary: Very simple pattern game in which players must lay out non-matching scoops-of-ice-cream cards above a cone. Players start with four scoops in hand, a spinner determines how many scoops can be played out of the players hand, players draw back up to four, and play passes to the left. The “melt” position on the spinner requires a player to return an already played scoop, and “steal a scoop” cards let players steal scoops from others. The first player to get five non-matching scoops played on their cone wins.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Transcontinental
description: A Warpspawn card game for two players. Theme is the building of the transcontinental railroad in the 1860's; one player is the Union Pacific RR, the other is the Central Pacific.RR. The players draw from a common deck of 80 cards: 7 suites each symbolizing an aspect of railroad building (jobs, money, supplies, etc.), and a "difficulty" suite. Each attempts to make melds of cards in the same suite, or cards of the same rank number, or cards of sequential rank (E.g. "a straight" or "straight flush"), to garner "Railroad Markers." First to get 100 Markers built their line to Promontory Summit first.

name: Möbelrücken, oder: Wie kommt denn der Toaster ins Schlafzimmer?
description:
Möbelrücken, oder: Wie kommt denn der Toaster ins Schlafzimmer? (translation: Furniture Moving, or: How did the toaster get in the bedroom?) was produced by Ravensburger for Ikea, which presumably sold it in their stores at one time.

In the game, players move around a board and collect cards showing items of furniture and accessories (e.g., lamps) which belong in one of four rooms. Having at least three adjacent cards from a single room allows a player to "open" that room, at which point they start moving around a smaller, altered track and have exclusive rights to their room. When someone gets all eight cards for their room the game is over and the winner is the one whose cards are worth the most points.

Additional details include joker cards and the use of a second set of cards to remove furniture from other players' rooms.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
